showerReviews.reviewText: Dirty and disorganised. There are plenty of staff, but only few of them are committed to this place. Badly managed. If changing rooms, toilets, gym etc. are dirty ( looks like not cleaned for days), and at the same time you see plenty of staff hiding behind the reception or talking with friends visiting the gym then for sure there is something wrong with this place. If you are visiting the gym before work and would like to take the shower after the gym, this place is not for you. For sure, there are better managed and clean gyms nearby for less. PureGym is much cleaner and better managed.

showerReviews.reviewText: Awful service before you can even get anywhere. Don't bother ringing the phone number; it's just a pre-recorded message that says they don't take phone calls. Instead, you are just sent a text to an FAQ page, which, surprisingly, doesn't answer my question. The website booking service is clunky for swimming, and you have to start your search again from the beginning if the centre you're looking at doesn't meet your needs. There are no baby swimming classes at weekends, so it's rubbish if you're a working parent who wants to take your child swimming for the first time. (not particularly inclusive)

showerReviews.reviewText:
Firstly reception and all staff are warm, friendly and welcoming, so it‚Äôs not an issue about personnel.
The  main concerns I wish to bring to management attention is the ladies changing rooms toilets which are in need of a fresh coat of paint as the current paint on the walls is very poor and flaking off.

The really serious issue is with the main floor, multi sport lower floor area, which is in dire need of refurbishment, as the hard surface requires clear demarcation lines painted, of each sport that can be played in the main hall. This would be a short term fix. The long term solution would be replacing the entire floor.
showerReviews.author: Maureen Smith

showerReviews.reviewText: Great little 'leisure' centre with good equipment in the gym and decent sized pool. Membership packages are very reasonable and the staff are lovely.  Can get quite busy at times in the fitness areas but more than enough equipment for everyone to get out what they need to from their time in there. Would've given 5 stars if the pool showers weren't so ridiculously hot, stay way from these if you have sensitive skin! Glad I signed up and would recommend to others looking to sign up to a budget gym with all the equipment you need to stay in shape

showerReviews.reviewText:
Some real improvement made especially with the app , decent /good quality gym equipment . Corporate discount so good value which includes use of gym ,pools and classes cannot complain .
However , one major issue is hygiene? You not able to efficiently spray or clean down gym equipment . They have a tiny pump spray but always out or it doesn‚Äôt cover much of the equipment . As a result I picked up a few cold /flu over a couple month period .
What happened to a spray disinfectant bottle ? And cloth change /replace every so often?
From now on I will be bringing my own spray and  detol wipes . The cleaning is is half done ,never seen anyone clean down the machines in terms of staff a lot of dust buildup  on window ledges .lorraine the lady before from Years back  would regularly clean down the whole machines routinely , now each machine all you see is sweat drips marks all down them and all you have in blue roll and little bit of pump spray which doesn‚Äôt allow you to clean down properly even if you want to.
showerReviews.author: Z Powell

showerReviews.reviewText:
Outstanding Service from Carol at the Help Desk!

I‚Äôve been to Djanogly Leisure Centre numerous times trying to sort out issues with my account and my sons‚Äô memberships, but unfortunately, on previous visits, I have just been brushed off without any real help- either due to lack of knowledge or simply couldn't be bothered to do their job properly.

That all changed when I was helped by Carol at the help desk today.

I‚Äôd been unable to link my sons' membership cards to the app or book my younger son‚Äôs swimming sessions via the app/ online. Carol not only got that fixed, but she also activated his membership, sorted out my older son‚Äôs membership, and linked everything to my account so I can now manage it all easily.

Even though it was a hot Friday evening and a queue was forming behind me, Carol remained calm, warm, friendly, and professional. She took her time to make sure everything was done properly.

After months of frustration, Carol sorted it all out in less than 10 minutes. She‚Äôs a credit to the centre and deserves to be recognised for her exceptional service. Many of the others can learn key customer service skills from Carol.
showerReviews.author: Samina Qayum

showerReviews.reviewText:
Disgusting, ashamed and regretful that I have a member ship here. Privacy is 0, there's a missing door in the shower room that's fully exposing you and it's hasn't been replaced. God knows where it is. Broken tile on the floor which is a safety hazard and it still hasn't been fixed, it's been over a month. When taking a shower you HAVE to hold the button, it won't flow out for a couple of seconds. How are we meant to shower properly if as soon as we let go on the button, it stops. Absolutely ridiculous. The Changing rooms started to smell horrible recently. All the blow dryers literally don't work and you guys ain't doing anything! Are we meant to walk out in the cold with our hair wet?

A nice thing to at least do is a ladies gym session above. Some women would like to go to the gym here however they aren't comfortable with men around. I think this would be a great session.
showerReviews.author: Sitara Hussaini

showerReviews.reviewText:
I really like this place. I used to regularly attend the gym and spin classes, which were great, but these days I mostly use the swimming pool. The facilities are generally clean and well-maintained, and it‚Äôs a good environment for both exercise and relaxation.

One area that could be improved is the swimming lessons for kids. My son has done Stage 1 three times and Stage 2 three times as well. This wasn‚Äôt necessarily due to his progress, but more because of frequent changes ‚Äì either the swimming teacher changed, or we had to switch the day or time. As a result, it felt like we weren‚Äôt moving forward as we should have.

That said, the swimming coaches themselves are excellent. They‚Äôre dedicated, friendly, and genuinely try their best to work with each child. It‚Äôs just a shame that the inconsistency in the structure or scheduling of the lessons can impact a child‚Äôs progress.

Overall, it‚Äôs still a very good centre with plenty to offer. I enjoy using the pool regularly and would recommend it for general fitness and family swimming. A bit more consistency in the kids‚Äô lessons would make it even better.
showerReviews.author: Monika awx

I really like this place. I used to regularly attend the gym and spin classes, which were great, but these days I mostly use the swimming pool. The facilities are generally clean and well-maintained, and it‚Äôs a good environment for both exercise and relaxation.

One area that could be improved is the swimming lessons for kids. My son has done Stage 1 three times and Stage 2 three times as well. This wasn‚Äôt necessarily due to his progress, but more because of frequent changes ‚Äì either the swimming teacher changed, or we had to switch the day or time. As a result, it felt like we weren‚Äôt moving forward as we should have.

That said, the swimming coaches themselves are excellent. They‚Äôre dedicated, friendly, and genuinely try their best to work with each child. It‚Äôs just a shame that the inconsistency in the structure or scheduling of the lessons can impact a child‚Äôs progress.

Overall, it‚Äôs still a very good centre with plenty to offer. I enjoy using the pool regularly and would recommend it for general fitness and family swimming. A bit more consistency in the kids‚Äô lessons would make it even better.
showerReviews.author: Monika awx

locations.title: Rushcliffe Arena
locations.address: ÓÉàRushcliffe Arena, Rugby Rd, West Bridgford, Nottingham NG2 7HY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Avoid if your child actually needs swimming coaching!

Took my daughter to swimming classes when she was 2-3 years old. For such high demand at this place i was extremely disappointed. A lot of the lessons were focused on nursery rhymes and repetitive circuits. I don‚Äôt have a problem with that with too much but when certain children are clearly struggling there is absolutely NO support or focus given to the child.

My daughter was struggling when she advanced to 3 year olds class and she was clearly struggling with confidence and even got yelled at by one of the swimming instructors. It set her back months and I only realised how bad this place was when I eventually left and went to a local swimming centre with instructors who are actually in the water with them instead of standing outside the pool singing nursery ryhmes.

The experience in rushcliffe set my daughter back months! Save your money and go to a local place that actually cares!
showerReviews.author: The Hussain‚Äôs Star

showerReviews.reviewText: Swimming Lessons - they are ok. Unless you have a teacher who is off quite often for whatever reason. Then you get stand ins who do not or can not affect your child's progress to the next level. They simply don't update it. And when you have had 5-6or7 occasions (weeks) where the teacher isn't there because they went back to Uni and getting a replacement takes a while and just when things seem settled, the new teacher isn't there again! Not good for the bank balance or the way your child feels because they are not getting anywhere! This change and delay in teachers is also not communicated to you unless you question it at the front desk- because the teachers don't get time! and that's if you know in the first place who is teaching your child!

Hygiene is a serious issue here. The group class equipment is stained and sticky with dirt and sweat, and everyone wears their shoes in the changing rooms so there‚Äôs dirty water along the pathways.

In my previous council run gym the session leader would ask everyone to clean their equipment after use, and everyone did. That doesn‚Äôt require extra cleaning resource and spend, so there‚Äôs no excuse not to do it. There wasn‚Äôt even cleaning equipment available in Studio 2 today, even if I‚Äôd wanted to scrub the black off the weights before I used them.

Based on the other reviews you‚Äôre losing customers because of this. I‚Äôm trying to find a new gym, but it‚Äôs not going to be this one.

locations.address: ÓÉàSouthchurch Dr, Clifton, Nottingham NG11 8AB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fisrtly i would like to say, there are some really nice people who attend rhe gym.

My concerns-

Showers are not cleaned and have funger marks all over the shower where you press for it to turn on. They are also quite cold.
Underneath the showers you can see mould, and all around the flooring part in the shower
Some customers feel it us okay to spit and blow their nose in the shower when washing, as well as shaving. This is not nice and very unhygenic. Please use tissue to blow your nose and shave at home!!

Sauna, steam room and salt room. The glass really should be cleaned daily, in and outside. The finger marks and dirt on the glass is quite off putting. Also door handles please. Reduce the spread of germs.

Cubicles. Please shut the cubicle door when inside and you will see a build up of grime on each door. All doors could do with a weekly clean, to reduce the build up of grime. Door handles could do with being washed daily to reduce risk to health.

Floor. There are many areas in the health suite which shows thick black spots of grime. Health risk. Please can this be mopped daily, twice a day maybe, but ensuring the mop is used in corners, next to leg stands, cublicle stands and und the mirror cabinet.

Toilets. To be honest i try not to use them. Each time i have, there is a build up of water on the floor, urine smell and has had hair from someone shaving in the sink.

I am sorry that i have had to write this review, but numerous customers are complaining each time ivisit, along with myself. The atmosphere is great, but their are concerns to peoples health and  should be priority, especially for those customers with weekened immune systems, which puts them at higher risk of health complications.
showerReviews.author: clair crofts

showerReviews.reviewText:
Visited for the first time today. Usually use Harvey Hadden, Ken Martin or Victoria baths, but the only swimming session listed as available and not fully booked was Clifton so I thought we would give it a go as it said swimming session with flume. The swimming pool was however closed and only the "Leisure pool" was open with the flume which is the baby pool for lack of a better description. You can imagine my teens face when she realised! This should be clearer when booking as no Adult or over 8 year old can swim here. We made the best of it though which is the only reason for the 3 stars.

The staff I'm sorry to say are miserable as sin.
Saw at least 5 staff members not one smiling or welcoming.
Very odd atmosphere where they almost make you feel unwelcome due to how miserable they are.
Being the Mum of a competitive swimmer I'm very regularly at Noytinghams Leisure centres and this is worlds apart from the atmosphere and staff at other centres. Not a happy work force or welcoming environment to say the least.

I dobt like leavibg bad reviews but this place warranted it. I wouldn't recommend or visit again.
showerReviews.author: Abi Bradley

locations.title: Carlton Forum Leisure Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàConingswath Rd, Carlton, Nottingham NG4 3SH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I love this place. The staff and facilities are second to none, however there are some issues, if improved could make it even better!
Swimming - only one lane that caters for the doggie paddler all the way up to Michael Phelps, which is extremely frustrating for all. I have stopped going as toes and arms are going everywhere and makes a decent swim a challenge due to start/ stop a lot of the time. The gym is where I really do believe there is an accident waiting to happen. Although you have gym etiquette signs displayed throughout the gym it is blatantly obvious that these are completely ignored by many. Some members think that when they are in there, it's their gym.  I've seen members walking around the gym with no trainers (constantly), wearing training bottoms that are that long, it's beyond belief how they have not fallen over and hurt their self ( there is a lot of nasty equipment in there to inadvertently headbutt). My favourite is where you see someone on a running machine, they then leave it going at a good old speed, then go on to another bit of equipment, to then hop back on the running machine whilst it's in mid flow ( i shudder to think what would happen if someone didn't realise it was going and tried to hop on). Another good one I've seen is someone using the step machine whilst using weights (thats and accident waiting to happen). Last point is the younger members, some must be 16 at best. I see some of them training, and it makes me look away, as some of them are trying to lift weights that must be nearly touching their body weight. I asked one of the staff the other day if it was OK to leave your kit over the floor for someone to potentially fall over (which will happen), and he didn't know? If a member of staff us manning the desk in the gym surely he needs the information on what he should be monitoring? , gym rules? Etc..
I'm not usually one for moaning about a gym, I like to turn up, get my training done, and get home. That said, I do believe in gym etiquette, respect for others using the facilities,
and most importantly Health and safety. There is a big accident waiting to happen if some matters are not addressed soonest.
showerReviews.author: JD

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚Äôve been a DNA member for some time now, and my daughter regularly attends swimming lessons at the centre. I want to start by highlighting the fantastic instructors ‚Äî Paul, Norah, Martin, and Noah on the kids' swimming side ‚Äî who are all incredibly professional, patient, and engaging. Their dedication really makes a difference in the learning experience.

However, I do feel the facilities leave much to be desired. The state of the female changing rooms is frankly appalling and not up to the standard one would expect from a centre of this size and reputation. It‚Äôs disappointing to see such neglect in an area that‚Äôs essential for comfort and hygiene.

Additionally, the new policy around class cancellations feels far too rigid, especially considering how frequently classes are overcrowded. Flexibility is important for members who are trying to balance busy schedules, and this policy doesn‚Äôt reflect that.

Lastly, while staff interactions in person have generally been fine, my experience over the phone has been frustrating. I called twice this week with queries and felt fobbed off both times. It‚Äôs not the level of service I‚Äôd expect, and it‚Äôs something that definitely needs improvement.
showerReviews.author: Caroline Nobili

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚Äôve been a DNA member for some time now, and my daughter regularly attends swimming lessons at the centre. I want to start by highlighting the fantastic instructors ‚Äî Paul, Norah, Martin, and Noah on the kids' swimming side ‚Äî who are all incredibly professional, patient, and engaging. Their dedication really makes a difference in the learning experience.

However, I do feel the facilities leave much to be desired. The state of the female changing rooms is frankly appalling and not up to the standard one would expect from a centre of this size and reputation. It‚Äôs disappointing to see such neglect in an area that‚Äôs essential for comfort and hygiene.

Additionally, the new policy around class cancellations feels far too rigid, especially considering how frequently classes are overcrowded. Flexibility is important for members who are trying to balance busy schedules, and this policy doesn‚Äôt reflect that.

Lastly, while staff interactions in person have generally been fine, my experience over the phone has been frustrating. I called twice this week with queries and felt fobbed off both times. It‚Äôs not the level of service I‚Äôd expect, and it‚Äôs something that definitely needs improvement.
showerReviews.author: Caroline Nobili

showerReviews.reviewText: Whilst it's nice and clean and majority staff are absolutely amazing, the timetables are designed for stay at home moms, unemployed or retired people. If you are full time employed and want to use classes AND swimming pool it's not going to be easy to pair that. Public swimming times are ridiculous,  it's either 6.30 am or 9pm if you work during the day. Besides they close one lane on public swimming times, so 30+ people are splashing in a small space while a whole lane is open for a tiny 4year old. Classes are great though,  sauna and steam room just the right temperature and always clean.
showerReviews.author: Viktorija Solima

showerReviews.reviewText: So starting on a positive most of the staff are polite and lovely. Lorraine and her classes are amazing! I enjoy swimming some mornings its a battle to swim as it can get really busy tho. Now for a few negatives ‚Ä¶.. so having booked for hip hop step this week, having confirmation on the app and reminding me i must cancel 2 hours before if i can not make it . I am informed by my class mates that group is cancelled do i get a call or a notification? No which is poor service. Then to tonight and water aerobics now with Lorraine being away ive not been to any classes as when I did book one it got cancelled on the morning so I gave it a go this evening and we get in the pool after five past and I told that the instructor is coming turns out the instructor is double booked and the class is taken by Tyler , now Tyler was absolutely fantastic. He improvise last minute and with the music Tyler was an absolute saviour to the day and kind of restored my faith in the place a little bit but it is still poor for that instructors to double book or customers to not be informed when classes are cancelled I understand things can happen at the last minute but the reason for this class being cancelled yesterday was not a last-minute thing, and no effort was made to tell us. So to recap the Positive stuff most of the staff friendly , Lorraine is Awesome and Tyler is a awesome !

showerReviews.reviewText: Just been swimming this morning for social distance swim, the place was very organised one-way system. You wait outside before your bookes time slot. They also take your temperature on the way in. Book your place online by the website again really simple to do. You don't put your stuff in a locker, they have a designated bag drop on the poolside. To ensure the changing rooms are cleaned after every use they have a red and green sticker policy on the outside of the doors, you only use the green ones and then there's a piece of velcro on the sticker you turn it ovee when youve finished in the changing room then they know to clean that cubicle for the next person and no use of showers e.t.c. at the moment and you exits into the car park but I would definitely recommend going.

showerReviews.reviewText:
An good gym. I visited on a Saturday afternoon, and it wasn‚Äôt too busy.
The free weights are ok, not the best.
The cardio machines and other equipment were  modern and of a good standard.

A beautiful steam room, sauna and spa are.
Lacking in showers (only 2) which got blocked twice and horrid scummy water just floated around until someone came to unplug the drains. Ruins an otherwise excellent experience.

The changing facilities and lockers were too small.
Only accommodates 4 adults changing at anyone time, else you‚Äôre left waiting for space.

A poor design overall, where there is 3 separate small changing area for this gym.

Suggestion: Why not create one large spacious clean changing area with good sized lockers?
showerReviews.author: Al Casa

showerReviews.reviewText: Genuinely an amazing leisure centre, hassle free swimming lessons for kids, i cant believe how my daughter had her first swimming class and didnt know how to swim at 5 years old, we tried as parents to teach her how to swim and she was always so nervous and afraid, in her first swimming session with HENRY she swam on her back! I couldn‚Äôt believe how he managed to get a very anxious little girl from swimming to get all that confident to swim unaided on the same session, she had another session the following week and swam again on her back unaided. He‚Äôs attentive and gives every child their focused time. My daughter was struggling with her goggles he even picked up on that and took them off and gave them a wipe and carried on. After her first session he came over to have a chat and gave lara the biggest words of encouragement for learning how to swim so quick. She came back home and would not stop talking about her achievements and couldn‚Äôt wait to come back. I would honestly recommend this swimming center for any parents, no frills, you‚Äôre in and out quickly, they learn so much in a short space of time, i hope this gets passed on to henry, he deserves some sort of recognition for being an incredible teacher, i‚Äôve seen swim coaches in the past whilst i‚Äôve been swimming myself and yet to see someone with that level of attentiveness, assertiveness that children need to focus on their swimming and encouragement they need to thrive in. Thank you for teaching my daughter how to swim on her back in the shortest time and getting her our of her shell!
showerReviews.author: Nura A

locations.title: The Gym Group Nottingham City
locations.address: ÓÉà14 Trinity Sq, Nottingham NG1 4AF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Good

It‚Äôs a good commercial gym with everything you need. There are five squat racks, two Smith machines, and four bench presses. There‚Äôs plenty of free weights and a good number of treadmills.

The Bad

The major downside is that some members lack basic respect, manners, and gym etiquette. Weight plates and dumbbells are often abandoned and left scattered across the floor. This means you have to search around to find what you need. EZ-curl bars are frequently left loaded on the ground, and the same goes for plate-loaded machines weights are rarely removed or put back properly.

The Ugly

The toilet area can be in a terrible state. Some members leave dirty tissues on the floor, and others shave in the showers without cleaning up afterwards. The showers don‚Äôt seem to be cleaned daily, as the same mess is often left from the previous day.

Overall, it's a well-equipped gym with plenty of racks, machines, and free weights, but poor member etiquette significantly detracts from the experience.
showerReviews.author: Matt

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great building. Generally lovely staff.
Very poor experience this evening. Given several warnings the sauna, steamroom, pool, changing facilities and gym floor were all closing at 9:45. Since when has the gym floor been included in this list? Google (& our contracts that we signed) state the closing time as 10pm. When I complained face to face it was explained that this was to give people time to leave the gym. Not acceptable. While I get closing the pool, sauna and steamroom 15 minutes early, the gym and shower should not. We have been members for over 20 years way back then, staff were kept on 15 minutes to do any tidying up after closing. Why can this not be done now? You invest in new equipment but not in people to maintain it.
My membership has gone up to cover the refurbishment and since the standards have slipped in all areas.
The cleanliness is horrific; I was told the cleaning is now outsourced and you have experienced problems. This is not acceptable. Deep cleaning should be done out of opening hours. I visit the gym first thing in the mornings too and the showers are filthy (grime, bits of fluff and body hair clearly not washed away).
While some of the new equipment is good, some has not been properly designed so for example, some pulleys often render other equipment useless. Some of the benches also have loose screws.
This topped off by a significant increase in student members who do not know how to put equipment away leads to the gym floor being left untidy for staff members who are lifeguards having to put things away. Perhaps members should be reminded to look after the equipment and put it back when they have finished? After all a life guard‚Äôs job is to life guard. It is not to grumpily tell members to leave the gym floor before the advertised closing time.
showerReviews.author: Troy Jenkinson

This topped off by a significant increase in student members who do not know how to put equipment away leads to the gym floor being left untidy for staff members who are lifeguards having to put things away. Perhaps members should be reminded to look after the equipment and put it back when they have finished? After all a life guard‚Äôs job is to life guard. It is not to grumpily tell members to leave the gym floor before the advertised closing time.
showerReviews.author: Troy Jenkinson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Decent place to work out. Has variety of machines and plenty of free weights.

Has a good selection of leg machines, definetely more than the colwick pure gym. Has a spin/cycling area I noticed. Machines seem to be maintained to a good standard.

On the down side, feels a bit claustrophobic, closed off and generally less looked after and alive than some other pure gyms like colwick. But not much can be done due to no windows, except lighting adjusted and atmosphere or layout changed.

The male changing rooms are decent. Why is there tons of locks left on lockers? More than there are people in the gym, make it a rule to periodically cut them off and bin them.

Another nice touch would be a hard floor or two for deadlifts and squats rather than soft rubber flooring.
showerReviews.author: Klaudijus Miseckas

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been to lots of pure gyms over the years and this had to be the one with the poorest experience overall

Cleanliness is a huge issue in both toilets/showers and on the gym floor - the toilets/sinks constantly smell of drains - even after nearly 3 weeks of work earlier this year.

The rules which are clearly displayed are not enforced - staff wearing Crocs/sliders - gym goers being barefoot ect.

The gym is over crowded with equipment- you advertise ‚Äònew equipment‚Äô however my experience is that it‚Äôs made the gym worse.
The small stretch area has been ruined by numerous bits of equipment - meaning there is nowhere to stretch or use the small 1-10kg weights safely at peak times.
You are alienating a large audience by limiting what space is available here.

The gym is in a prime location and could be very good but the cleanliness and layout need to be looked at - also members need to be held to account for the rules by staff/ managers
showerReviews.author: Bryony Lister

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very clean, great new equipment, nice showers, loos. I liked the defribulator safety unit, the duty gym managers place overseeing things. Vibrant atmosphere and busy. Why wouldn't it be at prices starting ¬£30 at month, great value. My only gripe is parking shared with shopper's going to nearby Aldi and a 2 hour limit, but apparently the gym have a way to extend that, not going to tell me when just visiting. The extra benefit, kill two birds with one stone with shopping after at a big Lidl and an Aldi about to open, plus a donut shop and chip shop/ restaurant,  so you  can quickly restore all those calories you just burnt off!

Lol
showerReviews.author: James Russell

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
Recently has gone 24/7, which is a welcome and long promised update.

Parking. Private parking is always trying to screw you over. Always look for and read the signs. It‚Äôs always (up to time of writing) been free for 2 hours between 6am-10pm and 10 mins outside of that.

If you‚Äôre staying longer you MUST enter your Reg number.

Gym is well equipped, reasonably well laid out and PureGym is well priced and reflective of what you get.

WiFi is the O2 one and needs a mobile number to verify.

Showers have a real funk to them. Likely need a plumber to properly fix or how it traps or moves on body hair. Perfectly serviceable 20sec push button ones with fixed head/temp.

Do I miss the ones at David Lloyd? Yes. Do I miss the dent in my bank account? No.

Changing rooms themselves are clean, but a bit small and easily get too busy/cramped.

Getting an RFID dongle for the barriers makes life easier, especially when attached to car keys (only way I get there so never forgotten).

Never interacted with the staff. Never had the need, which I‚Äôm perfectly happy with. You need and mileage will vary.

Feel this one is either safer or less targeted than Castle Marina, tried there once to find my locker padlock had been ‚Äòtried‚Äô. And no, you don‚Äôt mistake the only bright yellow padlock for your own. This was Saturday day time.

Suppose Wilford/Compton Acres is a nicer area‚Ä¶

Really wish they had 7kW EV charging on site (Aldi‚Äôs over the road don‚Äôt count/work and BP Pulse are too fast) to top up while working out.

And if their SM guys read this. Put an individual QR on each piece of equipment, that you can scan on the PureGym app to learn how to use or report broken. Will mean quicker reports (verified by staff on site) and visibility as to how long it takes to fix.

No one thinks machines won‚Äôt break, but seeing you fix them quickly is the key.

Think that‚Äôll do.
showerReviews.author: Mark Owen

locations.title: WholeHealth Open Water Swim Village & Sauna
locations.address: ÓÉàRacecourse Rd, Nottingham NG2 4DW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I love this lake and the people that run it! I used to avoid cold water at all costs, so getting in the lake was a really big deal for me. I'd seen people using it and chatted to them a few times, they talked so enthusiastically about how the water made them feel and the wildlife they'd seen and I could feel the sense of community around the lake. So glad I took the plunge. It has been one of the best things I have done in recent years. Having managed one winter in my swimming costume, getting in the water with ice on top, I really feel like I am capable of so much more in all aspects of my life. Thank you Cat and Wales for everything you do. Naomi.
showerReviews.author: Naomi Tipping

showerReviews.reviewText:
Brilliant open water swim spot! I was warmly welcomed by the owner and local swimmers, and everything is really well organised ‚Äî clear buoyed course, canoeists on the water, and a lifeguard keeping watch. The lake (or pond, but it feels like a lake!) was a lovely 19 degrees, much warmer than my usual Irish Sea swims, and it was amazing to be surrounded by nature and even dragonflies while swimming.

Great atmosphere, very safe, and even a super cute dog to greet you. Absolutely loved it ‚Äî huge credit to the owners. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre in Nottingham.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely facilities and vibrant Starbucks coffee shop near the entrance.

Great swimming pool with clean facilities.

But Parking...... Argh!

********Nightmare********

Go online before you visit and check if they have any events on.

If they do plan extra time for your travel, as you will likely have a long walk from your car and it will cost you over ¬£7 to pay and display.

They are hoping to expand the car parking onto the 'Slab' at the front. If they get the go ahead it may be available around June 2025.

Star docked for parking issues.

If you want a relaxed atmosphere with a team who are striving to improve the facilities, then Spring Lakes is the place for you.
The team are friendly and welcoming. The food and drinks are great and the swim and swimmers? Fabulous!
Amazing wildlife and scenery too!

locations.title: YMCA Camp Williams
locations.address: ÓÉàThe Becket School, Wilford Ln, West Bridgford, Nottingham NG2 7QY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: If you are putting your kids into Camp William for a whole week it looks brilliant. They get to choose from a wide range of great activities. If you put them in for less than a week they get no choice, and seem to be treated as second class citizens. The site chooses an activity for all of those kids only there for a few days which they do every day they attend each week. Ours got drama which neither would have chosen. And they know they will be stuck doing that for the rest of the days that week. In the afternoon they did swimming which consisted of one length following by a free for all of kids and floats, very little structure and no chance to really swim as pool was so full. In between they did indoor games which seemed ok, but the whole thing is made worse by them being able to see the kids who are there all week rock climbing, bike riding, scootering, skate boarding  and all sorts outside while they seem to be killing time or doing stuff they didn't choose. The website and brochure is full of pics of great activities and the kids were really looking forward to it. we mentioned it to the staff onsite who said, "yes we know it isn't great and we've fed this back before to the marketing staff because we think its misleading and it shouldn't be advertised in this way"
showerReviews.author: Paul Yeomans

locations.title: YMCA Gym
locations.address: ÓÉàYMCA Gym, 4 Shakespeare St, Nottingham NG1 4FG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
If I could give this establishment a black hole instead of one star I would do.

I have never known such shambolic organisation and blame shifting in my life.
Like many others I joined full of optimism, fitter and leaner.....yup that sounded good to me.

Warning bells should have sounded when the girl on reception entered my details and nearly double charged me, thankfully I was keeping a close watch and prevented this. No receipt was given as apparently the YMCA computer is incapable of printing off receipts.

Ignoring the dubious state of the changing rooms, lockers that did not accept the YMCA locker token, and the tepid shower pressure I decided to close my eyes to the warning signs and stick with it.

I booked three times for an induction session to design my leaner and fitter programme. Three times I booked this at the reception and three times I turned up to be told there was no record of my booking or the computer was down.

No one had the commonsense to write down on paper (yes...pen and paper that old fashioned notion) the bookings for the day.
It is obvious that no one on the YMCA staff have the most basic notion of customer care, no empathy, no one suggested an alternative. I was met with a wall of, 'I didn't make the booking, I can't help you.'
Or....just talk over the customer and pretend that nothing is the fault of the YMCA.

The final kicker was having to pay two months fee before I am free of this bunch of amateurs, I was never told this when I joined...surprise surprise...

The reception seems to be staffed by series of young ladies, more chance of seeing a Beatles reunion than the elusive manager appearing. When I closed my membershp in person I was told that there were no managers on the premises.

So what happens in the event of an accident, incident, or injury?
No management on the premises (04/07 to be precise), how can the management be so incompentent?

I feel sorry for those YMCA staff who genuinely care as it's obvious the management doesn't.
Still....keep paying those membership fees as that's all the YMCA care about, certianly not the customer.
showerReviews.author: Nugget McGraw

locations.title: Saunahood
locations.address: ÓÉàThe Campsite, The National Watersports Centre, Adbolton Ln, Nottingham NG2 5AX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I've been having saunas for years but started visiting outdoor sauna in the last year or two. On my travels I search the internet to see if there is one nearby. Luckily I found Saunahood . A very good set up with a beautiful log fired horsebox type sauna. Then out of the sauna for a quick cold shower before laying in one of the two cold water baths. Pure brilliant relaxation for an hour. The host/owner was very helpful & knowledgeable about the sauna experience. I will be definitely going again when I'm back in the area

locations.title: Nuffield Health Nottingham Fitness & Wellbeing Gym
locations.address: ÓÉàPlains Road, Mapperley, Nottingham NG3 5RH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A great gym with swimming pool, sauna and stream room facilities.
As with any decent gym it can get busy during peak times, likewise for the swimming pool.
The staff are great, very friendly and helpful,  and help contribute to the community feel that this gym has amongst it's members.
There is a wide variety of equipment on the gym floor, a spin studio which has recently had a refurbishment with new bikes, and if you're looking to do a class or two, this is where this gym excels.
Becky, the studio manager has carefully crafted a class timetable to give a wide variety of classes throughout the day and evening. Catering for Les Mills enthusiasts, yoga lovers, spinners and more. There is something for everyone. Don't be put off if you are new, the instructors are awesome and will offer low intensity options where they can.
showerReviews.author: H

locations.title: PureGym Nottingham Beeston
locations.address: ÓÉàThe Square Shopping Centre, Beeston, Nottingham NG9 2JG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member at PureGym Beeston Nottingham since June 2023, enjoying the gym's friendly environment and solid equipment range. While the functional training section could benefit from some enhancements, the availability of gear like resistance bands could be more consistent.

The gym is clean overall, but the facilities could use more regular maintenance, and the showers definitely need hotter water. Additionally, it's important to note that some gym-goers don't re-rack weights or return equipment after taking selfies. While it's great to see members documenting their fitness journeys, maintaining tidiness by putting equipment back is a courtesy that shouldn't be overlooked.

The staff is approachable and generally helpful.

Overall, PureGym Beeston Nottingham is a reliable spot for daily exercise, and I continue to recommend it, even with room for certain improvements.
showerReviews.author: Warren R.M. Stuart

Terrible services.
As a truck driver I visit a lot of services.
The showers had no room for personal belongings such as towel and dry clothing. I could hang them in a publicity accessible area but then they could be stolen without my knowledge (the cubicle has hooks however due to the fixed shower head everything would have gotten wet). The showers themselves were only slightly dirty which is pretty good.
The staff at the Smiths to direct me to the showers were average, I waited only several minutes for their attention but they were also working so fair enough.

I then fuelled up. What an absolute mess! They have staff manning both the Greggs and the fuel pumps at the same time during rush hour!
I waited 13 minutes just to hand my fuel card in so I was able to start pumping. Fortunately nobody was ordering food when I went to actually pay. Absolutely stupid system. They need a dedicated fuel station staff member instead of 3 people dealing with Gregg's.
showerReviews.author: Matthew West

locations.title: Tesco Extra
locations.address: ÓÉàService Station, Top Valley Way, Nottingham NG5 9DD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I like Top Valley Tesco because it‚Äôs so big and always quite well kept and reasonably well stocked. There are the odd things you can‚Äôt get (an example for me is Perfect Ted drinks) which is a shame considering the size of the store.

We drove from Colwick to Top Valley today for the Christmas market and was rather disappointed.

It wasn‚Äôt at all like what I‚Äôve seen promoted online by members of the public. Someone offered me a tea and I was shocked that all I got was a shot glass worth considering tea is 90% hot water anyway. The lady on the Teapigs stand was very lovely though, and clearly doing her job well.
The lady on the Lindt stall was busy engaging and serving too.

Not many of the staff were proactive like these ladies.
It‚Äôs clear that you don‚Äôt need more than 2 staff per stall, but the ladies on Pepsi & Crisps were just using as an excuse to have a chat, and not really acknowledging anyone to try their samples. One made eye contact with me and just continued talking to her coworker, didn‚Äôt seem like they wanted anyone to go over.

Overall, considering the small things you got e.g. one small celebration, one small Lindt bear/reindeer, 1 small minced pie - it felt more like brand promotion and tasters than an actual Christmas market. The hot chocolate stand was just outright non functional and unoccupied.

Members of the public on social media depict something very different, for one, there was no evidence of goodie bags anywhere here at Top Valley.
showerReviews.author: Kirstie Alex

locations.title: The Cotswold
locations.address: ÓÉà330-332 Mansfield Rd, Mapperley Park, Nottingham NG5 2EF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I thought this was a good value, basic budget hotel.
It is directly opposite a large Lidl store.
I stayed in room 28, a small, very basic box room for five nights in early November.
The receptionists were pleasant and efficient.
The room was very well heated.
There was a small single bed, smart TV, tea, coffee and a kettle, tissues, a very small chest of draws and a wall rack for hanging clothes; no hangers.
There was also an en-suite shower room with wash basin.
The room and en-suite were clean. Body Wash/Shampoo was provided as were hand and bath towels.
The hotel has a bus stop right outside with lots of buses going straight into the centre.
The only problem was that the WiFi was not working and this was not dealt with, despite numerous requests.
TOP TIPS: (1) assume that the WiFi does not work in order to save yourself frequent bouts of apoplexy; (2) bring a universal travel sink plug; (3) the shower can sometimes become very hot at first, (4) shower floor can be slippery.
Recommended for experienced budget travellers with realistic expectations for this price range.
showerReviews.author: Dr Jim Ferguson

showerReviews.reviewText:
DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!! It is disgusting!

You will come home either with BED BUGS or a skin infection.
I had booked one night in this hotel for one of my colleagues, he called my at 9pm and explained the room is so dirty and disgusting he refuse to sleep in it. he was offered another room but it was no better. It was so bad he said he would rather sleep in his van. So he checked out and went to another hotel that was cheaper and CLEAN.

The Bed was infested with bed bugs, the shower was mouldy and it looked like it had not been cleaned for months! And the carpet next to the bed looked like some one had died on it! Absolutely vile!

This experience reflects a serious lapse in maintenance and hygiene practices. I would strongly recommend that management address these concerns immediately to prevent further reputational damage and potential health risks to future guests.
showerReviews.author: Susanna Kingston

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a regular at this hotel for a while, and it's generally been a decent budget hotel but most rooms have small issues such as broken lights, broken blinds, windows that don't close properly, or a TV that doesn't work - but usually the beds are very comfortable and the staff are very friendly.

However, there have unfortunately been a few times in particular where the cleanliness wasn't up to scratch. During my most recent visit, the surface of the bed was dirty and there were some bed bugs and my partner was absolutely covered in these huge bug bites the next day! I'm really disappointed after being a regular for so long, but the price is unfortunately no longer worth the poor hygiene.
showerReviews.author: Dale Smith

showerReviews.reviewText:
Location: good location if you want easy access to the city centre, as the bus stop with several routes going to the city centre (so there is a bus every 2 to 4 minutes in the day time) is almost immediately outside, on the same side of the road as the hotel. Buses to the northern side of Nottingham, City Hospital or towards Mansfield can be found within a 2 to 5 minute walk.
Across the road is Lidl, and many restaurants are nearby or further up Mansfield Road. There is a laundrette across the road.
Bad location if you want somewhere very quiet as it is a built up area, but it's not the noisiest city area.

Room: There are rooms of different sizes. Room 2 is a very small room, with a single-sized bed. There is enough space to get changed. The floor space may be around 2 metres by 1.5m at the foot of the bed and 30cm wide next to the bed (the other side of the bed against the wall). The ceiling is high, so even a person well over 6ft would be ok. The bed would be ok for someone a few inches over 6ft.

The two pillows were firm, which was good. The bed is firm which is good, however the mattress was indented in in the middle.
I did not have bed bugs. I did get stung by a wasp, but I brought that in.

It has plug sockets and surpringingly two USB wall sockets, which was a good addition.
The dark curtains well-covered the window. The window can be opened and closed. The room was dark at night with the lights off. The lighting was bright, with multiple small lights in the ceiling.
The carpet seemed clean. It is spongey to walk on, which is unusual.

The room was a comfortable temperature - I never felt cold and could wear just a t-shirt/trousers/socks, despite 10-15C weather outside.

The en-suite bathroom is an ok size and layout - small, with the toilet and sink on the right, shower on the left. The sink is very small and has separate cold and hot taps. The shower was electric and adequate. There is shower gel in a holder in the shower and at the sink, plus body lotion near the sink.
The bathroom door handle doesn't work, but it doesn't need to because the latch thing is a circular roller so it opens by pushing or pulling the door without the need of pushing the handle down.

The room can be noisy as it's at the top of the stairs so you may hear it when people go up them or when they close the door at the top of the stairs. When people walk in the corridor it's like a mini earthquake. You can also hear people if they talk at the top of the stairs. The cleaning cupboard is outside, so it can be noisy when cleaning is happening.

Misc items: in the room/bathroom there was tea, instant coffee, milk pods, a small mug, a small glass, a kettle, two wooden hangers and a hanging rail, a small-medium wall-mounted TV, TV remote, bath towel, shower gel at the sink, shower gel in the shower, body lotion near the sink. The TV was not tuned well, but I retuned it and then it was fine from BBC1 to the higher channels (not that I watch TV). I never used the kettle.
The door uses a mechanical key, on a wooden keychain.
There's no desk but the windowsill is big enough to write some notes on if you knelt on the bed. There's a very small wall-attached table in the corner by the bed (A5-sized), a chest of three drawers below the TV (upon which is the tea etc, but you can put a few small items here).

Service: didn't bother me and friendly enough. I left my phone charger plug in the room and called about it and eas told to contact the next day. I went the next day and they gave me the plug.

Some people did laughing gas here. I heard the staff saying it. I guess you find some sleazy guests here.
showerReviews.author: Daniyal

showerReviews.reviewText:
Well, we booked this before looking at the reviews so we were pretty anxious before we arrived on what this place was like.

When we arrived there was older fella on the desk, and if we could give him 5 stars we would. Had a great laugh chatting to him.

The rooms however‚Ä¶

Beds are comfy, clean and fresh. And that‚Äôs as good as it got really.

When you flush the toilet or have the shower on, the drainage absolutely stinks. It seemed to be attempted to be covered up with bleach before we arrived, FYI- it didn‚Äôt work.

Some questionable brown smears on the walls in the bathroom.

Mouldy grout in bathroom.

Black mould bottom left of window sill.

Pubes around toilet rim and ALL OVER THE FLOOR.

From each window you just see a lot of rubbish, lots of materials open to the elements and rotting away right under our noses.

Our tv was I think 12‚Äù, walking past the other rooms they all had big TVs and bigger rooms which didn‚Äôt seem fair that luck of the drawer you could be shoved in the small room on the corner.

On the note on our door it says they provided a breakfast- not true. Same note also stated check out was at 10:30, it‚Äôs 10am.

Just a lot of stuff needs updating and sorting.

I think for ¬£35 and for a night or 2 isn‚Äôt unreasonable. My honest review on the place is it‚Äôs not great but will do for a place to sleep. Wouldn‚Äôt want to live here.
showerReviews.author: Tom baggaley

showerReviews.reviewText:
The bed was a bunk bed, rather creaky. The pillow was quite uncomfortablen and the sheer amount of stairs, absolutely sucked.

The shower was like hacking a numpad, trying to get the right combo of settings as the heating was awful on most, absolutely freezing, just about managed to get it to an okay standard after minutes of configuring it

Oh and all this whilst the bathroom light was flashing on an off whilst also flickering.

The locks on the door didn't seem robust, the handle isn't quite attached firmly to the door.

As for noise, it was difficult to get to sleep with the busy city life, at one point fireworks went off, absolutely no idea why.

Entrance was fine. The receptionist was okay.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Totally First class. Firstly this is a warm and clean, welcoming and well-appointed premium hostel at a budget price,a and with an excellent central location in Nottingham. I had a very positive visit here. Over and above that, though, I was superbly managed and treated after a nightmare situation thanks to that incompetent shambles Booking.com. They had cancelled a booking due to a card blocking that day (due to a too much contactless swiping  - but I was at a business conference)

With great kindness, the owner honored my booking, was hugely helpful and swiftly checked me into a pleasant, airy shared room. I got a quick and helpful tour and a soul-reviving shower, after a quick brief of the sensible house rules and a few local quirks (a nearby pub empties its glass bins late at night - nothing too onerous). He also mentioned a few disappointing occasions when he had been unable to help people 'auto-messed up' by online booking systems.

The kitchen and lounge are very pleasant and bright, and the beds are good. I have no hesitation in recommending and will be sure to return. Thank you MTH Nottingham!
showerReviews.author: NS Pr

showerReviews.reviewText:

locations.title: Igloo Backpackers Hostel
locations.address: ÓÉà100 Mansfield Rd, Nottingham NG1 3HD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great place to stay for one night that did not cost an arm or a leg. Not far from the city centre or the motor point arena.

I stayed with 4 other friends in a room with bunk beds and could have fitted in another person if required. Despite having shared bathrooms (3 in total) they were kept nice and clean.

The kitchen downstairs was roomy and held facilities for you to cook your own meals and provides some plates, cups and utensils to use.

The two staff members that I met were friendly and helpful. Just what you need in a new city.

Free wifi is available.

Towels can be rented for ¬£1 (prices may have changed since my stay in March '18).

The room was paid for on (physical) arrival to the hostel and a ¬£20 deposit was required for each key to the room provided (the money was returned at the end of the stay. Again prices may have changed).

I would recommend this place to stay for a couple of nights or if just passing through.
showerReviews.author: Adeola Adebola

locations.title: Student Roost - Hydrogen
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Goldsmith St, Nottingham NG1 5JS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
hi, this gonna take long cause i'm gonna tell you why i give 5 stars and not 4 or 1. i've been living here since 2023 and i'm graduating in 2026. so almost 3 years here. as an international student it's really sad and lonely to be where you're not usually stay at. but hydrogen never make me feel sad NOR lonely. they always have something every week be it pizza night, movie night, eid, christmas, halloween, they will always do something fun. and i appreciate that a lot. i could stay in my bed in my room the whole week - that's how comfortable this accomodation is.

in terms of facilities, the only thing that is missing is gym. but i believe they are planning on something cause we pay A LOT so a little gym room with treadmills and some lifting stuff won't hurt their pocket hehe. everything you can think of is here. snooker? they have it. board games? simply direct yourself to lower ground and you'll see it. pingpong? they have it. don't ask for swimming pools we ain't living in a hotel here HAHAH. i always hang out with my friend at their social space and my friends have been loving it. we had so many memories there.

now this is where i feel appreciated the most. their staffs. they are SO SO SO LOVELY. kristy, ameera and sean ( had been the most amazing people. they always helped me, always been kind and chatty and i love that. don't get me wrong, other staffs a nice too, i just don't remember their names haha. and i was so so so sad that kristy and ameera left cause it's now not the same anymore :( the new staffs don't look friendly but i know it's just me. maybe they're trying to adapt with the new environment too so that's totally understandable.

sean once helped me paint my room cause i desperately wanted a gray walls instead of orange and he fulfilled. i love sean for that god please don't let sean quit his job. tbh i don't know if i spelled his name correctly so if you're reading this, i'm sorry if i got your name wrong!

guys, please consider this accomodation as your first and firm choice. you'll never regret it. and now that i'm graduating, i feel sad to leave this place too - that's how attached i am with hydrogen. i love you hydrogen!!!

attached is my room hehe
showerReviews.author: Hurin Izzaty

showerReviews.reviewText: I have lived at Hydrogen since Nov22 and move out in September23. My experience has been very positive. The staff on reception are so friendly and helpful- around 24/7, and follow up issues quickly. The social spaces are modern and a great space to work in. They put on events fairly regularly, but maybe not quite as often as other student roost buildings- more events/activities would‚Äôve been good. My room was a great space- (I had a silver studio), and it was big and modern (gray carpets and gray walls, unlike the photos that look much more run down) but am aware not all rooms are updated yet. I was on the 1st floor and expected lots of noise, but the windows block out most of the noise and it‚Äôs actually really quiet at night! Shower, heating and hot water works perfectly, unlike what some of the reviews say. Location is fantastic, bus service, tram service and NTU city campus all within 5 min walk- and right in central city centre. Overall, really loved my time at Hydrogen!
showerReviews.author: Ella Morel

locations.title: Silverhill Woodland Retreats & Teversal Campsite
locations.address: ÓÉàSilverhill Ln, Teversal, Sutton-in-Ashfield NG17 3JJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great site for our motorhome, really friendly and helpful staff, nice big pitches, gravel hard standing with EHU.

Facilities block spotless and very modern, massive cubicles each with their own sink, mirror, toilet and shower. Very clean pot wash and chemical toilet areas, very well thought out and hot water.

Lovely little information shed with a chair and a wheelchair (presumably for use by those who need it). Lovely little shop with lots of items, coffee machine, outdoor table, etc. Didn't get to explore the area as it was horrendous rain while we were there and we were visiting family close by, but it's right on some trails and open park areas, 20 min walk to local co op, 5 mins to local pub.

Very quiet and peaceful site and felt very safe and secure - all in all a wonderful stay and will be back :o)

Oh, and for fellow motorhomers they had an easy to access Motorhome Service Point for grey waste drop and plenty of drinking water taps around the site
showerReviews.author: Nyree Holmes

locations.title: Holme Pierrepont Country Park, home of The National Water Sports Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàAdbolton Ln, Holme Pierrepont, Nottingham NG12 2LU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The site itself is lovely. But it's unfortunately let down by a few points.

The pitches first of all aren't clear. When we arrived, the people pitched next to us had parked on our pitch, due to the lack of zoning.

We used the shop, which is quite expensive but exactly what you'd expect from a captive audience, but the woman running the shop was rude and clearly uninterested.

The rules on keeping the noise down were not enforced, with the people next to us watching their television rather loudly until midnight both nights of our stay.

The biggest issue we had however was the toilet and shower blocks. They aren't cleaned often enough, in fact I believe they are only cleaned once a day, and very badly at that. They absolutely stank, I'd hate to have been pitched near by as you can smell them as you're walking toward them. The site state they've recently refurbished the block, they haven't, they have simply added another block outside the existing block, which really needs totally refurbishing.

It's a shame there were the issues with cleanliness, as the site itself is beautiful and really well located.
showerReviews.author: Charlotte Hawkes

showerReviews.reviewText:
We camped on the site, which is a decent 20 minute steady walk to the Lake for Paddle boarding and White water rafting. I recommend booking in advance as the place is really popular.

The camp site is basic but has electric hook ups and there is a toilet and shower block, play park, shop, and loads of open spaces for kids to play.

The watersports themselves were great, and decent value for the time we got.

On the saturday we hired paddleboards and a kayak to keep us all entertained, it was great fun and a nice way to cool off in the heat!

We hired a raft on the Sunday and I'd like to say a special mention to Sam the Instructor who was great! He kept us all entertained whilst teaching us how to be safe on the water. And overall he made the experience one to remember for the kids and the adults! Well done Sam, highly recommended!

My daughter also had a go on the Sky Tykes trail which she loved, worth mentioning it‚Äôs attached to a cafe selling food & sweet treats, ice creams & waffles, and the odd lager & cider to cool off!

Sam also provided knowledge of the wider area including a mention for the Poppy & Pint pub which we visited and also enjoyed!

In all we had a really pleasant sunny weekend and I would recommend a visit.
showerReviews.author: Nathan Johnson

showerReviews.reviewText: Grounds kept well, shower and toilet blocks ok. Decent facilities. Pitches not clearly marked out though, so we had someone next to us overpaid a little, which meant we had to as they weren't around to speak to. We went after school summer holidays to ensure it wasn't too noisy, but had a few families with very young kids running around screaming late and very early next morning. Not the parks fault of course - fully on the parents - but would be reluctant to stay again because of that

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pensioners in a 7.5m moho

Delightful site. Easy, secure access. Carl is very pleasant and accommodating. Facilities included: Water; chemical toilet disposal; waste and recycling facilities; EHU; grey water disposal; clean, efficient shower rooms (2) lots of nice green areas including a fishing lake. Wonderfully quiet from 21st century noise, just beautiful bird song.
The only ‚Äúimprovement?‚Äù I would ask would be some means of getting a decent WiFi signal for when the weather isn‚Äôt good. Site is ideal for caravans as you need some transport to get around. Apparently the village is an ‚Äúeasy bike ride‚Äù away, but for us two geriatric motorhome dwellers this wasn‚Äôt an option.üòè In the sunnier months of the year we‚Äôd definitely return.
showerReviews.author: Sylvia Hinton-Keenan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just spent our Easter break here at Sherwood Forest Holiday Park. Absolutely loved our stay here. The staff were brilliant, the site was clean and we had asked for a quieter part of the site which we got - and the pitches were a very good size.

The only reason I gave 4* and not 5* were the toilets/showers. Although clean, they were dated and the shower you had to push the button like every 5 seconds and when trying to shower it was a pain. Also the block we had only had 2 showers so as it was a busy weekend, there was a wait.

Also, remember to take a hairdryer as there were none in the block we were in.

Again with the showers, no where to put your shower gel on, no seat/bench just 2 little hooks which is hard to hang your clothes on and towel.

But overall we were more than happy with the site and the cost was also good for our stay. We shall be returning but no doubt take a little foldable seat for the shower to put stuff on and a Velcro strap for them push button showers.
showerReviews.author: Stuart Buckminster

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here over bank holiday weekend, the location itself is lovely and the wardens very helpful.
We stayed on riverside, mainly because it was near the play park. We had a huge pitch which backed in to the river which was perfect however we came to realise that pitch etiquette wasn‚Äôt a thing and it was normal for adults and children to constantly walk through our pitch to get to the river, I wouldn‚Äôt have minded quite so much but rather than take the outside route they were walking between the van and the car.
We had people park on our pitch for the day, children playing with footballs etc on our pitch it took away the peace and enjoyment from been able to sit outside our van.
Children‚Äôs play area is very old dated and damaged and in desperate need of funding to renew the equipment.
Showers are basic but clean and large.
There‚Äôs different things on at certain times all in all it was a good break but could have been better but the location is perfect.

If your hooking up make sure you have a way to hook onto the tv Ariel point on site
showerReviews.author: Della Knight

showerReviews.reviewText:
We booked 2 nights at Sherwood Castle Holiday Forest after staying in a small pod at their park in Norfolk last August. Our Sherwood Forest chalet was more spacious and had 2 rooms, so could definitely accommodate kids or another couple - we stayed in Harmony 29.
After reading mixed reviews, we weren't sure what to expect but our September stay was fab! We were allowed to check in a little earlier than 4pm, and the both staff members when we checked in and out were lovely.
The grounds were quiet due to the time of year, however it was perfect for a couple who were after a quiet break. The chalet was clean and warm, the bedding was clean and comfortable and the kitchen had everything we needed for a 2 night stay.
At first we weren't sure about the placement of the hot tub as it was more exposed than our one we had in Norfolk, and was on the side of the chalet in view of a small road that led to the last few chalets - however our tub was more set back than others next to us and there was a short wooden fence, so you got used to it!
There were always staff onsite so I got the impression that they are quite on top of maintenance. Somebody popped by daily to check on the hot tub so I feel like any issues would have been resolved.
The location was great for visiting Nottingham and Rufford Abbey and there was enough to do for a mini break.
The surrounding woodland provided a nice walk and a few chickens, and there was a swimming pool onsite too.
If you're after a less intense Centre Parcs stay at a much cheaper cost I would recommend Sherwood Castle. We would definitely return.
showerReviews.author: Hollie Birch

showerReviews.reviewText: Just back from a 2 night stay in the "bohemian love lodge" arrived just after check-in at 4pm and that was easy enough was given our lodge key with a code attached for access to our secret room,was excited to see the secret room as I worked here as a cleaner 8 years ago so knew what to expect with the lodge and not much had changed with that,still had the same dated furniture,the bathroom as been updated had a full size bath with shower over it,mattress in main bedroom was old and very uncomfortable needs updating,realy sqeaky floor and heating constantly kicking in (not sure if its because thermostat is on an external wall) even when turned low it was constantly on and the pipes made quite alot of noise,when it came to cooking breakfast i coudnt find a frying pan or a few utensils turns out they was in the dishwasher so this hadnt been emptied prior to us arriving ! The secret room looked exactly as in the pictures very romantic but had a few issues, tv didn't work with remote as it had gotton damp so rang reception and maintenence came within 20 mins to sort it great size tv 65" but you do have to jump on your own hotspot to watch anything,there is no heaters in the secret room which let's it down as it got really cold once you was out the hottub,the table and bar area were great the bar area had a fridge big enough for lots of drinks,we played a few card games at the table but the huge tree stump coming into the room made the roof squeek,the day bed was so cold and damp from the condensation you couldn't lay on to get warm,the hottub was the best bit of the room was huge and set to a lovely temperature with lights and bubbles,however it wasn't working on first morning so again had to phone reception which didnt open till 9am we was up early and wait for a member from the leisure team to come sort which took about 40 mins,a few tweeks and this could have been perfect but we're happy we had a break away and made the most of the bits that were great üëç
showerReviews.author: Jackie Gascoigne

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely awful experience.
We were supposed to be staying in a ‚Äúluxury‚Äù lodge at Sherwood Castle Holiday Forest, but our original lodge was disgusting. It was obvious it hadn‚Äôt been cleaned at all ‚Äî filthy appliances, a mouldy, rusty microwave, and ripped flooring with carpet covered in hair. Completely unacceptable.
After complaining, we were moved to another lodge, but it honestly wasn‚Äôt much better. Two of the beds were snapped, the sofa legs were broken, and the TV didn‚Äôt work. Basic maintenance has clearly been ignored throughout the site.
The facilities were just as bad. The swimming pool looked unappealing, with paint visibly flaking off into the water. The sports hall was even worse ‚Äî half the lights didn‚Äôt work, and there wasn‚Äôt even enough equipment available to use it properly.
This place is advertised as ‚Äúluxury,‚Äù which is laughable. It‚Äôs run down, poorly maintained, and absolutely not worth the money. Save your time and your cash and go somewhere else ‚Äî or honestly, stay at home. Never again.
showerReviews.author: Millie 123

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been coming here for a few months and it's a decent gym, though with a few issues. The facilities are good for the most part, with good machines but a cramped free weights section where people often get in each other's way.

The showers are clean, both for the pool and in the changing room.

The staff range from friendly with a good sense of humour to miserable and cold. I don't expect them to have smiles on their faces all the time but one or two members seem like they want to be anywhere else.

Another downside is that they are shut on bank holidays, which is pretty poor compared to other gyms I've been to; have reduced hours, sure, but to be closed entirely? The swimming hours also leave very little options for anyone working full time. Most gyms with pools I've been to have allowed people in as late as 8 or 9pm, but here? The last swimming session you can book is as early as 5 or 6 on many evenings. Very restrictive and if they don't extend the hours then I'm not sure I'll renew my membership in a few months' time.
showerReviews.author: Frank Gell

locations.address: ÓÉàBeaumont Way, Beaumont Leys, Leicester LE4 1DS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I‚Äôve been using the gym for the best part of 30 years. Like me the place has decayed over time. The treadmills are the same ones I ran on all those years ago. Not only are they so outdated compared with modern ones but they are filthy and rusty with years of sweat. When I started there were actual staff who helped people train and made sure that the public were safe but now the only time male staff members enter the area is if there is a young woman training that they can ‚Äòchat‚Äô with. People train in their outdoor coats and shoes. Personal hygiene is often an issue. There is no gym etiquette - people sit chatting on equipment for literally ages or play on their phones. . The music played is non inclusive - rap music and continuous Radio 1 Xtra drivel when the clientele are often mostly well into their 50s. Now I‚Äôm a pensioner and I still pay a fortune to go 2/3 times a week -  I wonder why I don‚Äôt go somewhere else - but I‚Äôm trapped by convenience and the lure of Tesco. If you ever want a microcosm of all that‚Äôs decayed in modern England this is the place to go.
showerReviews.author: J B

showerReviews.reviewText:
Swimming.
¬£10 for 1 adult and 1 child.
Changing rooms were awful, I can live with mess if it's just me, but not when my son is subjected to unnecessarily bad hygiene.
Baby's nappies left on the floor, sink units and sitting points. Broken locks on changing stations, pubic hairs on baby changing counter, almost all lockers broken. Generally dirty. The pool zone was fun, but the water flumes were out of use, these were the main attraction as I remember years ago, looks as though its been left to rot. Quite sad to see. It has great childhood memories to it, hence the visit. With correct management coordination it could easily be in good shape.
Overall, disappointing.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cossington Swimming Pool is a decent local spot for swimming and lessons. The staff are all really friendly and helpful, and the instructors are great ‚Äì especially for beginners or kids just getting into swimming. The lessons are well-structured and supportive, and there‚Äôs a good range of sessions available throughout the week.

However, there could definitely be more attention paid to cleanliness and hygiene. The changing rooms and showers aren‚Äôt always in the best condition, and sometimes the pool area could use a deeper clean. With a bit more effort on the hygiene side, this place would be a much better experience overall.

Still, if you're looking for a supportive place to swim or learn to swim, it‚Äôs a good option with a positive team behind it.
showerReviews.author: Maariyah Ismail

showerReviews.reviewText: The swimming pool is pleasant, but the receptionist, specifically an individual of Indian descent, displays rudeness in her interactions. I want to clarify that my concern is not rooted in racism or prejudice towards individuals from South Asia. However, regardless of her background, it would have been more appropriate for her to communicate in a polite manner instead of loudly calling us out in front of others. We arrived slightly earlier than our designated time, and she could have handled the situation with more courtesy. The incident caused embarrassment as everyone's attention was drawn to us. Considering her role as a receptionist, it is important for her to maintain a level of politeness as she represents the image of the facility.

Changing room require cleaning.  The reception staff are seriously over worked because you can never get through. Most importantly children's scores are not always recorded on the devices. As a result we not sure when and if children are progressing. The council is quick to take the money but not following through on swimming.

Female lessons are barely available because we are informed those attending simply use it as a socialising time and thus waiting to take a lesson are left waiting - in our case 4 years of waiting. In addition,  lesson times dont meet the needs of working mothers.

The staff who coach and manage are wonderful hence the 1 star but they cannot be blamed for the lack of investment.

Monday night after 6 pm, all 3 have lessons, only sessions instead of having differing days to enable access to the pools after 6pm.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Every time I or my family try to call Parklands Leisure Centre, nobody answers the phone. It either rings non stop or cuts off. When you walk in, you see staff at reception and some on their phones, so why are customer calls ignored. If they don‚Äôt want to answer phones, they should remove that service and use live chat or WhatsApp instead.

For a place that makes so much money from memberships, activities and parking, the customer service is shocking. Toilets and changing rooms have been complained about before for being dirty and nothing has changed. Management clearly isn‚Äôt paying attention. Someone from the staff should try calling themselves and see what customers go through.

Really disappointing experience.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The facilities are good when theyre working. Ive had several bad experiences with many staff members here who come across unhelpful, rude and miserable. Some of them are really helpful and positive like Jenny for instance.

If you're female I advise you not to use the sauna or steam room. The usual middle aged men will sit around waiting to strike conversation and prey on you.... And then talk about you in a derogatory manner in the changing rooms afterwards. Some might csll it "male banter" but entirely inappropriate and very offensive if you're the unfortunate subject. I did try and report it but was basically just talking to a brick wall with single word responses.

If the management sorts itself out this gym could be a lot better. Start off by greeting your members with a hello. It costs nothing. I talk as a non student member. Leicester University needs to send in a team to train the staff who spend more time talking to each other and laughing away rather than do their respective duties and treat their customers with some respect.
showerReviews.author: S Ibrahim

locations.address: ÓÉà166 Walnut St, Leicester LE2 7GR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Used the gym mainly early hours (starting anywhere from 0:00-05:00).

Large group of treadmills all with error codes on them which were never fixed during the entire duration of my membership, most people stopping them by using the emergency stop buttons out of pure laziness.

There would be groups of people hanging round on equipment and only letting their friends use it because they‚Äôre ‚Äútraining each other‚Äù which is a breach of terms.

Equipment and bags often left strewn across the gym floor. If the rules actually got enforced there wouldn‚Äôt be any members left because most people play by their rules not the ones they agreed to.

Locker rooms adequate but often dirty, the cleaners only seem to bother with the floors.

Toilets often out of loo roll and soap which once caused me to have to leave early.

Vending machines constantly understocked, hottest day of the year and they were completely devoid of water when I arrived. If they weren‚Äôt understocked they were jammed and wouldn‚Äôt dispense.

Large windows leaving you visible to the outside world‚Ä¶except when they‚Äôre completely steamed up and mouldy. Air quality is also dreadful.

I understand the gym is unmanned from 22:00 but based on other reviews it‚Äôs clear that these issues are also prevalent during the day too so no excuse.
showerReviews.author: Josh B (MrJamminJosh)
