locations.title: David Lloyd Leicester Meridian
locations.address: ÓÉàMeridian Leisure Park, Lubbesthorpe Way, Leicester LE19 1JZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been a member for several years, and this was likely my final session, having served a three-month notice period. I want to be clear that the staff are fantastic, work hard and do an excellent job.

However, the condition of the changing rooms and pool area is unacceptable and poses a clear health risk. The changing rooms and showers are damp and visibly covered in black mould, indicating serious failures in cleaning and maintenance. The poolside and changing areas are excessively humid, suggesting problems with the ventilation system. There also appears to be an issue with the pool itself, as my eyes stung significantly during use.

I am expecting my second child and had planned to pause my membership for six to twelve months with the intention of returning. Given the current state of the facilities, I will not be doing so.
showerReviews.author: elliot priestley

showerReviews.reviewText:
rejoined David Lloyd three months ago, hoping things had improved‚Äîbut honestly, nothing has changed. Yes, they claim to have spent a lot of money refurbishing the gym, but in reality, all they‚Äôve done is lease new machines, paint over old walls, and add a big Lloyds logo display. That‚Äôs it.
The spa section and changing rooms are still in a terrible state‚Äîdirty and far from what you‚Äôd expect from a so-called ‚Äúpremium‚Äù club. Dirt is everywhere, all the time. The showers are full of mold, which is extremely harmful to health, and nobody seems to care or do anything about it.
The pool is filthy, and the temperature is inconsistent. Whenever it‚Äôs family time and you bring your little one, the water is freezing cold‚Äîthis has been the case for at least five years. It almost feels intentional. The jacuzzi and kids‚Äô pool have parts missing, leaving sharp edges exposed‚Äîhow is this even compliant with health and safety standards?
I‚Äôve complained multiple times through the app‚Äîno response. On Wednesday, I even left a message at reception with a lady (curly hair) who took all my details and promised the manager would call me Friday. Today is Friday‚Äîstill nothing. I submitted another complaint through the app requesting a callback‚Äîagain, nothing.
And yet, they have the audacity to email me saying membership fees will increase from January, which I clearly stated I do not agree with.
David Lloyd might have been a premium gym years ago, but now it‚Äôs worse than PureGym. Honestly, Nuffield is ten times better. So think twice before locking yourself into a one-year contract with a company that clearly doesn‚Äôt care about its customers‚Äîor their safety.
showerReviews.author: Lucian Prejban

locations.address: ÓÉàSYN, 2 New Walk, Leicester LE1 6RU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Update a year and a half on. It's declined slightly. Facilities aren't as clean as they used to be and it's oversubscribed, which would even be fine if there was enough equipment to accommodate. In the last few weeks there's been a handful of times when I really haven't enjoyed it due to having barely any space to work out. Legs day is becoming an annoyance due to oversubscription and only one squat machine and 1 leg press. Advice. If you want a million members get a bigger place and more equipment. My original review is below.

Previous review: Joined this week and so far very impressed. Doesn't get too busy (although not been at peak times yet) Sam is very helpful, hospitable and always approachable. Equipment is good and is better then most places I've worked out at The only thing is I noticed there are only one set of dumbbells for each weight which is one minor downside. The most impressive thing about the gym is the shower facilities. First gym I've been to where you have your own private cubicle with a door. All in all enjoying it so far.
showerReviews.author: Mo Laher

showerReviews.reviewText:
Have been at this gym now for 9 months and can safely say it‚Äôs the best one I‚Äôve been to in Leicester. I have trained for about 10 years and the atmosphere is so chill and even at its peak hours it‚Äôs not as super busy as other gyms and you can get your workout complete

Other points to mention:

Toilets are clean and having own cubicles is a nice touch.
Water dispenser is prompt and filtered with a motion sensor for the bottle
Vending machine with loads of drinks in case you forget your water or you need an energy drink
Protein bars for sale at the bar when you need something quick pre or post workout
The staff and Sam are super friendly and approachable when you need them.

Thoroughly recommend this gym from anyone who‚Äôs a beginner at the gym to the more experienced lifters, has everything you need machines wise and they‚Äôre all pretty much brand new!
showerReviews.author: Kris T

locations.title: Nuffield Health Leicester Fitness & Wellbeing Gym
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Byford Way, Leicester LE4 0DZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
One of the best gyms in Leicester.
The staff and management here are so well organised and happy to help - always a smile.
This is a welcome change from other gyms.
This gym and pool are spotlessly clean with an almost constant visible effort being made.
This gym has all the usual machines and a work out are upstairs.
Rowing, running and stairs machines, and cycles etc too.
Classes often run in various areas. Multi bike room too.
Big pool with sauna and steam room.
Changing area and showers well maintained too.
Plenty of car parking here.
This is a gym with a strong group spirit and nice atmosphere.
Highly rate this gym which I visit 3times a week.
This more a health club rather than solely focused on body building.
Swimming for younger swimmers and classes.
Cafe self service and seating available.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Top class customer service!
Very helpful, polite & professional staff members in reception. Great swimming pool, sauna & steam-room.

Many lockers and a good size changing room.
Boxing area upstairs is a bonus!
On Sunday, saw staff were busy with cleaning operation. I think hygiene standards are very high in this club.

Also saw, swimming guards checking sauna temperature every now and then.

Felt welcome to the club for a trial pass! Only given 4 starts as I think there should be more WC inside the changing room. Swimming lanes were not wide enough.
And membership can be a little expensive but, you pay what you get.
showerReviews.author: Sangar

showerReviews.reviewText:
The staff are really friendly and helpful. Some really dedicated staff which the gym are lucky to have. The gym has a nice size car park and in a good location. Sadly this is about it when you consider it is a premium gym.

The membership is very expensive for what you get and certainly isn't on par with other Nuffields. Other Nuffields in more expensive locations closer to London has the same membership price yet even has badminton and squash courts.

This gym has well exceeded it's capacity for members for a few years now. They use to pride themselves that even at peak times the gym was not busy now they don't.

The only reason people come to this gym is because of lack of premium gyms in the area. I have no doubt if another premium gym or even a David Lloyd opened nearby this gym would go out of business very quickly. It certainly feels like Nuffield aren't interested in listening to feedback of members but also provide a premium gym. I guess it's because they know they have a sort of a monopoly in the area as a premium gym. Although they are happy to charge like a premium gym.

Overall, this gym is like a pure gym/ gym group but with a swimming pool and gym classes.

showerReviews.reviewText: Ufit was a wonderful experience. I feel the really listen to your needs and cater to all forms of fitness. Be it diet, exercise, recovery were all areas they payed close attention to. When you step into a class, the energy is always positive and each exercise can be modified to your level of difficulty. The coaches boost your confidence and make the whole experience very smooth. The whole aura of the studio is very welcoming. Their machinery is top class, be it the dumbbells or Pilates equipment or the Dyson in the changing rooms or the mirrors all over, you feel like you are being looked after well. I cannot recommend Ufit enough for anyone who wants to focus on improving their life in a wholistic way. The stand outs on top of all of these would be the Mat Pilates and the sound bath sessions, all make you feel so relaxed. They also make catered take home protein smoothies

locations.title: Bannatyne Health Club and Spa
locations.address: ÓÉà58 Welford Rd, Leicester LE2 7AA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym has everything you need but is overpriced and in desperate need of refurbishment.

The gym equipment is good and you have everything you need for a workout.  I can‚Äôt believe that they advertise Spa days here though! The facilites are run down and the venue has the feeling of a council leisure centre vs a spa.

My partner and I paid ¬£25 for a day pass which didn‚Äôt include a towel.  If you want a towel it‚Äôs an extra ¬£3.50! Plus you have to pay a ¬£5 deposit! Rather than welcoming us to the gym, the reception girl seemed more obsessed with making sure we paid for the towels.  I‚Äôd paid online but it wasn‚Äôt showing on her system so she was trying to make me pay again.  When I assured her that I‚Äôd paid she said that they‚Äôd needed to ‚Äòlaunch an investigation‚Äô! And she wasn‚Äôt joking! Eventually I managed to show her a bank statement that proved that I could take a towel! It was really unbelievable. And the towel is just a small white towel you‚Äôd get anywhere!

The sauna area was crowded and not particularly female friendly. My girlfriend didn‚Äôt feel comfortable there with the clientele.  The changing rooms are not clean and the showers don‚Äôt have shampoo or conditioner.  All the lockers and doors are falling apart and need replacing.  The reception area feels like it‚Äôs not changed since the 90‚Äôs.

Otherall, if you want a gym that has everything you need for a workout and sauna this place is fine. If you want to take your partner for a spa day this is definitely not the place!
showerReviews.author: Jamie Rylett

showerReviews.reviewText: Paid astronomical prices for years to attend these poorly maintained, often unclean facilities. Got emails every few weeks informing of pool closures while I was paying more than local luxury private gyms charge. Kept on coughing up because it was a 5 minute walk away from my home. Recently moved & was thrilled to cancel my membership.
showerReviews.author: Alex Gillham

showerReviews.reviewText:
I came here from Canada and honestly, I was really disappointed with this gym. The equipment is very limited ‚Äî for example, there‚Äôs only one bench press bar, so it‚Äôs quite possible you come in and can‚Äôt even do your main workout because it‚Äôs always in use. The membership price is similar to other gyms like PureGym, but PureGym has several times more equipment and you don‚Äôt need to wait in line or change your plan.

They also have strange rules. I usually train with my friend and sometimes we do a video call while working out, just to check each other‚Äôs form. Here, you‚Äôre not allowed to make a video call at all (even if there‚Äôs no one else on your screen). I emailed the university and even they couldn‚Äôt explain why, just said it‚Äôs the ‚Äúpolicy.‚Äù

Hygiene is another issue. They put wipes to clean the equipment, but honestly, I felt like only me and one other person ever used them. There‚Äôs also a sign that says no outdoor shoes in the stretching area, but everyone walks straight in with the same shoes they wear outside ‚Äî so the mats are actually quite dirty.

There‚Äôs hardly any space for stretching, and the ventilation is really poor. On hot days, it feels like you‚Äôre being cooked inside.

Overall, not worth the money compared to other gyms in the city.
showerReviews.author: Hourieh Jamalidinan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Although it took us some time to navigate the process of booking swimming lessons for my little one online, the overall experience at the leisure center was excellent. Parking was included with the swimming lessons, and we were also given a free swimming hat. The receptionist was very friendly and provided all the information we needed to locate the swimming facilities. The changing rooms were clean and offered plenty of space.

showerReviews.reviewText: Attend for swim lessons. Ratios have been increasing since we joined in 2021. Now 10 kids per class in one lane. Just ridiculous. Everyone active are greedy and try and pack the classes to the max. Its such a shame this company took over our leisure facilities from the council. Changing rooms are always dirty and smelly, not enough seating for spectators during lessons , so you cant even watch your child swim with ppl standing up . Not enough showers either. Quality of teaching depends on what teacher you get. We have been lucky to get a very experienced teacher but now the glass sizes are so big the value for money isnt their. We started in 2021 and it was ¬£22 a month and now 31, and its not worth it now.

I‚Äôd booked the 13:30 slot ( I was travelling North) but arrived earlier and was able to swim at the earlier time. The showers did take some time to run warm. A lovely cafe is next to the pool. locations.title: Splash Spa Leicester
locations.address: ÓÉà61 Bedford St S, Leicester LE1 3JR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is the largest sauna in Leicester, which can have its drawbacks, as if it is not busy then you can find it hard to make contact.

The sauna has a nice bar/relaxation area on the ground floor with a pool table, bar serving food and drinks (free coffee & tea) and the wet-area which has the showers, sauna and steam room and a large heated pool ‚Äì not exactly a Jacuzzi though.  Upstairs is a large video room, various cabins, darkrooms, g.h‚Äôs.  There is also and open-air terraced area for taking the sun and smoking.

The clientele are a little younger than is usual in saunas these days ‚Äì I would say that the average age was between 25 to 45 on my recent visit on a Sunday lunchtime/afternoon ‚Äì although there were some older men also in attendance.  There were also 50 -60 people visiting during the period I was there.  There was also quite an ethnic mix during my visit.

The sauna runs themed night including foam parties, under thirties nights with reduced prices for the younger crowd, over 60‚Äôs on alternate Wednesday when the youngsters pay the standard entrance fee.  There are concessions for the under 25‚Äôs on most days too.  There are also ‚Äúgear‚Äùdays and bears‚Äô days as well ‚Äì best to check the website.

The steam room and upstairs see the most activity.

A nice clean place with friendly staff ‚Äì well worth a visit if you can be sure that it will be busy.
showerReviews.author: ComeFlyWithMe

showerReviews.reviewText:
My friend took me for my first visit to this (gay sauna). I wasn't totally sure what to expect, but had a general idea.

The facilities where spread out and all working. The hot tub was bigger than average (so I'm told).

The staff are friendly and professional which helped me to relax. I feel I could go to them if I had an issue...

It was busy but not wall to wall with a mix of age groups. Everyone from my experience respected each other and didn't encroach on others space so to speak.

I would consider going again, maybe on my own in the future.

My only criticism would be that some areas of the facilities could benefit with some small repairs maybe upgrades. However, everything was clean and safe. An i understand things are a work in progress.

Towels provided are all the same style this can make it easy for you to mix your towel up with others. Maybe a tag or something would help to prevent this.

Overall a relaxing experience with friendly staff. I would recommend this to others looking for a gay sauna.
showerReviews.author: Malc B

My only criticism would be that some areas of the facilities could benefit with some small repairs maybe upgrades. However, everything was clean and safe. An i understand things are a work in progress.

Towels provided are all the same style this can make it easy for you to mix your towel up with others. Maybe a tag or something would help to prevent this.

Overall a relaxing experience with friendly staff. I would recommend this to others looking for a gay sauna.
showerReviews.author: Malc B

showerReviews.reviewText:
Today was my first visit with my partner and friend. It was a last minute decision to come and test the waters. We drove from Market Harborough (35 minutes away). We did look online so knew exactly how much entry would be and that it would be no towel day. I was fine with this whilst the other 2 were a little more apprehensive and reserved at first. Unfortunately upon arriving around 19:30 the area for parking was very busy. My partner and friend got out to ask if the no towel was optional (it was not), which was fine for me. When they came out to let me know that having a towel/swimsuit wasn't an option for a today they decided they wanted to give it a shot because it looked nice and the staff member was very friendly and helpful.

When we had managed to find a parking spot we all went in and the staff member on the door was very helpful, friendly and informative. He gave us a little tour of the facilities and what to expect.

They provide you with a large towel, small flannel towel, flip flops and a locker key all for the price of entry (¬£15). This also allows you to stay all day if you wanted (open -close).

The facilities are on the darker side compared to your typical type of spa but as a fan of the dark and dingy I felt at home üòÖ the facilities could honestly do with some updating in some areas but don't let this deter you as everything was very clean and seeing the staff members very frequently changing bins and cleaning up the different areas was fantastic.

Clientele was very mixed in age, size and race which was nice to see. The majority of the clients were exceptionally friendly and said hi or started small talk which was also nice of them, especially as first timers. We never once was made to feel like we were outcasts or unwanted there.

It's a shame that this was our first visit and not our millionth. We will definitely be visiting again and more frequently possibly weekly (no towel Tuesdays) for me, but the different days and events they hold caters to a wide variety of people, needs and interests.

I would however recommend as a first timer that arriving after 6 on a weekday seems to be a good time as it's not very busy and let's you get used to it before being thrown in the deepend as they say. Multiple people had mentioned it can get rather busy and overcrowded on some days and times.

All in all a fantastic place for the LGBT+ community in the Leicestershire area and will look forward to many more visits in the very near future.
showerReviews.author: Zak Walker

locations.title: Leicester Roman Baths
locations.address: ÓÉàLeicester LE1 4LB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Today, the only visible reminder of Leicester‚Äôs Roman past, in-situ, is the Jewry Wall.  At 23m long, 9m high and 2.5m thick, it is one of the largest pieces of Roman masonry still standing in Britain.  Since the medieval period, when it was commonly believed to be part of a Temple to Janus, there has been much discussion about what the Jewry Wall may have been.  It was not until it was excavated in the late 1930s by the pioneering archaeologist Dame Kathleen Kenyon (coincidentally in preparation for the building of a new swimming baths) that its role as part of a substantial bathing complex was demonstrated, and not the town‚Äôs forum as previously thought.  Kenyon‚Äôs excavations were the first large-scale archaeological investigation of Roman Leicester and paved the way for eighty years of archaeological discoveries
showerReviews.author: Jason Smith

locations.title: JD Gyms Coventry
locations.address: ÓÉàBelgrade Plaza, Upper Well St, Coventry CV1 4AJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I usually like JD Gyms, but this branch is really disappointing. There‚Äôs a clear lack of gym etiquette among many users. People regularly leave weights lying around instead of putting them back‚Äîexpecting someone new or less strong to unload multiple 25‚ÄØkg plates from a barbell or leg press is unreasonable.

Dumbbells are often left scattered on the floor near benches, creating obvious trip hazards. If someone were to fall or injure themselves because of this, it could easily lead to legal action. Safety should be taken seriously. If someone is strong enough to lift the weights to use them, there‚Äôs no excuse for not racking them properly afterward.

I also can‚Äôt stand how some people have no respect for personal space or hygiene‚Äîincluding groups of students and Uber drivers who seem more interested in staring at women than actually training.

I understand people need to rest between sets, but it‚Äôs frustrating when they take 10 minutes just staring at their phones or having long conversations, with no regard for others waiting to use the machine.

On top of that, some of the equipment is badly in need of maintenance or replacement. For example, one of the calf raise machines feels like the bearings are shot, and the loading pole on the leg press is so angled it looks like the plates could fall off at any moment.

Overall, the entire branch feels neglected and seems to be relying solely on the JD Gyms name to keep attracting members. With so little competition in the area, it feels like there‚Äôs no incentive for management to address these issues.
showerReviews.author: Latif Ad Din

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's a shame with how lovely the staff is, but the quality overall seems lacking.

Some improvements since the last review, but it seems like they forgot to put any money into actually improving/fixing machines.

I don't know if the owner willingly ignores the quality issues with machines, or for some other reason pays no attention and just doesn't allocate money or resources.

The bench press assistance arms are still broken on some, the benches themselves move more than they should and are not stable.

Both of these wouldn't really be issues at low weights, but when you you're nearing and going past 100, stability starts to become a bit more important.

I suppose they're just waiting for someone to injure themselves so they can go "whoops", knowing nobody will challenge them on it.

Leg press backrest is loose. Foam on the quad extension roller is almost fully worn. Few quid to fix it? Nah, not with how busy they are. It's so bad you either need to be willing to hurt yourself on it at higher weights, or use shin pads.

I'm sure there's more issues around, just haven't bothered to look so closely.

Rules are hit and miss. Go topless in the middle of the gym while crowded? Sure. Not frequent but still happens.

No real enforcement if at all with putting weights back, or on clothing. No bike signs downstairs are more suggestions.

Even the small puregym near the Transport Museum had it in it's budget to place a cleaning station or two with paper towels around, but this was too much for JD with its higher prices and much larger footfall. Got to clean up the sweat and grime of everyone and their mother with your own things.
showerReviews.author: Codrin Gherman

I try to avoid the times between 4PM-8PM as that's most busy and you may struggle to find a bench, barbell, dumbell or plates. Also some members just hog the equipment when it can be shared between sets.
Plenty of lockers available but just 2 urinals and 2 toilets.
I suggest management should invest in more frequent cleaning and maybe some sort of air freshener equipment around the locker room and the main entrance.

showerReviews.reviewText:
review of BIRMINGHAM BRANCH SPECIFICALLY

The facilities of the gym are very decent, a lot of kit and decent equipment.
HOWEVER, the gym is horrible, there is no etiquette, dumbbells are always left on the floor and individual parties use up to 4 sets of dumbbells, I get it but it‚Äôs a community gym, extremely selfish. I wanted to use the sauna but was disgusted, spitting on the floors, not washing before entering - vile. The toilets are equally disgusting do not look like they are cleaned at all. At some times it can be a pleasant experience but after work it‚Äôs awful. There is plenty of parking the car park however is always full, not an issue I understand it‚Äôs busy.

The gym culture however it awful. Lack of respect for others and extreme selfish individuals.

Cancelled after 5 sessions and will not be returning.

Other JD gyms I been to seem a lot better, same decent equipment and a well thought out gym. The sauna is a great add on and the operating hours are very good.
showerReviews.author: Andrew Pedrycz

showerReviews.reviewText:
Signed up, went once and cancelled membership.

Gym is over packed, free weights section is a genuine safety issue with people leaving dumbbells all over the floor. Never been to a gym before where people just throw their weights down then walk away. Had to wait for every machine I wanted to use and not even any space in the ab mat / stretching area.

Male changing rooms were disgusting, whole room is soaking wet, even 2 of the hair dryers were just left turned on with no one using them.

Avoid this gym and pay more somewhere less busy and have actually have staff on the gym floor. Even though the equipment is good (standard for a JD gym), this is the worst gym I‚Äôve ever been to in regards to safety, cleanliness and overcrowding.
showerReviews.author: Reece Suffield

showerReviews.reviewText: This Gym is amazing! The price may be stunning at first but when you enter you understand the price is right! The staff are friendly and always hospitable in classes and generally around the gym. The best part of this gym is the Women's section, absolutely fabulous, there is one section dedicated to cardio and abs with great machines and another section with a variety of free weights and machines! For shy women or just women looking for some privacy in a workout it is great, just to top it of you don't even need to leave the changing room to get there! They made it as an extension of the room! definitely worth it üòÜ

showerReviews.reviewText: Things are always broken. Good free weights room. Some of the equipment is separated by a floor, which can be annoying. For instance, the leg extension machine is on the yop floor, but the squat racks are on the floor below. Also, there is a tendency for broken machines to become broken more often than would be good, and stay broken longer than is ideal. On the whole, however, this is good value for money. One note is that while the gym is open 24 hours a day, the changing rooms and showers are not. They open at around 5 (no idea when they close).
showerReviews.author: Barry Robinson

showerReviews.reviewText: A great gym, especially for the price! It‚Äôs massive space with excellent ventilation. EVERYTHING WORKS and there‚Äôs multiples of most of the equipment. The studio is also huge and there‚Äôs plenty of Parking space. You‚Äôll need to bring a padlock for the lockers and there‚Äôs a vending machine with a few drinks. Loving the Sauna, it‚Äôs honestly the icing on the cake.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great space, open layout, and very clean!
Special mention to the lady who cleans on Sundays she does a fantastic job. Honestly, give her a pay rise.

The gym has a good selection of equipment, including seated hamstring curls (which some other gyms weirdly don‚Äôt have).

That said, the hip thrust machines and benches are rubbish . They‚Äôve got about four or five, but they‚Äôre all awkward and uncomfortable. Maybe look at what Moorways Gym or Nuffield use the ones with plates on either side and proper padding.

Also, there‚Äôs only one hanging leg raise/dip station for the entire gym, and it‚Äôs always in use. Would be great if management added another one (and maybe a few more gymnastic rings too).

The volume of the music can be hit or miss. Sometimes it‚Äôs loud, and if you‚Äôre under a speaker it can get really loud. Other times it‚Äôs at a decent level (would be great if it stayed that way all the time). Still, it‚Äôs miles better than my previous gym in that respect.

Pricing is really good, great offers and genuinely affordable memberships. That does mean you occasionally get a group of kids messing about, probably until their pocket money runs out.

One real gripe though: how can you call yourself 24/7 if the changing rooms close from 12‚Äì5am? PureGym manages to stay open and keep their changing rooms accessible, so that‚Äôs something to fix if JD wants to live up to the 24/7 claim.

The parking bays are quite tight, which can be a bit annoying when it‚Äôs busy but that‚Äôs just me being picky.

Overall, great value for money, clean, and well-equipped just needs a few small improvements to make it a proper 5-star gym.
showerReviews.author: Jame Cole

showerReviews.reviewText: The showers are the push-button type that only run for about 10 seconds at a time. They used to be warm enough, but now in winter the water isn‚Äôt hot, and during those 10 seconds you suddenly get blasts of cold water. It makes it impossible to have a comfortable shower. Might be time to look for another gym if this isn‚Äôt fixed.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently upgraded my JD+ membership to the higher tier and switched my home gym to Derby for work reasons. My first visit went smoothly, but on my second visit the following week I had a very frustrating experience.
I arrived just after 6:30 and couldn‚Äôt get in‚Äîneither my QR code nor my membership number worked. I pressed the help button several times and waited about 35 minutes before I was eventually let in by the manager. She was teaching a class and could clearly see me outside but made no effort to buzz me in. When she finally came over, there was no apology‚Äîjust the explanation that ‚Äú5G doesn‚Äôt work because of the tin roof‚Äù and I should have connected to the WiFi. Because of the delay, I only managed a 12-minute workout before needing to shower and get ready for work.
On the way out, I had the exact same issue. Even when connected to WiFi, the system still didn‚Äôt work, and I had to ask the manager again to let me out. Again, no apology.
I‚Äôve since heard that I can buy day passes at other gyms, so for days I want to train with my friend (we‚Äôre preparing for Hyrox), I‚Äôll be going to her gym instead. Even though it‚Äôs not as well equipped as JD, at least I won‚Äôt risk wasting my time stuck outside.
The equipment here is very good‚Äîthat‚Äôs the only reason I‚Äôve given 2 stars instead of 1. Customer service, unfortunately, was extremely poor.
showerReviews.author: W Cams

conflicting opening hours on google and there own web site
showerReviews.author: Gary Royle

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice place to park and facilities are great - Cafe and showers.

However the lady in the shop by the barrier hasn't got any customer skills. Pulled up here last night really tired, when I went to pay she was busy on her private phone, after she eventually ended a long conversation she continued to ignore me by talking to someone else who wasn't in need of service.

Thank god for the security bloke realising that I was stood there like a lemon wanted to pay for parking. Man saved the situation.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Brilliant!
My mate jason introduced me to this truckstop as he knows people who work in here from down in Weymouth ,he said it was 10/10 and was spot on.
Your always greeted with a smile at the gate to book in from 24/7 security and then chaperoned to your space by the bubbley banksman.
Once settled in your in theres no traffic in n out all night its super quiet with no fridges!!  Very clean Great  showers with a seperate personal changing room to freshen up after a long days trucking.Then you can go into the nice truckers restaurant for a home cooked meal from the extensive menu.There is a pool table n dart board with nice sofas and a huge tv to relax also.
Self service complimentary hot drinks toast provided through the night with some chocolate snacks to start the day off."dont take the piss as some "truckers have apparently "!!
All in all a truckstop built for  truckers and one of the very best in uk . üòäüòäüëåüèºüëåüèº

showerReviews.reviewText:
Brilliant truck stop!

5 minutes from the M1 in a secure, quiet and spacious place. Friendly and helpful staff with snap account welcome.

No cafe as such but there is an on-site catering van serving until 8pm with a good choice of food and looks nice and hygienic.

There is free tea, coffee and biscuits after 8pm along with a tv room and pool table.

Toilets and showers are very clean.
Hidden gem of a place.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely amazing place. Yes it's get full fast, yes it's on a slope  in some places..... but.... food is absolutely winner 10/10

Top price (as you have a few options) is ¬£35 with ¬£12 food voucher. Other options  are for ¬£6/¬£31  and so on. ¬£ 12  feed you everything  from menu apart from fully monty grill  ¬£15.95
Food menu is massive,including  burgers,curry,kebabs,home made pizza sandwiches  and so on. Food is awesome!  Trucker next to me said they try to kill you with the size of those portions. I saw different  platters out and all was great and when ask all said amazing. So a big shout out to a kitchen staff!

All place  very clean and tidy, don't forget to take token for a shower(7min plenty enough)  shower  room with massive space and regulated temperature of water üòéüí¶üòç so in summer - winner.

Staff mostly  very friendly  and kind, one bad egg but it might  be not his day so I won't  blame or judge  his life  on that. We all had it.

If by any  chance  I will be around, even  for a sneaky 45 I will be there!

I would recommend it 100%

showerReviews.reviewText: They say they don‚Äôt accept running frigos that is why I payed in advance to rest here for two nights. After we parked, I was BLOCKED by a running frigo and I couldn‚Äôt move forward or backward. It was my favorite parking and I used to park here all the time since 2016, now I avoid it. The mushrooms chicken was not cooked enough, I didn‚Äôt send it back because it was impossible to do anything about it after that and I didn‚Äôt want to find some ‚Äòspices‚Äô added. They couldn‚Äôt provide me the bank card receipt which I needed. And the showers are good, but they should have start/stop buton, especially for women, 7-8 minutes it is not enough, or at least it should play the sound one minute before ending, not when the water stops so we are able to rinse.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stopped off here for a bite to eat, in our motorhome.
Although it's a truckstop car's and Motorhomes are welcome here.
If you want to stop overnight during the week you would have to pay the HGV rate, which is around ¬£23. At weekends the price is negotiable, although the cafe isn't open, but there are still toilets, showers and 24 hour security.
Everything was very clean.
The food was good home cooked meals, which were huge and piping hot. I had the special sauagemeat and sage pie, with mashed potatoes, cabbage, carrots, peas and gravy, plus 2 slices of bread and butter and a mug of tea, lovely.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice little family run truck stop, quiet parking with security that walk around so you feel safe. I didn't use the showers so can't comment on that. Only 1 toilet at bottom of park, however I did see more toilets at the top end and the lady told me they weren't currently plumbed in yet. So would be nice to see them all working soon. Pub right behind the lorry park which do alright food, again however the park do have a food van which I've heard is really nice. Not sure on the prices. Park on snap and I believe there's no food vouchers but the parking is quite cheap anyway. They should definitely invest in some nice toilets and shower rooms, meaby they already are. I don't know. Staff were really helpful and friendly, nice greetings when you arrive !
Thank you bardon truck park üòÄ.

showerReviews.reviewText: Amenities itself are fine, but as a lorry driver, when I heard about "the best motorway services in the UK" I expected much after the showers which was a big, big disappointment. The most basic showers I ever seen, just bench and shower. No basin, no shavers socket, no mirror. What's more, there was no hot water (I tried 2 cubicles) so finally I haven't used them. If you travelling north, use Newport Pagnell services showers, which looks like a 5 star hotel compared to those.

locations.title: Moto Blyth
locations.address: ÓÉàHill Top Roundabout, A1(M), A614 S81 8HG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: What can I say that hasn't already been said? Well let me start with this, there is ample room for walking your dog,  fairly large amount of undulating terrain arranged in such a way that simulates a reasonable route around half the perimeter of the services itself. Granted it's not particularly scenic but it's next to a motorway so what do you expect? The rolling hills of Scotland? Furthermore I found the inside of the service station to be exactly as I've come to expect from a services. Unfortunately nothing sets it apart from the others but that's not to say there's anything wrong with it. I had a burger king meal, someone tried to claim it as their own when the number was called out but I can't put that on the service station, the good lady had a wrap from M&S which was likely fine. I've marked the services down a star because I used the wash room and found the smell to be rather pungent, of unrine. Now this isn't uncommon I know and probably expected, I'm willing to review this later on in life when I return. But until then it's a soild 4. Which does put in it my top 10 of services in the UK (northern half) Stay say.
showerReviews.author: Ed Manley

showerReviews.reviewText: I‚Äôve been asked to elaborate on my rating and in fairness, I should have done so originally. Arriving on a wet busy Twixmas afternoon, the service station was really busy, floors wet, tables needed a clean down and the general feeling was pretty meh. That said, I can imagine on a warm summers day with more people sitting outside it may have an entirely different feeling to the place. But our visit, on this day, was just a bit meh. Long queue to get into the car park to find there were in fact lots of spaces but the layout meant people parking caused tailbacks. Three staff wearing hi vis, apparently there to assist with parking, standing doing nothing. Two on their phones, one standing with a sign stating Spaces Here but not holding it aloft meant no one could see it.  The bathrooms were wet and there were papers littered on the floor in the cubicle, with a wet seat and not in the best condition as a result. We‚Äôve all been there, and even hourly checks would have struggled to keep the cloakrooms up to scratch on a wet busy day, and ultimately, it‚Äôs down to the users to make an effort. Visited the food shop and grabbed a burger meal (dry burger and bland fries)and staff were pretty indifferent.  The service station itself provided a service but it‚Äôs a splash and dash, not one I would want to take a break at, particularly compared with others on the same south to north road trip.
showerReviews.author: Lorna W

showerReviews.reviewText: A small service station but it has a few areas to buy food. The bathrooms were extremely clean with the rest of the areas. When I was washing my hands I saw a staff member to say thank you for the cleanliness but when I'd finished the lady had moved and I couldn't find her. The staff that we saw were all very friendly. The staff in Greggs worked tightly as a team with every customer been served quickly and got breakfast sandwiches handed out quickly (the sandwich fillings were lovely and hot.) Lots of electric charging points. We will definitely use this service station again.

locations.address: ÓÉà8, M5, Strensham, Worcester WR8 0BZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Visited today, I have been a few times to stop for a shower whilst on my 45 min break / daily rest. Waited 20 minutes to use the only female shower as it was in use. To my disbelief a man came out, I did ask him what he was doing in the only female shower when there were several male showers, he said a showers a shower & 'genders don't matter anymore'. This is disgusting, not only is there one shower for women, but its so easily accessible for anyone. Shower floods and the sink and toilet were an absolute state. Shower doesnt last long so you have to keep pressing it. I'm not going to lie it is probably one of the better showers ive been too however it's still not great. There is plenty of room to park & I like the variety of food outlets. However this experience is bad enough for me to complain about it. Around 1500hrs 17/7/25 I went to shower.
showerReviews.author: Lauren O'Shea

showerReviews.reviewText: The hotel is modern, a nice design with comfortable and spacious rooms. Good amenities in the room including a rainforest style shower head and a traditional handheld shower head. Good section of coffee with Nespresso pods and biscuits. The hotel is located next to the Tigers rugby ground and an easy 15 minute walk to the railway station and city centre for shops. Parking is available but it‚Äôs chargeable and not a big area. Breakfast is a usual buffet selection as well as selected items you can order. The downsides was dirty plates had not been cleaned away and many tables not used because of that. Staff in the hotel unfortunately let my stay down from being all 5 stars. Nobody was rude, just did the absolute minimum. Otherwise a great experience.

locations.title: SNG (Sovereign Network Group) Key worker accommodation
locations.address: ÓÉàElm Court, Walnut St, Leicester LE2 7GJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good spot overall. I'm happy with it. Not many doctors stick around for more than 6 months. The rent covers everything including the utility, council tax and 40mbps internet.
Setting up direct debit is a breeze.
Security is solid, but watch those keys to avoid lockouts. During the day, no issues, but after hours, it can get pricey to regain access unless you have a flatmate connection.

The washing machine is fantastic. They have a dryer too. All included.

It's a quiet place with plenty of parking for cars and bikes. There's also a bicycle shed. Plus, it's close to LRI and the gym.

I've shared first 3 pics of single room, all to yourself. And next 4 pics of double room which can be used for family with your own spacious kitchen. Then finally the rest of the pics are the single room in a shared 4-bed flat. The study table there is a 55cm table. The kitchen is shared, I got a welcome kit when I moved in. The washing machine and dryers are on the ground floor and you need to time it well to find an empty machine to use. Weekends are the worst for this.
showerReviews.author: Abhinav Kumar

showerReviews.reviewText:
Room: was very clean and well maintained and I got a welcoming package with 2 towels, toilet paper, a nice pen, and a couple of coffee/tea bags; efficient soundproofing; very useful and handy sink in room; enough storage (especially if you are staying any where around 1-3 months)
Kitchen: everything worked well and there was a fan oven; very clean; the fridge was TOO small for a 4-bed appartement; OKAY-ish amount of utensils but wok was rusty/not useable and some essential utensils were missing such as a can opener, for example.
Bathroom & toilets: very clean but had a tiny amount of mould; water pressure was about right.
Laundry service: free and available on site 24/7. Washers and Dryers are big and you can do a few weeks laundry in one go.
Reception services: amazing! I was let in hours before the usual check-in time; got my packages signed for and kept safe; very friendly and helpful staff.
A cleaning lady came on a weekly basis to clean common areas/bleach the toilets and leave some garbage bags (one week nothing was cleaned for some reason).
Overall: a very convenient place to stay short term if you are starting work at LRI or visiting for another reason. I would recommend.
showerReviews.author: Aya Mbj

showerReviews.reviewText: The accommodation itself is awful. Dirty, unkempt and way too small for the capacity, as other tenants do not respect shared space or maintaining cleanliness in the house. Doors constantly slamming shut (no respite) with no sound proofing. Showers were always cold and there were silverfish and mould in the bathroom. I'd think the price would be low for this standard but it's very expensive for the low quality accomodation. Glad I left when I did but would NOT recommend staying here (unless you are desperate and there's literally no other place you can find). Only good thing was location.

locations.address: ÓÉà40-72 Western Rd, Leicester LE3 0GH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
If you‚Äôre thinking of booking this accommodation and want a plain, simple, honest review, this is it.

This is genuinely one of the worst places you could ever book, and you will regret it with every fibre of your being. I stayed at The Code Classics, Flat 3, 18 Lancaster Road, and if you‚Äôre considering this specific accommodation, it will be one of the worst decisions you can make.

The insulation is awful. The flat is always cold no matter how long you leave the heating on. When I arrived, the condition of the place was shocking: unfinished cupboards that still haven‚Äôt been fixed, a towel heater so dirty you wouldn‚Äôt put anything near it, structural damage to the roof, and many more issues that made it clear the room had not been properly prepared or maintained.

If you‚Äôre thinking of booking this place, save yourself the stress and don‚Äôt do it. There are plenty of better options in Leicester, and the cheap price is misleading because the electricity bills make it cost just as much as any other accommodation.
showerReviews.author: samiat onafuwa

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and highly recommend if you are looking to recharge in nature.

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed for 2 nights at the end of half term. booked two pitches for myself and extended family - many of whom were first timers. Bell tent provided was already set up for us and spacious - a lovely way to camp. Fire pit and bench also in situ in both pitches which were nicely laid out. Toilets and electric showers all plumbed and kept in good working order. The support provided when needed was great. Hot water always available. Popular with families and anglers and locals coming for coffee and pizzas. Pizzas are really good and a welcome treat.  Dishwashing facilities, fridges and freezer and firewood are all available in the communal play and living space provided (as well as charger points) - this would keep you dry during wet weather too. There is no wifi and phone signal on site which is a bonus to help switch off. Comms from Mark were excellent. Would recommend and visit again. Kids really enjoyed it and asked to come back!
showerReviews.author: Benjamin Chik

showerReviews.reviewText:
Being the owner of a small camper van I‚Äôm a big fan of wild camping and I know the frustration of not being able to find such places.So i can imagine what it‚Äôs like for someone with a metal detector when they find a bit of treasure because that‚Äôs what it felt like for me when I found Emily‚Äôs Cut camping ground with water supply,cold shower & a portaloo which is cleaned on a regular basis.Also there is a lovely village pub just a 20 minute walk away which serves good food and are very welcoming.
This site is level cut grass area of approx 2 acres,perfect for groups of friends,family‚Äôs & pets.The only thing about hidden gems like this is they don‚Äôt stay hidden for very  long.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely perfect place to camp for both big and small groups looking for privacy and freedom.

My group of 12 stayed for four nights and Absolutely loved our time on site.

For a start the space is incredibly large, kept clean and tidy and surrounded by hedgerow for complete privacy.

The comfort of easy road access and parking right next to your tent cannot be overstated.

In terms of facilities there are picnic tables to congregate around and a large fire pit to use throughout your stay. The 2 portaloos were clean and easily accessible, as were the drinking water tap and cold shower cubicle.

We enjoyed a meal at the local pub, trips into Leicester and as well visits to Bradgate Deer Park and Rutland Water and still felt we scratched the surface of the surrounding area.

All in all this site is perfect should you want your own space and Andy made booking it a breeze. I intend to make use of Emily's Cut again and suggest you try it too.
showerReviews.author: James Wayne

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely perfect place to camp for both big and small groups looking for privacy and freedom.

My group of 12 stayed for four nights and Absolutely loved our time on site.

For a start the space is incredibly large, kept clean and tidy and surrounded by hedgerow for complete privacy.

The comfort of easy road access and parking right next to your tent cannot be overstated.

In terms of facilities there are picnic tables to congregate around and a large fire pit to use throughout your stay. The 2 portaloos were clean and easily accessible, as were the drinking water tap and cold shower cubicle.

We enjoyed a meal at the local pub, trips into Leicester and as well visits to Bradgate Deer Park and Rutland Water and still felt we scratched the surface of the surrounding area.

All in all this site is perfect should you want your own space and Andy made booking it a breeze. I intend to make use of Emily's Cut again and suggest you try it too.
showerReviews.author: James Wayne

showerReviews.reviewText:
We booked Emily's Cut as a base for a stag do where people were coming from all over the country. Everyone who came (even those anxious about camping) commented on what a great find it was; most couldn't quite believe how ideal it was!

Because it's an exclusive use site we were able to spread out and not have to worry about bothering other campers - perfect for a lads weekend away, and good for those who wanted to slope off to bed "early", as they could go to the quieter end of the field.

We had a mix of campers and tents, and everyone was happy.

It's basic - a couple of portaloos and a cold shower (that only the northerners in the group braved!) - but it's all we needed. There's also a big fire pit which we were able to get some fantastic fires going on, picnic benches, garden chairs and a BBQ.

We spent most of the weekend drinking and eating in the field, but there's also paintball and excellent go-karting (Stretton Circuit) near by. The pub in the nearby village (Rose & Crown, Tilton on the Hill) is only a 15 minute walk away, and is brilliant.

Highly recommend and, if we ever have the need for a large group of people from all over the country to meet up again, we'll definitely be back!
showerReviews.author: Dave Stockdale

showerReviews.reviewText:
Emily's Cut camp ground is the gem that no one knows about!
I‚Äôve stayed there multiple times with friends, family, even alone with my dog and it has remained one of my favorite escapes.
The camping ground is located in the heart of Leicestershire, about 20mins walk on a public footpath through fields from Tilton on the Hill where there is all the important things like a pub for a late afternoon pint and a small deli style shop for bacon butties on a Sunday morning when you don‚Äôt feel like making breakfast.
The site is for private group hire only which means there is no privacy issues or someone telling you to keep quiet if you decide to stay up till late!
It is a decent size, around 2 acres of nicely cut grass with high hedgerows that provide privacy from all around. There are space for around 20+ tents and loads of room to park cars.
The amenities are basic with a communal tap for drinking water and a cold shower, for the ones who need to "cool down", if you know what I mean. A chem loo is provided and professionally cleaned on a weekly basis.
The 2 massive pub style benches can easily seat 10 people on each which is handy, come dinner and breakfast time.
There is enough room to kick a rugby ball around and it has been known to see bottle rockets flying around to entertain the kids.
Dusk brings out the wildlife, that is, if you are quiet enough and the pheasants and rabbits don't notice any movement, also lookout for the muntjac's and predatory birds, plenty around.
Bring your own fire wood! There is a dedicated area to make a decent size bonfire and enough room for all to sit round.
Your location allows for spectacular views of the night sky, and on a clear night the sky is packed with stars due to the distance from the nearest city and on 2 occasions we have spotted the space station going by.
The owner is an "old" rugby player and very much down to earth, so bookings and payments are quickly dealt with, without any hidden catches.
Take what you need and don‚Äôt forget to clean up after yourself to preserve the unspoiled beauty of our countryside.
I would thoroughly recommend Emily's cut for a relaxing, no fuzz weekend or a few days more!
showerReviews.author: Herman Combrinck

showerReviews.reviewText:
We booked Emily's Cut for a weekend celebrating a significant birthday and anniversary with family and friends. We had 10 families camping in tents and vans and others that just joined us for the day. There would have been space for plenty more.

This is a lovely private field with a high hedgerows for privacy and a few mature trees throughout to give a bit of character. It's a basic camping experience with 2 clean portaloos, a drinking water tap and cold shower in a semi private cubicle. There are two very large picnics benches and a fire pit for your own wood.

For the children there's an old trampoline and a giant plastic tube, plenty of space to run around and it's secure so no need to constantly watch little ones.

Some of our group enjoyed meals at the local pub, others spent time exploring Oakham (Tesco 15mins drive) and some had a country walk and popped into the village church.

The one thing that would help improve it would be to provide a bin/recycling. However we knew we would have to take rubbish home so it wasn't a problem.
showerReviews.author: Ruth Fry

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just had an absolutely wonderful time at Emily‚Äôs Cut with 13 friends. For those who are looking for a place with some privacy in a incredibly scenic location with a shop nearby (Co-op in Houghton on the hill) this is perfect for you.

With drinking water, two well maintained Port-a-loos and a Shower all the essentials are available for the more seasoned camper.

The site is a comfortable size, perfect to house cars and tents and to chuck a frisbee or kick a ball around!

I can‚Äôt recommend Emily‚Äôs Cut enough, I‚Äôll certainly be returning soon.
showerReviews.author: Sean

showerReviews.reviewText:
Harry is a fantastic host - sending through plenty of instructions and information in advance.

Campers should be aware that the facilities are pretty basic - composting toilets and cold showers - but if that doesn't bother you and you like getting back to nature then it's a fantastic setting.

Harry generously shares his ornate garden, which is simply stunning - a bit like having your own botanical garden - and also his own swimming pool, which was thoroughly enjoyed by us all.

A lovely spot and we'll definitely return.

Thanks Harry.
showerReviews.author: Matt W

locations.title: Fire & Stars Woodland Camping
locations.address: ÓÉàNethercote Wood, Snarestone Rd, Newton Burgoland, Coalville LE67 2SN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I was skeptical about camping in the wood because I've only ever pitched on grass before. However, we spent a wonderful weekend with friends and their children (7 kids aged between 9 & 3 years) among the trees at Fire and Stars. It was perfect. We were sheltered from the very hot sun and also the wind. The fire pits are a great touch, we love a camp fire. The kids had a blast hunting for beasts in the woods and making friends with other campers kids. I didn't use the showers at the pub, but those that did said how nice they were. The toilets were clean and the staff welcoming. We didn't see any other campers unless we went to the public areas, it was bliss. Will be returning next summer when we've picked a date.
showerReviews.author: sariofthepie

showerReviews.reviewText: I was skeptical about camping in the wood because I've only ever pitched on grass before. showerReviews.reviewText:
Came for three nights, with my husband and two boys, 13 & 10. My husband came last year with our eldest and they wanted our youngest and I to come and stay to experience it as they loved it so much. And now I can confirm, it was very enjoyable. The site is beautiful, nicely maintained. We had a family pitch which was large with a fire pit and included a little picnic bench with roof. Washing up area was very handy, they're located next to the porter toilets.
We were next to the communal playing field which was fun, we played football and badminton which are supplied in a games box. There are ride on cars which are popular with the kiddies. There's two small cute play areas one with a car track and next to that a little play treehouse. And a book shelter if you wanted to borrow a book to read.
We had a go at disc golf (twice!) which is a nice short walk through the site to get to. Never played that before was lots of fun, small cost to it.
We love nature and being outdoors we had a great time.
We will definitely come back, the staff are very friendly. Andy is a wonderful.
showerReviews.author: KirstyMay

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText: Such a lovely spacious woodland campsite. We loved the no music campsite it really made us appreciate the beautiful sounds of the woodlands. This campsite was so easy to find. Andy was very friendly and helpful. Me and my family of 9 shared two pitches at a great price so much space for all 5 of our tents. There was lots to keep us all entertained the box full of sports equipment was a good idea. We all enjoyed a brilliant game of disc golf at a very good price. Lots of space to walk around and explore in the forest campsite we didn't even get to see it all. Great that there's a pub straight across the road with showers for campers to use. Thanks for a lovely memorable camping trip would definitely visit again
showerReviews.author: Kayleigh Bettney

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed for one night on the way back to Essex from completing the NC500 the site/field was perfect and the Farm shop right opposite was a great bonus with lots of fantastic produce and a great cafe/restaurant. The shower pod was very clean with a great shower although there only being two could see them being very busy if the site was full. If in the area again we would definitely return.

showerReviews.reviewText: Manor Farm campsite is a lovely campsite with good-sized, all grass pitches, which is open for all camping options.  They welcome dogs on site so long as they are kept on leads.  On site there is two shower/toilets which are kept clean, tidy and operational.  Over the road is a fabulously stocked farm shop and the Farmhouse Kitchen, serving from breakfast through to late afternoon tea, and other delicious treats.  Full compliments to all the wonderful staff who offer you a warm welcome and where nothing is too much trouble.  We were reluctant to write this review in fear of Manor Farm becoming so popular that we struggle to get a pitch!!!
showerReviews.author: Julie Morris

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed here for the last Saturday and Sunday in July. Given this is high season the site was quiet, relaxed and the pitch spacious.
The owners were both helpful and friendly. The loo‚Äôs and showers, although limited (2 only) were clean and mostly tidy. The pitches varied, some flat and some sloping. The farm shop and restaurant opposite was a great addition. We enjoyed Sunday lunch there and it was excellent value.
On the downside the charge of ¬£8.00 for electric hook up per day seemed exorbitant. I  say that because the last site we stayed at had electric meters where you paid for exactly the amount of electricity used. This cost us ¬£2.80 for two nights.
Overall we enjoyed our time and would definitely stay again.
showerReviews.author: Martin Williams

showerReviews.reviewText:
Recently camped here for the weekend, we had a lovely time despite the weather..
campsite is big with very spacious pitches. Toilets and showers were very clean and very well maintained throughout our stay, very modern compared to some.
Water was very hot. Pot washing area and clean drinking water was available.. good lighting once it got dark in the evening. Fire pits and logs are also available to rent and buy from the farm shop.
lovely views and a nice quiet area..
farm shop is brilliant with a good range of local fresh produce and the farm shop kitchen was brilliant with fresh cooked food.
You feel like you‚Äôre in the middle of nowhere, but in fact the local town is just a few miles away. Over and just eat also deliver to the main gate.
Secure gate and secure site if you want to bring your fur babies.
We where part of a large group with a mix of tents and caravans so we had the entire campsite to ourself for the weekend. Staff are friendly and very welcoming.
We will be definitely returning again.
We had a lovely stay. A***
showerReviews.author: Hannah Ineson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Manor Farm is a great campsite. Situated in a lovely field overlooking beautiful countryside.
The site was very well managed but felt relaxed.
The  shower/ toilet cabin was kept beautifully clean and it was nice they were heated when it got a bit chilly outside
The farm shop and restaurant are just across the road and sell fresh local produce and offer a good range of food and great coffee.
All the staff were so helpful and welcoming. I hope my travels will take me there again.
showerReviews.author: jane priest

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great weekend away again at Fortway Farm Leisure & Fishery.
Lovely to get away with the parents again!

Not the biggest of carp but every one is in such great condition and so well cared for!  My 7 year old had 9 tiddlers on her float rod... all at a lovely site that i can't recommend highly enough. Good clean facilities, really friendly owners. And a well kept, well stocked lake.

Really looking forward to the next one

showerReviews.reviewText: We arrived at the gate and phoned the number to get in. We were welcomed and directed to where we could pitch up. We had a brief induction of where things were and the rules and paid a ¬£5 deposit for the shower block key. The toilets and showers were clean and well maintained. There was a nice undercover area around the back door washing up. There's a code to open the gate when you enter and leave the site and they ask you to wait until the gate has closed before you drive off. The gate opened and closed really slowly.  We had access to fresh water and a metered electricity supply. We paid less than ¬£2 for a 3 night stay.
showerReviews.author: simon boor

showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently stayed at this fantastic campsite just a short drive from the Stoney Stanton diving site, and it exceeded all our expectations. It‚Äôs a perfect spot for families, especially those with active kids.

The site is well laid out with spacious electric pitches, and everything is clean and well-maintained. The toilets and showers were spotless throughout our stay, which made the experience even more comfortable.

One of the best features for families is the range of activities for children. There are proper football goals set up in a large open area, which kept the kids entertained for hours. There‚Äôs also a fun and safe bike track where they could ride freely. For the adults (and keen little anglers), the fishing lakes were a peaceful and scenic bonus.

The owners were incredibly friendly and made us feel welcome from the moment we arrived. They clearly take pride in the site and go out of their way to ensure guests have a great stay.

A lovely surprise was the breakfast wagon onsite ‚Äì perfect for a lazy morning with a hot coffee and a bacon roll without having to cook.

Overall, this campsite offers a brilliant mix of relaxation and fun. It‚Äôs a great base whether you're diving at Stoney Cove, fishing, or just enjoying the countryside with your family.

Rating: 5/5 ‚Äì Highly recommended for families and outdoor lovers!
showerReviews.author: Connor

showerReviews.reviewText:
An Absolute Gem ! A Perfect Weekend Retreat!
Fortway Farm is hands down one of our favourite weekend getaways. It ticks every box: peaceful, well maintained, and packed with thoughtful touches that set it apart from other sites.
The fishing lake is beautifully kept and genuinely tranquil, ideal for unwinding. The spacious green area is a real highlight, complete with football goals and a small pump track that‚Äôs perfect for children‚Äôs BMXs and e-bikes. Our kids absolutely love it. It‚Äôs clear a lot of care has gone into making this a fun, safe, and family-friendly site.
Dog owners will be happy to know it‚Äôs fully dog friendly. The team that runs the place are outstanding, warm, welcoming, and always willing to help. Security is excellent too, with a large electronic gate giving added peace of mind.
Another bonus! There are two fantastic pubs within walking distance. Stanton Lakes is just a short stroll away and offers a great pub with a lovely atmosphere and a fantastic tapas restaurant. Or, take the scenic dog-friendly walk across the local fields to Stoney Stanton, where you‚Äôll find a brilliant pub with bistro-style food and beautiful views over the lake.
On-site catering is also great. A food van often serves up delicious evening meals (we‚Äôve had excellent fish and chips here) and breakfast cobs in the mornings. The wash block is modern, spotless, and clearly maintained to a high standard.
Whether you‚Äôre after a relaxing fishing weekend, a child-friendly adventure spot, or a quiet break with the dog, Fortway Farm really does have it all. We‚Äôll be back again and again.
showerReviews.author: aaron granger

showerReviews.reviewText: This was our first time in our new caravan and what a great site. We had a very warm welcome from the owners John and Katie and were directed to our pitch, after first putting some credit on our electric card. The pitches are serviced and hard standing with water and electric on the post and a drain in the corner for grey water. Our pitch was divided from our neighbours by a young hedge,  which will in time provide more privacy. The toilets and showers were amazing,  very clean and well kept. We will definitely be returning and the Saturday night we were there, they had a fundraiser for the local nature reserve,  that had a band and food on the Garden centre restaurant.

All staff are very friendly and the cafe is well worth a visit, all cakes are made on site, by young staff. We will visit again . Showers and toilet block has central heating and there is disability parking.

showerReviews.reviewText: A lovely warm welcome and really nice clean facilities, excellent farm shop with a cafe on site too. All the pitches are either grass or hard standing and all with electric hook up as well. locations.title: Proctors Park
locations.address: ÓÉàProctor's Park Rd, Barrow upon Soar LE12 8QF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very much a residential park and not touring.
The whole place is tired. Seems to be a lot of junk and rubbish around and loads of seemingly abandoned caravans. There seems to be a lot of permanent residents who were friendly so the place must have some positive points but we couldnt find them.
Toilets - very old, smelly but relatively clean.  The bar looked abandoned. Found only one chemical disposal point on the whole site.
Didnt find showers & wouldnt have used then given state of rest of the place.
A6 is nearby and very loud as is the music at night from the pub just outside the site but that could have been where we sited.
Shame really, this place should be a star and could be  with some money spent on it.
Had to call a mobile on arrival as no one was about and were more or less told to find a pitch and get on with it. Didnt see anyone all weekend which wasnt really a problem.
In summary -
Was it okay ?  Only just
Would we go again - God, No!
showerReviews.author: Andrew Cooke

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed for two nights. Toilets were smelly but relatively clean.
The "Club House" looked run-down from the outside and said "Cash Only" on the door so we never went in. Didn't see a shower block and the chemical toilet disposal point was not near the toilet block, no signage [for one] either! I wouldn't bring a young family here. It's a shame because there are plenty of things to do nearby with good pubs, cafes, shops, takeaways and restaurants within walking distance.

Showers x2 ( male + female and one excess able ) , lovely and hot .

I would thoroughly recommend this site for walkers and those that want to explore.
All pitches have electricity and water

Other than that, highly recommended.

Mostly, the waterpark provided a good environment for us to relax.

locations.title: Derby Leisure Fitness Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàThe Pavillion, Moor Ln, Allenton, Derby DE24 9HY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
GOOD POINTS:

Great little gym, hardly any waiting around for equipment, and most machines are generally available. Plenty of both HIT and free weight machines available.
We seen to have a high turnover of staff, though they are always around when you need them

BAD POINT;

Needs cleaning, place is a tip! Paper rolls are always empty, and never get refilled. New comers don't seem to know how to work machines, and then never wipe down afterwards!!

Oh.... and the changing room, just gets overtaken by the badminton players which come in and dump all their bags and belongings on the few benches we have and then leave them there for half an hour why are they going to the sauna! So nobody can use the benches and get changed!

But apart from fighting for a space in which you can get changed after your session, this is a very very quiet gym, with pleasant staff and members.

There are always loads of free parking right outside the gym.
showerReviews.author: sammy geezer

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited David Lloyd and really enjoyed the spa and swimming facilities. The pool area was clean and relaxing, and the spa felt like a great place to unwind.

The women‚Äôs changing room was very tidy and well looked after, which made the experience even better.

The overall atmosphere was welcoming and calm, and it felt like a nice space to spend time in. A really good visit, and I‚Äôd be happy to go back.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been a member at David Lloyd Derby for a little while now and honestly can‚Äôt fault it. The facilities are top notch ‚Äì everything is spotless, modern and really well looked after. The gym itself has a huge variety of equipment, whether you‚Äôre into weights, cardio or functional training, and there‚Äôs always enough space so you‚Äôre not queuing to use machines.

The classes are brilliant too. There‚Äôs such a wide range to choose from ‚Äì spin, yoga, HIIT, bodypump ‚Äì and the instructors are genuinely motivating and friendly, they make you want to push yourself but also make it enjoyable.

One of the big highlights for me is the pool and spa area. The indoor pool is perfect for proper lane swimming, while the outdoor pool feels like a treat in the summer. The sauna, steam room and jacuzzi are a great way to wind down after a workout.

The staff deserve a special mention ‚Äì from reception through to the trainers, they‚Äôre always welcoming, professional and approachable if you need advice. It gives the place a real community feel rather than just being ‚Äúa gym‚Äù.

It is on the premium side price-wise, but you definitely get what you pay for: a full fitness, wellness and leisure experience all under one roof. If you‚Äôre looking for more than just a standard gym in Derby, David Lloyd is well worth it.
showerReviews.author: Robert Morrison

showerReviews.reviewText: Great gym, perhaps the best all round in Derby as it has a very impressive spa, 2 heated swimming pools and a well kitted out gym. The club area is good too, with reasonably priced food. However, it‚Äôs costly and you need to be sure you‚Äôll get value from it. Recommended.
showerReviews.author: Zachary Naylor

showerReviews.reviewText:
My family and I signed up on Easter Monday by Dylan and I've been there most days since. Dylan was very professional and thorough.

I love the range of kids clubs, and the lads that are there are always friendly.

I've had a couple of PT sessions with Izaac, he's very nice and friendly, knowledgeable and professional.

I enjoy using the gym. I have no previous gym experience but it seems well equipped to me.

I enjoy the swimming pools, and they've never been too busy, but be careful where your treading, there's a lot of bird poop and I've seen the same corn plaster every day for the past week.. I heard someone moaning in the changing rooms about kids jumping in and getting in the way. There's lanes that you can swim your lengths in. If you're not in a lane but in the family areas, then suck it up moaners and expect kids.

I thoroughly enjoy the spa. My favourite steam room is the amethyst crystal, but I do wonder how many other people's sweat I'm sat in, are they cleaned daily? The hydropool is amazing, a must after a gruelling workout with Izaac!

The changing rooms are ok, with little corner cubicles here and there. The cleaners are always around too. The showers stay on and you don't have to keep jabbing a button lol The changing room doesn't smell which is one reason I won't use Moorways; there's stink and I refuse to go there, if DL's had of stunk the same, I wouldn't have joined. Only thing is, I accidentally left my blue silicone beaded wristlet in the family changing room, photo of similar attached. If you have it, hand it in, I got it from a cruise ship and can't get another.
showerReviews.author: Emma Wardle

locations.address: ÓÉàHilton Rd, Etwall, Derby DE65 6HZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: This place is awful for your kids swimming lessons. They claim the teaching is superior to nearby centres but basically it‚Äôs a random number generator. They dropped my son‚Äôs swimming stage, he wasted a year having to go over the same stuff that two other centres were happy with. Then when his teacher changed, they deducted his progress again just because the new teacher was a little unsure. No communication. No proper governance, the changing room usually smells like an open gutter and when you complain, the swim manager doesn‚Äôt really care about any of it.
showerReviews.author: Bharat Lad

showerReviews.reviewText: I went here for swimming with my 2 year old. we went into the building. it was amazing I love the layout.then we proceeded to walk into the changing room and once in it was smelly and very hot and sweaty I there but I can't complain because people have been swimming and the smell was mostly chlorine which is needed in a pool. so I wasn't too concerned. we then went into a changing room with a baby changing table on there. (which is amazing by the way to have for parents who have children) we obviously got changed and I could smell something in the changing room. ours. I looked for anything that could do with the smell and then I opened the baby changing table and there was a full on open nappy which has been used. i just headed out and me and my son did our swimming and then went back in and got changed very quickly as I didn't want it to ruin our swimming trip. I once informed a member of staff and they helped me with the situation. lovely member of staff. I went back and got my things but checked it again and there was still a smudge of you probably know what. I just left as it isn't my issue. but I did have a lovely time overall except from the changing room part.
showerReviews.author: kelli osmorth

showerReviews.reviewText: The classes are great but the facilities need a serious facelift, the gym is tired and rundown, with old equipment that if often broken and takes months to be fixed. The roof leaks whenever it rains which is fixed by placing buckets around the floor... hazard tape is used as a permanent solution to any issues. The pool is closed at least once a week due to chemical issues and other reasons, the changing rooms are disgusting and the toilets always have a strong odour of sewage. Overall, the centre needs a real upgrade and facelift. It's disappointing to pay around ¬£40 per month just for classes as the gym is barely usable. Hopefully this feedback will be taken on board by the Active Nation group.
showerReviews.author: Jessica Harvey

locations.title: Trilogy Active at Belper Leisure Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàJohn O'Gaunts Way, Belper DE56 0DA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I've been going to Belper leisure centre for over 3 years now and for me it offers a lot for just over ¬£1/day on a monthly full membership. I use the swimming pool 2-3 times per week and they have increased public and lane swimming times over this summer which is greatly appreciated. Yes - the changing facilities could do with a make over, however I can see that they can't do everything at once. The newly refurbed gym looks great! I also use the sauna a lot and it's perfect for me and finally we've got a cold shower - hallelujah :-) The steam room on the other hand needs attention. It has a bizarre smell. I also go to fitness classes from time to time and Jacqui is really my hero when it comes to classes - whether it's yoga, pilates, dancing or body con - she rocks them all! This leisure centre ain't perfect, but what is?! I enjoy the laid back and friendly atmosphere and I'm glad they offer swim classes for the school and kids in general as well as other team sports sessions. It feels like a welcoming hub to me and that is what matters.
showerReviews.author: Rob

showerReviews.reviewText: July 2025, absolutely appalled by whoever has taken over the pool at BLC.  Used to enjoy a 2-3 hour swim regardless of public swim/family fun, now you are removed after only an hour or so and have to pay again to get back in to continue swimming.  Its NOT cheap for a family and is NOTHING like we used to enjoy.  Will NOT be using again.

I explained he is Autistic and needs my support - it was pondered over by the staff and it was decided we were disabled enough to use their disabled changing room üôÑ. Communication with this person was arduous and painful with a condescending undertone.
