showerReviews.reviewText:
Very disappointing experience. The equipment is often broken or poorly maintained, toilets stinks of piss constantly. Staff are unhelpful and seem more interested in chatting than assisting members, unless they like you or fancy you , Cleanliness is a big issue‚Äîlocker rooms are dirty and rarely stocked. For the price they charge, I expected much better. Would not recommend,
Also This gym has serious issues with staff behavior. Several employees were rude, unhelpful, and seemed uninterested in doing their jobs. Simple questions were met with attitude, and problems were never resolved. For the price, I expected much better service. Definitely not worth it.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I trained here for nearly a year and honestly wouldn‚Äôt recommend it. The gym feels dark and cramped, and most of the equipment was poorly maintained during my time there (see photos).

There‚Äôs no air conditioning downstairs just a large fan, which they‚Äôve recently started switching off, leaving everyone overheating. The fan itself looks unhygienic and could really use a clean.

Like many other reviews have said, the music is way too loud, and the management doesn‚Äôt seem to take customer feedback seriously.

There‚Äôs only one communal changing room, and it‚Äôs not clear whether it‚Äôs meant for men or women, which makes things uncomfortable.

Despite the ‚Äúworld-class‚Äù claim, it‚Äôs really just a budget gym with machines crammed together. There are definitely better options for the same price or less.
showerReviews.author: Jame Cole

showerReviews.reviewText: Incredible gym, by far the best gym in Notts/Derby area. The equipment is fantastic. As a smaller human, I often struggle with generic machines, but the equipment here is adjustable and suitable even for petite people. It's clean and spacious. The equipment is divided into areas, lots of variations of things to try, great for training compounds and accessories, plenty of weights, racks and machines. Functional area and boxing area upstairs. Lovely changing rooms, friendly staff, variety of shakes and snacks, music isn't too loud, free parking. (¬£25 pm for NHS staff! It's a steal!) (Day pass used to be ¬£5 but now ¬£7 but it's such great value for money). All round, good vibes.

showerReviews.reviewText: Not a great experience, visited this on a day pass to try the gym out after seeing their social media, their social media feels like a catfish. The gym is very run down, a lot of the equipment needs repairs/upholstering, everything felt very unmaintained, out of order toilets and showers, the areas with smaller footfall showed layers of dirt and dust. On arrival when asking for a day pass, no help from the people on the reception desk pretty much left to fend for yourself. Surely a small ‚Äòhave you been here before?‚Äô Question would help and then an offer to just show you around so you get the layout of the land. Seems to have a lack of gym equipment only seems to be one of each machine which I imagine at peak times would not be an enjoyable gym experience. Felt very small and cramped. Definitely needs some more attention, it feels like it‚Äôs been opened a year ago and just left to fend for itself no upkeep.

locations.title: ONE|DZ
locations.address: ÓÉàDarley Abbey Mills, Darley Abbey, Derby DE22 1DZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was a member at ONE|DZ for 2 years before moving and I have to say it is without a doubt the most well maintained, friendly and caring gym in Derby. Staff members consistently greeted me with a hello at the door and took the time to ask not only how my session was going, but my week in general! The community is second to none with everyone there having a real pride in place and a genuine love for ONE|DZ itself.

Personal trainers are incredibly knowledgeable and capable of assisting anyone no matter their individual age, fitness level or mobility, making it an ideal gym no matter who you are or what you want to do. James makes sure to run the operation like a well oiled machine with changing rooms, toilets and all equipment kept to a high standard of cleanliness.

In my 2 years of membership I can't think of a single bad experience I had there, thank you very much!
showerReviews.author: Cameron Redfern

showerReviews.reviewText:
THE GYM: I‚Äôve been training for a while and this is by far one of the best gyms I have ever been to. The equipment is well maintained and is good quality. The range of equipment is everything you need for a great work out. It‚Äôs clean and well organised.

ENVIRONMENT: The environment is great! Super friendly and not intimidating. The owner James is very friendly and down to earth. The music is varied, but always a good vibe.

FACILITIES: The showers and changing rooms are super clean and look high standard. Lockers are great. Plenty of toilets and they are always clean. Good range of supplements, energy drinks if you want to purchase them. PTs are all super friendly also.

PT: My PT is Jake. He is very knowledgeable and aligns my workouts with my fitness goals, so it‚Äôs personalised to what I need. He explains everything well and demonstrates the exercises. He continually will adjust workouts as I make progress and introduces me to new exercises despite me being in various gyms for a long time. Exercising in the proper way with Jake I‚Äôve seen massive improvements in the gym (muscle gain, fat loss, improved mobility),with zero negatives like pain from bad form. 10/10 experience.
showerReviews.author: Ryan Wolny

showerReviews.reviewText: This is my local gym, over the Christmas period getting in and parking has been a nightmare due to the insane parking system, not a fault of the gym, but a part of the experience for most users as it's not really easy to walk to. It's always busy, the least I ever see is 30ish people but it's up to 150 plus at peak times. It is a big gym, but you'll still queue for equipment. The male changing rooms and toilets are often gross and smell bad, I've never seen them totally clean in the months I've been going. The pros are, lots of equipment (but still not enough at peak times), in theory a good location, when parking isn't being used by Christmas shoppers, and a wide range of gym users. There are a few not so friendly groups of teenage and young adult boys/men but most people just mind their own business and work out.
showerReviews.author: Magnus Alexander

showerReviews.reviewText:
From the very first lesson, I was so impressed with the teachers. They were warm, approachable, and made my daughter feel comfortable straight away. The lessons were well-structured but still fun, and the teacher had such a great way of keeping the kids engaged and excited to learn.

My daughter made amazing progress, both in her swimming skills and in her confidence in the water. She looked forward to every session, which says a lot about how enjoyable the experience was for her.

It‚Äôs not easy to find lessons that are this well-run and still so much fun. The whole experience has been so positive for my daughter ‚Äî she‚Äôs grown more confident, had a great time, and genuinely looked forward to every session. I‚Äôm really grateful to the team for creating such a friendly, supportive environment, and I‚Äôd happily recommend them to any parent looking for a place their child can enjoy learning to swim.

showerReviews.reviewText: tried this place out last night, whilst the staff were nice and the changing rooms clean, the place was bizarre, no-one in reception, you pay pool-side to the lifeguard, but no notice to advise this, lots of signs up saying 'leave shoes at own risk etc' and you are strictly not allowed to leave belongings in the changing rooms, these also have to be kept poolside. Lane swimming is a joke, there are no lanes set up, a third of the pool is taken up by the wide steps that are permanent, one other lifeguard was doing adult swimming lessons on the side of the pool without steps valiantly trying to have individual sessions with ten people at once, the water was cloudy, people just swimming for their life as no lanes set up and beginners mixed in all over the place, there's no deep end, and to top it all off there are 'rinse showers' on the poolside, but NO SHOWERS in the changing rooms. Never again.
showerReviews.author: hannah wilks

Giving this place 1 star is generous to be honest. We went for the first time today, on arrival it was all a bit chaotic. We very quickly realised the entire place, including changing room was flooded because "one of the lifeguards left a tap on". Changing rooms are dirty, no privacy and the floors are all grimy. I didn't even want to take my shoes off.
On getting into the pool there was a lot of sharp grit on the floor of the pool and black bits floating on the top of the water.
The entire place is disgusting, dirty and unhygienic. We will not be back again. Save your time and money go somewhere, anywhere else.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely awful, took my daughter and granddaughter 2 weeks ago to a baby session in the teaching pool .
The facilities were poor , hardly any pins on the locker keys , dirty , only one dirty playpen to sit a child in whilst mum gets changed and absolutely freezing , not only the water but the changing area , one girl actually asked us if it was usual for your baby to be blue after swimming as hers was!
We have all been ill since ...maybe a coincidence but perhaps not
The price was about ¬£9.30 for the three of us but add on carparking and the fact we couldn't stay in the freezing pool for more than 15 minutes and it worked out quite expensive , a few knackered floats and chewed balls to play with honestly shameful for a City the size of Derby !
Cost cutting gone mad!
showerReviews.author: Carmel Kennedy

showerReviews.reviewText:
I used to go to this gym back when they offered two membership options: ¬£28 for the standard package and ¬£38 if you wanted access to the sauna. Now they‚Äôve removed the cheaper option entirely, leaving only the ¬£38 membership.

For that price, I expect a high-standard gym but unfortunately, the quality has gone downhill.

Several machines don‚Äôt work or aren‚Äôt even plugged in, including the bike and the rower, which have been out of action for far too long. On top of that, the showers have been broken for a while with still no sign of repair. For nearly ¬£40 a month, basic maintenance should be a given.

What makes this even more frustrating is that many higher-quality gyms charge around ¬£25 a month and provide fully working equipment and proper facilities. Even their Birmingham branch looks far higher quality, with a better layout and well-maintained machines ‚Äî so it‚Äôs disappointing that this location doesn‚Äôt meet the same standard.

Overall, the value just isn‚Äôt there anymore. Until the equipment and facilities are brought back up to standard, I can‚Äôt recommend this gym.
showerReviews.author: Max

locations.title: Orangetheory Fitness Derby
locations.address: ÓÉàRetail Park, Wyvern Way, Derby DE21 6NZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Recently attended on a guest pass and really enjoyed the experience. I was called prior to the workout, sent a video link introducing the concept and covering everything I needed to know.
On arrival the team was welcoming and gave me a demonstration of everything I needed to know. I didnt feel out of place or intimidated in any way.
The workout was easy to follow and allowed me to work at an individual level. Every exercise had easier and harder variations.
After, I was spoken to by multiple members of staff, felt great and sent a review of my efforts which was useful and informative.
Parking is easy as the location is on a retail park. Also free.
lockers only need a code so no need to take ¬£1 or a padlock.

I would recommend this if you like group exercise or need motivation. I felt apart of a team and not like I was in competition with others.

No need to join with a friend. Once the workout starts its you vs you. You will make friends there but taking your friends is also good fun for a little competition

workouts change daily so plenty to do and keep you engaged
showerReviews.author: marvin burton

locations.title: Onroute Truckstops - Junction 29
locations.address: ÓÉàholmewood industrial estate, Holmewood, Chesterfield S42 5SA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Really Good food, good showers , truck shop ,new exit around back !! Fuel available . Busy because its decent, easy access üëçüëç ‚Ä¶
showerReviews.author: James Paterson

showerReviews.reviewText: Really Good food, good showers , truck shop ,new exit around back !! Fuel available . Busy because its decent, easy access üëçüëç ‚Ä¶
showerReviews.author: James Paterson

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time visit to Onroute Truckstop Jcn 29 of the M1. First of all a congratulations to all the staff on site, I engaged with ground staff who were at the fuel pumps, shop staff, the catering team in the restaurant and visited the truck wash.

On arrival, my purpose of the visit was to refuel, quick shower, some breakfast and wash my truck. All of which were the result of my eroute @SNAP app. Fuel pumps were easily accessible with over head canopy at 5m height restriction.

Keyfuels, UK fuels and Silvey Fuel cards accepted with loads of information boards encouraging you to sign up to the Onroute app and collect loyalty points which can be reclaimed onsite as discounts towards purchases, and 50% off your first restaurant order. A few minutes later my app was installed and breakfast ordered whilst stood at the fuel pumps!

Parked up and next on the agenda was a quick shower. Straight into the shower block which was spotlessly clean on entry with a separate changing and drying area. A bit old school but better than trying to dress on a wet floor. Striped off and wondered into the shower cubicle to find a vending machine at the shower with a notice to buy a token from the shop at ¬£2.50 for the pleasure. I was sorely tempted to walk back out naked to get my token but decided as time was of the essence and my breakfast was being cooked, to dismiss the shower for now. Perhaps moving the notice to the shower door would be advised? As a result no review to the showers or the hot water, but looking at the shower curtains, stained and tired looking, we‚Äôll leave that there.

The shop staff, stock available and friendly engagement was first class. I picked up some Tacho rolls and paid via Apple Pay at the till and was given a receipt without asking. Conversations were flowing and a happy environment - 10/10.

In the foyer and just outside the front door with the usual slot machines and laundry facilities, all working and available for use.  Plenty more information on hand about facilities on offer and selection of advertising.

Into the restaurant and again a joyful atmosphere with happy staff and a greeting by another member of staff ensuring I had downloaded the Onroute app and even offered me a fuel card application for silvey - nice touch. Food was presented bang on time as per the app order, was piping hot and further enquiries if I needed anything else, which I didn‚Äôt. They catered for everything. Very well done 10/10.

After breakfast I retired with my coffee to the seating area outside for my cigarette and the smoking area was fully accessible, clean and tidy.

Finally the truck wash, which was the purpose of the visit. I departed Driffield in Yorkshire on route to the South West and my collected trailer was black. It was supposed to be white!  Logging into the Snap app my first available truck wash on route was here. So this was a fairly integral part of my visit. You can imagine my disappointment to pull up and find it abandoned and closed. 0/10

All in all, not a bad experience, not sure if the truck wash is permanently closed but it‚Äôs let the site down in its overall scores.
showerReviews.author: Casper Roe-Lavery

I mean come on. . . . Does it get any better. 100% recommend, we will be back!!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Firstly, I‚Äôm sorry I can only rate it two stars but it‚Äôs not to standard, yet.
I stayed a night here and would have loved to give a better rating as the owners are really nice and welcoming. Unfortunately the previous owners let it come to a state and there‚Äôs a lot of work to do and some money to go into the business until it‚Äôs up to a standard I could rate as adequate.
On the pro side: The cafe is a nice place with good and reasonably priced food. The truck stop is clean and so are the facilities beside they‚Äôre pretty run down and need a lot of attention. Maybe a facility container would be a good interim solution.
On the con side: It is quite noisy due to the A38 only a few yards away from the lorry park. As mentioned earlier the facilities need to be refurbished completely and this includes increasing the amount of showers, toilets and sinks.

In total I have to say I‚Äôll come back and will see how the new owners are getting on and what sort of improvements they‚Äôre going to put in place.

Again, the truck stop is under new management and it looks like the new owners are working hard to make this a decent place to stay for the night and I wish them all the best.
showerReviews.author: Markus Allard

Parking is brilliant, abnormal loads can ring up and be saved a spot, a real blessing.
Showers need to be looked at, poor performance, low pressures, a real gamble as to which one will work best on the day.
New Cafe is rather nice, bright, airy and spacious.
I've only had the breakfast so can only comment on that, but what a load of overpriced slop, belt buster; 8.50, 2 cheap sausages, anemic fried potatoes, eggs with jelly inü§¢(undercooked) and really salty bacon, no toast or bread, plus 2 pound for a instant coffee, yes I had instant decaf coffee. I don't mind paying for a quality breakfast, what I do mind is paying quality prices for sub par food

locations.address: ÓÉàWillow Row, Longton, Stoke-on-Trent ST3 2PU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time stopping here last night. I have to say that early indications are really good. Was met at the gate to be shown my parking spot and was guided in. Then asked if it my first time here. I was then given a full explanation of every facility available to me which includes showers, large and spacious even for bigger guys like myself, scoff room where later on I had a very good carvery, laundry facilities and also a great little idea that is a unit where in the mornings you can make yourself a coffee and some toast. All provided by ADS. Staff couldn‚Äôt do enough for me. Seems extremely secure as gates locked at night and constant security patrols.
All in all an extremely decent place as far as I‚Äôm concerned. Loved the unlimited coffee or tea deal that they do. No brainer for me. Will definitely be making it one of my go to places.
showerReviews.author: Craig

showerReviews.reviewText: Parked here at 11pm last night, gates locked but security let us in. Nice and quiet, facilities very good and clean. Even though we were parked up away from all other vehicles we weren‚Äôt allowed to have our fridge running. This will be a deciding factor as to weather we use this facility in the future as we carry temperature sensitive goods. Cafe still not open at 8am which was also a little disappointing. The showers kept running hot and then cold when someone flushed a nearby loo. Also they desperately need extractor fans in them as they end up soaked and the room is very cold. We were promised tea and toast in the morning but couldn‚Äôt see anywhere to get it as cafe is closed.
showerReviews.author: Mark Welsh

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great place. First time I've stopped here, and couldn't feel more welcomed by the staff. Andy (the manager of the place) is a great bloke - really chatty and nothing is too much trouble for him. Parking is fully camera'd up, with security on all night too. Meg is in the cafe knocking out some great home cooked food. Proper chips - none of this frozen stuff!
The place is easy to find - just put the postcode in that's on Google, and it'll bring you to the door. Clean toilets and showers too - a real rarity these days.
showerReviews.author: Iain Morgan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Location: Perth city, There is a 24-hour convenience store next door, walking distance to Elizabeth Harbour (didn't go).

Employee: Philip (I only knew his name after asking the supervisor in the morning). He was very friendly, asked detailed questions about the customer's needs, and introduced the hotel's facilities and location. Feeling cared for, compared to the mechanical check-in at other hotels, this is more human-like, and I give a thumbs up to Philip.

Room: The sheets are clean, the pillows have no odor, the towels are clean and dry. If you often travel, you should know how important these three points are.

I didn‚Äôt experience breakfast and the bar because I didn‚Äôt have time, so I don‚Äôt dare to make a random evaluation.

This is also the hotel where the cabin crew of Cathay Pacific and Malaysia Airlines stay, and the environment is very good.
showerReviews.author: YU ZHUO Xu

showerReviews.reviewText:
One of the worst and certainly the weirdest ‚Äòhotels‚Äô I have ever stayed in. The rooms look great on the photos but then so do so many. In reality the room was adequate. The bed looked good but in reality was desperately in need of a new mattress - very saggy and uncomfortable. The rooms were only cleaned once a week which is weird in itself and even that didn‚Äôt happen. Tea, coffee, milk, towels, toilet paper were not replenished. The heating didn‚Äôt work & it was colder in the room than outside. One positive was a fridge in the room but that didn‚Äôt balance out the negatives.
Finally, there seemed to be lots of dubious looking ‚Äòguests‚Äô hanging around, not the sort you get in proper hotels, including the noisy annoying woman with her many loud phone calls & occasional visitors (one of whom inadvertently knocked on my door late at night ) it was my misfortune to have next door. She evidently either couldn‚Äôt read or more likely couldn‚Äôt care about the notices to keep the noise down. As every one of these guests seemed to smoke fiendishly they spent many hours lurking outside and I was also subjected to the delights of a couple fiercely arguing outside my window. Rather than a hotel it was sometimes reminiscent of a ‚Äòsink‚Äô council estate.
Naturally the pub next door which apparently once supplied breakfast was closed and appeared on the way to becoming dilapidated, I think it might not be long before the ‚Äòhotel‚Äô joins it.
showerReviews.author: Dave Wright

locations.title: East Midlands Guest House
locations.address: ÓÉà100A Douglas St, Derby DE23 8LJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A small budget B&B with shared bathroom facilities, located about a 25 minute walk from the city centre (a little over 10 minutes from the Midlands Train Station) in a quiet, unexciting part of town. Staff were friendly, the bathrooms (all two of them, on the ground floor, with an extra toilet on the first) clean, the shower facilities adequate. My room was clean, too. Free parking in their own designated parking lot is included.

Climbing down the stairs in your underwear to get to the showers was a point of concern. The hotel was difficult to find, as it's not clearly indicated as The Elk Inn on any sign except right next to the entrance. Actually, it's *identical* to the East Midlands Guest House - it's the red brick building on the corner of Osmaston Rd and Douglas St. I don't know why they're using two different names for the same place. The room was very basic, indeed. It's only a place to sleep for a few days. There was *no* room service at all on any of the 5 days I spent there.
showerReviews.author: Thomas M√ºthing (theviolinproject.de)

locations.title: Abbey Lodge Student Village
locations.address: ÓÉàLonsdale Pl, Derby DE22 3NX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Absolutely terrible accommodation and a large reason why university for me personally was such a disaster last year. While they may have offered me a room switch when I requested one as I wasnt getting on with my flatmates, they were more than happy to dispose of hundreds pounds of equipment and clothes when I went home during the second lockdown. I suffer from mobility issues and extreme hip pain and having refused to offer me any help moving my heavy furniture while I was actually living there they reneged on their promise to keep my things safe. Aside from that the maintenance staff are extremely unreactionary and our flat was littered with mechanical faults, my sink wouldnt drain water, the shower made an awful sound when turned on and when our toilet wouldnt flush it took weeks for them to offer assistance. DONT GO HERE!
showerReviews.author: Kyle Frid

showerReviews.reviewText:
I really enjoy living here for a number of reasons.

The flats/bedrooms are modernly furnished and are ideal for the needs of students with great sized bedrooms and social areas with a consistent colour scheme.

All indoor areas are always heated.
The living room area is comfy and perfect for flat gatherings/films nights. Theres a tv in the living room which has great quality.

There is more than enough cupboard and fridge/freezer space in the kitchen. There is also an eating island.

There are plenty of plug sockets throughout the flat and bedrooms.

There is a new double vending machine with very convenient items that you may need in an emergency. Toilet rolls, milk, toothbrushes, snacks, ready meals, drinks etc

There is a wonderful outdoor social space with fairy lights which would be great for parties during the night time in summer. There are also plenty of other seating areas throughout the site.

The hot water in the showers have never run out even though I'm sharing with 6 people.

There are 2 showers and 2 toilets so I never have to wait to get access to one.

There are designated smoking areas.

There is a common room which is always warm and has many books and a tv, a pool table, table tennis and comfy chairs.

There is always somebody helpful in the office whether we need to collect post or chat or report any maintenance issues.

There is a bus that stops across the road from the accommodation which goes to the university and doesn't stop too far from the city centre. The bus is designated to Abbey lodge students only.

There are also 2 convenience stores right at the bottom of the drive.

Also a bonus is i have great flatmates who all get along.

The only downside is i dont get very good service in the entire area as a whole (including inside of the accomodation) so there may be specific spots in your room which are best to make a call but this isn't a fault of the accomodation itself.

One last thing to mention is that the rooms are a really really good price. The cheapest student accomodation price youll find in derby. Even the university owned accomodation rooms are ancient and overpriced.

Living at Abbey lodge I am able to eat well, have a social life and save a lot of my student loan at the same time.
showerReviews.author: Chantay Campbell

showerReviews.reviewText:
Booked on of the glamping pods for begining of December.
Brilliant two person wood fired hot tub.
Cabin has a small fridge microwave and kettle.
Also a heater.
Mattresses are comfortable cabins are clean.
Unfortunately due to the soggy weather we couldn't enjoy the bench and decking. So made full use of the hot tub instead. Feel like I should have booked another couple of nights instead of just two. Will definatly be booking again for the summer.
Site was clean and tidy. Toilets showers indoor and outdoor are clean. They also supply some fridges and freezers first come first served though.
Nice chilled few days.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here for 3 nights, camping in a tent as we were attended an event at the nearby Elvaston Country Park which is 5-10 mins walk away. We were put in a large field which was reasonably quiet other than the sound of the road at night. Ground was fairly level and well drained although drainage seems to be aided by rocks about 4 inches under the ground. Because of this, it was very difficult to peg the tent down effectively. We ended up with about 8 bent pegs and for the ones that went in all the way,  many had to go on such an angle that I wouldn't have trusted the tent to stay put should the wind have gotten up.

We called upon arrival as there was nobody in reception and a very pleasant gentlemen came to take our money and tell us where to camp. He didn't however tell us where anything was; toilets, bins etc were all needed to be found for ourselves. The toilets and showers near the reception; whilst dated, were adequate, and we did see them cleaned. Hot water pressure was low from taps though so came through at a trickle and if you have a shower, don't leave it too late as we did end up having a luke warm shower later one evening. We never found the 'luxury' toilet block.

All in all it was easy to find, conveniently located and adequate to throw your tent down for a night or two to get your head down. It isn't luxurious, but then you're not paying the ridiculous price that some campsites are asking these days.
showerReviews.author: Jim Roberts

showerReviews.reviewText:
A nice small, but secure site.
There's a shop with some basic essentials in.
The shower and toilet block are very clean, and well maintained.
There are pods available, as well as pitches, and also areas where people are staying for longer.

They're currently doing some site maintenance but it still did not affect our stay, and its actually a very quiet and peaceful area, with local fields for walks and even a small fishing pond.

Its a good choice for a peaceful getaway.
To note, the pods are small but warm !

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic, 3 night stay in our motorhome in this small and friendly site. Originally booked 2 nights but enjoyed it so much we extended by another night. Booking system easy and straight forward. Owners call or message you the day before with your pitch number. EHU available as a pay as you go option at each pitch. Shower and toilets very clean. Washing up area. Grey water, Black water and fresh water facilities all within easy reach. Location not far away from Hulland Ward with a pub and a few shops. 90 minute walk through beautiful countryside to Carsington Reservoir. Very relaxing location with fantastic views across the valley. Thank you very much for a memorable stay. Please be aware that this is an adults only site.
showerReviews.author: Steve Young

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed only for one night in glamping pod Ash as a mid-way point to home. Friendly owner greeted us and showed us our glamping pod and explained the layout/amenities. Pod was clean and contained all the essentials you could possibly think of. Each pod has their own shower and toilet facility within the "toilet block" for the pods. It's a clean, small, amd peaceful site with plenty of walks in the area and a nice pub within a 15-20 minute walk. Great first experience in a pod. I would highly recommend this camp site. P.S. we greatly appreciated the owners letting us park our car and small caravan on site while we used the pod as we didn't want to unload and put down  the feet just for a one night, shirt stay. Thanks again--we enjoyed our stay!

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed here for 2 nights in July in a hired motorhome to meet up with some friends who lived nearby Not a bad site, gets busy at weekends, not the best kept site but toilets were very clean,waste disposal but nowhere to empty grey waste if in motorhomes, also think the showers should be free  if already paying  to stay on site although they were only ¬£2 for 10 minutes with a token from the shop or guy in the hut on site so not a big expense, nice pub on site, reasonable priced, great food and lovely warm pork scratchings served at bar. Read a few reviews about the guy booking you in being obnoxious and rude etc when checking in, he was absolutely fine and pleasant with us, so don't judge the this site based on other people's personal opinions, everyone has worse days than others,

showerReviews.reviewText: I like this park. It has a good little pub and does food from Thursday through Sunday. It's fairly clean and reasonably well maintained. There's lots of other pubs around and within walking distance. We stayed for Download, as we always do, and although it gets busy, it's never rowdy. Please be aware, that when it's busy, the showers may not be that good. Lots of water points and an elsan point that works well. Lovely marina with ducks and swans that wander the park. There's a bus stop at the end of the entry lane, 5 minutes walk, with 24 hour buses to the airport and Donnington park and to Derby too. Bus fares are capped at ¬£3.00 so you can park and leave your car. If you want curry, then get the bus to Castle Donnington village as they have some superb curry houses. There's a Chinese within a 2 minute bus ride, 5 minutes drive or a 25 minutes walk. Great location although you can hear the motorway as it's near the M1 and A50 but don't let it put you off. It's a good park
showerReviews.author: steve roscoe

showerReviews.author: Yvonne Bowers

showerReviews.reviewText:
The park was great and the staff were very friendly. Unfortunately while we were there a fight broke out in the campsite pub which made it not possible for us to go the next evening with our kids. The toilet had fecies running up to it from several meters away up to and in the male toilets and was not cleaned up all day a long with 3 of the toilets being blocked which was also not cleaned all day. The shower only trickled water and cost an extra ¬£2 to use per person.

As stated all the staff were great and the facilities looked amazing. Unfortunately upkeep was very unsanitary probably the worst we have seen most likely due to being understaffed is our only guess. The fighting obviously can happen however with children it's not what you want your kids around. We left early and only stayed one night and won't be returning because of all the above which ashame as it has all the catching of a great park.
showerReviews.author: joseph chambers

locations.title: Packhorse Farm
locations.address: ÓÉàFoxholes Ln, Matlock DE4 5LF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just stayed here for 3 nights.
Slight problem on arrival as we couldn't fit onto the allocated pitch but this was sorted straight away with no fuss at all.
Our pitch was really well kept as was the rest of the campsite. Lovely areas separated by hedges and trees.
The toilets and showers were clean and spacious as was the pot washing area.
We walked to the local pub (The Gate) which is as other people have said about a 20-30 min walk down a long hill. Well worth a visit for the food, also a playground if you have kids. People have said they ordered taxis to get back to the farm but the walk back really isn't that bad.  We also walked into Matlock which takes you through woods and past Lumsdale waterfall. The walk took about 45 mins and again was worth it.
All in all this is a great little campsite with very nice owners.
showerReviews.author: Gary Douglas

showerReviews.reviewText:
Live locally & went because my daughter has wanted to try camping. Rang and spoke with Byron and we went just daughter and I Sunday 27th July for one night with a small tent.

The greeting upon arrival was excellent,  the man was incredibly lovely and friendly,  the camp site is immaculate,  lovely toilets and showers, great site. Plenty of space.

We both absolutely loved it and will most definitely be returning.

My daughter absolutely loved her first experience in camping (although I think I need a inflatable mattress next time!)

10/10 for everything

showerReviews.reviewText: Returned today from a lovely 3 night stay at Packhorse Farm Campsite. We had our own cul de sac which was really nice and private. The site has a no noise after 930pm rule which we loved as were away with 2 children. Clean toilet blocks which were warm with lovely, hot showers. My sister stayed in one of the glamping pods with my niece and they loved that too. Really friendly owners and a very relaxed site. We look forward to returning already!

showerReviews.reviewText: It was a really nice stay at Yew Tree. Very nice and peaceful place with pitches which are spaced out well. There was no traffic noise and all the guests were very quiet. We went for a really great walk in Matlock from the train station parking and visited Abraham's heights and High Tor. Definitely worth doing just for the views but the first bit of the walk is very hard going up hill. I only have one criticism of the campsite which needs addressing.. the washing up water needed to be hotter. I ended up boiling a kettle for the washing up because the sink water wasn't hot, also didn't bother with the showers because of the same issues. All in all excellent value for money though.
showerReviews.author: steve whyte

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed for the fireworks weekend in November 25.
Not massive professional display but huge fireworks that went on for 30 mins and was better than (or at least as good as) a professional display.
Really really big fire.
Well marshelled event .

Site.
Very clean good facilities. Free range kids having fun.

Went nice and quiet about 10pm

We were grass non hook up. Pitch was open and big enough.

The caravan hook up areas have beautiful hedges.

This place is large and well kept. We saw litter pickers everyday

Didn't use pool or pub so can't comment

Toilets clean enough
Showers looked clean.
Play room clean .

Yeah....enjoyed my visit and good fireworks.
If we don't find another site for next year I'd be happy to return.

Didn't see fishing lake so can't comment

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic 2 night break away from home at this little gem of a site. Really well maintained pitches, reasonable rates, large spaces for trailer tent, clean and well kept shower and toilet blocks too. The kids loved the swimming pool, games room, park and generally being able to just play footy or make friends. I came to visit this site as a child probably about 30 years ago but we won't be leaving it that long to visit again. The staff in the reception and shop were friendly and happy to help, and the shop was reasonably priced too, with a massive variety of items you might need when camping.
showerReviews.author: Michael and Gemma Andrews

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely camptite. Very friendly staff. Nice pub on site. Food quite pricey but looked good, burgers and pizza. Its open to full sunshine with no shade but they eventually put a few umbrellas up. Swimming pool nice, not too big but clean. No loungers but some bench tables, again no shade. Small kids pool too that gets very busy, especially at weekends! Good shop that stocks essentials plus some camping gear. Electric hookup extensions are about 30 quid and you may need one as the electric posts are every 3 pitches! Gets very busy at weekends!

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely site and lots to do, couldn't fault any of the staff! Constantly cleaning facilities and driving around checking site was safe. showerReviews.reviewText:
Cracking value site for the whole family!
I read the bad reviews after I had booked. That put me on edge before we even got there!
However, I have no idea what these bad reviews are about. Everyone has bad days. Not everyone can be pleased all the time.
But the site is clean, well maintained and looked after. The toilets/showers were clean other than an odd leaf or stick. Which you obviously expect on a campsite surrounded by beautiful woodland. There was always loo roll, paper to dry hands, hand wash, bins ect. Everything you need and expect to be there.
Plenty for the young ones to enjoy. 3 big play areas. A giant sandpit which is under cover. So great for rainy days! There are pool/football tables too! Again , under cover for rainy days entertainment! Fishing is great for everyone to have a go at! A great pond and well stocked!
We tried the caf√© and we loved it! Great choice, great price and, great taste! Their Latte's are out of this world! Just like their loaded fries!
All the staff were helpful, friendly and, always wore a smile.
We can't wait to return! I highly recommend to anyone! Give it a go! You either like it or you don't ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Just because one person didn't like it, doesn't mean you won't!

(I have wayyy to many photos to post. But, I promise you will NOT be disappointed!)
showerReviews.author: Carly Tomlinson

locations.title: Holiday Inn Express Derby - Pride Park by IHG
locations.address: ÓÉàWheelwright Way, Derby DE24 8HX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is the first time we've stayed here & upon entering we were greeted by the happy friendly staff at the desk. They made it easy to check in & were very helpful. The room was clean, tidy & well presented, fresh towels, bedding, bathroom spotless etc. The location isn't far from the stadium so ideal for gigs, football etc & only a 5min drive to plenty of restaurants. The reception has a small bar & the breakfast had a reasonable selection including the usual full English, cereals, fruit, pastries, coffee & juices. Staff were constantly refilling breakfast items & checking everything was okay.
Overall we enjoyed our stay & at this price point it's what you would expect & we would be happy to use it again with no problems.
showerReviews.author: Dan Dan

locations.address: ÓÉàMorledge, Derby DE1 2AY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very good place to stay. I have been visiting Derby for work and this has been my go-to place to stay for couple years. They have made complete facelift to hotel by renovating the reception to first floor together with the restaurant. Staff is very helpful and friendly. They have a greener stay option for using room cleaning only when needed. Really enjoyed the restaurant menu. Parking in Derbion is easy and parking discount available from reception.

Room details:
Double with king bed
7 nights stay for one adult

Here is this hotel general checklist (+/-):
+ Easy check-in
+ All room lights working
+ Roomservice
+ Laundry service
+ Hotel has a restaurant
+ Accessibility
+ Fast wifi (room)
+ Fridge (room)
+ Kettle (room)
+ Toiletries (room)
+ Bath towels (room)
+ Shower
+ Bathtub
+ High quality mattress
+ Extra pillows
+ Electronic locking (room)
+ Tv (room)
+ Gym/fitness room

Price-to-value ratio: Nice (920¬£/ 7 nights for 1) 130¬£/night
Floor surface: carpet
Noiciness level (0-10): 0 (courtyard side)

The view from hotel room window was very poor because 2nd frool courtyard is basically just grey garden tile. Basically courtyard looks like how I imagine prison look like. Not really a big issue, but it would be generally good idea to make courtyard look more attractive.

locations.title: The Kedleston Country House
locations.address: ÓÉàKedleston Rd, Quarndon, Derby DE22 5JD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a lovely family-run hotel just ten minutes from Derby city centre. Didn't have dinner but it was quite possibly the best hotel breakfast I've ever had! Friendly service and spacious rooms - good value for money. Oh and the shower pressure was fabulous.

We were staying on a bank holiday weekend but it felt very quiet.

There's a couple of small things they could do to elevate the property further, e.g. investing more in the toiletries, better cushions for the lounge areas, updating the cocktail menu. But I'm quite sure I'm being a fussy Londoner!

Looked like a good spot for an intimate wedding.
showerReviews.author: El

showerReviews.reviewText:
A lovely reception area, great.
Smelly changing rooms, and nappies left in cubicles.
Swimming pool lane ropes are dangerous, lots of plastic broken, others are missing leaving the ropes not easily seen by swimmers.
showerReviews.author: Pete Manley

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
Sorry to say but shocked on how this place is still aloud to be open.
facilities cleanliness is abysmal - especially the showers/toilets in changing rooms, the whole pool changing rooms each cubicle has muck , mould build up even the pool is full of sediments.

Gym facilities is very poor and well over 20 years out of date and well behind any other local gym , their are to many machines that do not work properly or are broken and not being fixed. (treadmills , bikes , striders , damaged weights , weight machines , bars are not even correct)

a full membership is sold for gym and Swim use but you can never actually use the pool as its ran by a timetable and there is no swimming time in the evenings / afternoons for general people to use..   Your left with late mornings which does not fit the people that work 9-5 (or longer)! the full pool is sectioned into swimming lanes and it is stupidly busy!! (where this could also be sectioned off for general use , or allow the lane swimmers to use the deep end ! so general use can use the shallow to medium depth.

As part of the membership as well it advertises sauna and steam room - i have found out the steam room has not been working for 6-12 months and people are being told it is not going to be fixed.
Also the Sauna is suppose to be for adults only and even the Sauna has a timetable and there is more time that it cannot be used than what it could be which is even more appalling when you add the above problem with the pool.

if Money cannot be pumped into this so called leisure centre to improve standards , quality and a proper leisure centre experience how can it remain open and charge the public money.
I have seen better set ups and care in 3rd world countries.
And for Lincoln being such an available place to live its shocking how far behind this leisure centre is behind in the real world.
showerReviews.author: Foadi-Boi #

showerReviews.reviewText: Very Friendly staff. Very Helpful Reception Staff. Any queries complaints re lack of toilet rolls or empty soap dispenser have been dealt with quickly n efficiently. Help given to those needing help navigating round the Better app..to book a class or pay membership etc. Getting more n more different classes and new instructors being trained to deal with the number of classes needed. Instructors are brilliant n so helpful in improving health,posture, balance,fitness. There is also so much camaradie in the classes. Made some lovely friends n we chat over coffee( n often cakes )in the cafe after.  The new LiNKup scheme on 1st Thursday of the month has been a hit too..Over coffee we do quizzes or craftwork for Charity.. .or sell baking for Centre's latest Charity Fundraiser. I have done my 5k Swimathon for Cancer Research n Marie Curie at a Swim Fit session allowing me a whole lane last year. Shows how obliging they are. I definitely get good value for my membership as i do lots of classes n swimming a week. All Classes are included in the membership.

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been a member of the Sleaford Leisure Centre Gym for around six months now,   The gym has just had a refit with brand new machines - its really well equipped. The staff at the leisure centre are absolutely brilliant, they are friendly, knowledgeable and provide positive instruction and feedback.   I enjoy going to the gym, apart from helping me to achieve my goals in relation to fitness, it is a really friendly place, the other members are great, help to provide motivation and are happy to engage in friendly banter, for me - its also a social experience.    The classes at the gym are excellent, there are a wide range of activities to suit most people. I regularly attend box fit, group cycle, core stability, yoga, swim fit and step.  There are other classes I haven't tried yet, but all are well worth checking out with very positive feedback from people who participate. The classes really demonstrate in a practical way just how brilliant all the instructors are:  Swimming at the Leisure Centre is also excellent, clean facilities,  enough lockers. great showers.  The sauna and steam rooms are also available if needed.   There is a separate area available for the little ones.   The swimming classes for kids are also great.  So yes - attending is a positive experience, Reception staff are brilliant and there is even an app you can use to book onto classes , its really easy to use.     I'd recommend joining 100%
showerReviews.author: Andrew Collis

showerReviews.reviewText: Stunning place, beautiful gardens nice little cafe and a wonderful swimming pool. Well worth a trip out to see but book in advance for the pool.

showerReviews.reviewText: Stunning place, beautiful gardens nice little cafe and a wonderful swimming pool. Well worth a trip out to see but book in advance for the pool.

showerReviews.reviewText: ¬£16 for two people but you get three hours in total and use of all the facilities around. The pool is heated to a nice warm temperature and is a good size so your not crowded and on top of each other. There's also a kiddy pool as well with a big splashing water tap. The onsite Caffe serves both hot and cold food for a good price. We spent ¬£18 for two burgers, a tea, a cookie, a hot sausage roll and a latte. It's an amazing activity for all the family as there's a grassy area next to the pool which allows for a picnic to be taken. You can go in and out of the pool as much as you like during your allotted time. There are also lockers both in the changing room and pool side which cost a pound. The changing rooms have showers which are a good size too as well as free hairdryers. I would highly recommend, it's a great day out and they also offer midnight swims.
showerReviews.author: Robyn

showerReviews.reviewText: ¬£16 for two people but you get three hours in total and use of all the facilities around. showerReviews.reviewText: What a beauty of an outdoor pool. From the outside, it looks like an unassuming tin shed, but as you walk through the modern, clean changing rooms there are posters of other iconic lidos - Saltdean, London Fields, Brockwell - and Jubilee Park certainly holds its own in this illustrious company. The main pool is 33m and gently heated to around 24¬∞ when we visited. There is also a sizeable learner pool with a giant tap which provides intermittent downpours. The pools are clean and well-maintained with attentive lifeguards. A smashing pool which is operating an extended heated season for 2024 - don't miss out!
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText: What a beauty of an outdoor pool. showerReviews.reviewText: My first time at jubilee park swimming pool and first impressions are that it has friendly staff, clean facilities and beautiful out door space to relax and catch the sun. The pool is clean and well maintained for all to enjoy. Unfortunately my experience wasn't completely satisfying.. the pool quickly became busy and crowded, there were signs that children couldn't go past if they aren't confident swimmers which is understandable but it means everyone is bottled together in the shallow end making it difficult to swim, relax and enjoy. I took my son who is a confident swimmer aged 8 and who has had swimming lessons at jubilee park, to the deep end and we was quickly called on by the life guard who wanted my son to prove he could swim from sign to sign.. it turned from a fun, relaxed and playful swim, which is what I paid for, into a swimming lesson just to have a little bit more room to swim.. this pool seems more of a strict regime swim then enjoyable.. many parents were called on by the life guards for doing small playful things with their children in the pool and being told to stop.. takes the fun out of it all.. I 100% agree swimming should be safe and pool safety is important but this pool feels over the top.. I feel like I've paid for a regimental swim and not a fun, relaxing family swim. Over all jubilee is a beautiful place to visit and to bring the kids for a swim but best visiting on less busy days.
showerReviews.author: Damon Lewis

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been a member for a couple of months now having joined from another commercial gym that just kept putting the prices up but giving us less.

overall pretty nice gym! we don't go at peak times so i can't really say much about how busy it is, but when we go (10pm-ish) it's usually manageable.

the drains in the women's changing rooms need cleaning though - every time we've been in there there's always an underlying smell - we were unsure whether it was the toilets but when i went to wash my hands the other day it was definitely the sink drains!

weights are often scattered but that's more a fault with the people that attend than the gym itself

music is also a little loud and sometimes the yanga flavoured water just comes out as plain water, but again overall a nice gym. it was the first and only one i've ever been to and ive had a pleasant experience on the whole :)

showerReviews.reviewText: Whilst in the area we wanted to go swimming and google found us this little gem of a place! Whilst it‚Äôs not as cheap as a communal pool, it‚Äôs by far 100% better. It was impeccably clean! Loved that we could connect music to the sauna to play as we swam! The views were amazing, some building work is happening in front of the building but this didn‚Äôt spoil our opinions of the place! The showers were perfect and again spotless! The only thing we felt was missing was a couple of hooks within the changing rooms to hang clothes/bags! Pool was just the right temperature for us!! We will definitely be back!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely loved our visit to Swim Blue! The pool water was spotless and was crystal clear. The views from the pool area are beautiful, and the whole space is well maintained and inviting.

The changing facilities are fantastic ‚Äì clean, spacious, and equipped with lockers for peace of mind. The hot shower was a nice touch, and the little sauna with a Bluetooth speaker was definitely a highlight ‚Äì it was so relaxing to unwind while listening to our own music!

As a former pool owners who used to rent out our own facility, we know the effort and dedication it takes to keep a space like this so immaculate. We know firsthand how much hard work goes into maintaining a pool and they are doing fantastic job.

Perfect for a family swim or just some time to relax and recharge. Plenty of parking spaces available.

The owner welcomed us warmly and was incredibly lovely, making us feel right at home. Highly recommend Swim Blue for anyone looking for a top-notch swimming experience!
showerReviews.author: Patricie Baker

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have just been to SwimBlue Swimming Pool for the first time and WOW!!

We were very impressed with the immaculate cleanliness and the warm welcome from Bav!

Nothing was too much trouble and we were very impressed!

The changing rooms are large, spotlessly clean and have 2 showers!
The Toilet is separate and is equally clean!

The pool is easy to access with a choice of 2 ladders and the water is the perfect temperature for swimming and crystal clear!

The pool is a very good size for swimming lengths or for children to play with all the available floats etc and have a great time!

There is also a Sauna available!

There are lots of clearly signed rules for everyone‚Äôs enjoyment and safely which is very encouraging!

We give SwimBlue 5 Stars and will definitely be booking again!

It is truly value for money and with the Loyalty card it‚Äôs fantastic value!

locations.title: Wragby Swimming Pool
locations.address: ÓÉàSilver St, Wragby, Market Rasen LN8 5PJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: A fantastic resource for me. This is a small and friendly pool and the staff are all very helpful. I started using this pool about seven years ago and at the time I could hardly walk, due to significant problems with arthritis in knees. I have been swimming here two or three times a week and this has helped me get active again. Before, throughout and after Covid lock down this place has been run well and every effort is made to ensure the swimmers needs are met, whether for serious exercise or simply a pleasant swim. Well done to all involved.
showerReviews.author: Kevin and Libby

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our son has swimming lessons here and I can't recommend them highly enough!

He had always loved the pool but due to a bad experience at another local swim school he was extremely nervous about swimming. However, the staff here were calm, caring and kind and within minutes of his first lesson he was relaxing, giggling and enjoying himself in a pool once again! They push them along at just the right speed for each individual child and ensure the lessons are fun, while still teaching the core skills needed.

Our son has gone from strength to strength, is now confident in the water once more and progressing well through the swimming levels. Well done Wragby, you're fantastic!
showerReviews.author: Deneice Harwin

showerReviews.reviewText:
Clearly this place has seriously taken a nose dive if the last reviews are anything to go by? I went there for the first time ever this morning, and to kick off I found the toilet door wouldn‚Äôt close at all and then noticed that that even if it did there was no lock fitted for privacy! No lockers in the changing room, no hooks on the walls to hang clothes off, no mats to stand on whilst getting changed from wet to dry clothing, no showers to wash yourself after a swim.
Then came the fun bit! 12 people in the small pool with 10 going lengthways and 2 swimming the width. The pool isn‚Äôt wide enough for 10 swimmers so your constantly having to navigate around another body or two to avoid a collision, and lord help you if you break out into an over arm swim as it‚Äôs just not the done thing amongst geriatric swimmers, as it‚Äôs breast stroke all the way.
After watching blue balls of fluff floating on top of the water pass me by from time to time during my swim, the sight of a clump, and I mean clump of grey/black hair floating next to me made my stomach turn as I wasn‚Äôt sure if it was the chest, head, or pubic variety, but I was out of there sharpish as it was totally vulgar.
showerReviews.author: mike hulme

locations.title: The Gym Group Doncaster
locations.address: ÓÉàUnit 110A, Frenchgate Shopping Centre, St Sepulchre Gate, Doncaster DN1 1SR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not my best first experience of the gym. New member. Signed up to improve my health. Have a 24 hour membership because I'd like to use this during quieter hours at night or have flexibility.

However, I wasn't aware the locker/changing rooms are closed off between 1am and 3am. That information wasn't easy to find in the app, and there's no signage advising anyone anywhere that this is the case. My keys were in the locker in there. I was unable to access them and had to wait two hours for access to be unlocked for me to get them and go home. Had I been aware of that, I'd have used the accessible lockers in the gym areas themselves. Signage would be good on that.

The gym leaks. Noticeably. Not the fault of the gym itself to be fair. The entirety of the Frenchgate Centre itself is leaky and in need of some repair by the owners.
showerReviews.author: Ash H

MOLD, LEAKAGE,UNCLEAN AND SMELLY. The gym is constantly closed for refurbishing, where is the refurbishment? Every time I go back into the gym I see buckets on the floor to collect water from leaks coming from the ceiling. There is literal mould everywhere. Why is the gym is always closed for refurbishment when actually it looks the same and is worn down please invest something into this gym it‚Äôs not fair for people who come there spend money for half arsed conditions .You need to allow better ventilation and clean equipment and do something about the awful stench when you walk to the second floor. On the top floor where the treadmills are if you look up in front of you there is mold everywhere. Also there isn‚Äôt much variety when it comes to be able to have space to lift weights unless you‚Äôre at a smith machine which is hovered by men. Please sort out the mould the broken ceilings and clean and make the gym look clean and smell nice. Update- I went into the gym again they have repainted and added lights but MOULD EVERYWHERE STILL, more buckets
to collect water and looks a mess also women‚Äôs changing room is a state and horrible stench when you walk in. CLEAN THE MOULD, MOULD!

locations.title: Signature Health & Fitness
locations.address: ÓÉàSignature Health & Fitness, North Hykeham, Lincoln LN6 9QX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fantastic facility. It has all the equipment needed for a fantastic training session with a fantastic PT. There is a great sound sound system and air conditioning. As the facility is just for personal training clients it is never crowded. All the equipment is excellently maintained and there are showers to use too.
My personal trainer Josh is brilliant. He is always professional but has a great sense of humour and always makes the sessions enjoyable. From the first assessment , everything is a very personal approach, the sessions are designed for my specific needs and goals. Josh also spent the time to make me an individual nutrition plan to help me achieve my weight loss goal. We do a check in once a week to discuss progress and makes plans for the following week.
The sessions are updated and changed as you progress so there‚Äôs no boredom or stagnation.  There is also a fantastic sports therapist on site every Thursday. She really knows her stuff and is amazing if you have any sort of injury or general niggles. I would 100% recommend Signature health and fitness to anyone wanting to improve their health and well-being and fitness in a personal, professional environment that also allows for a bit of fun. Thank you to all at signature health and fitness for such an amazing service x
showerReviews.author: Philippa Williams

showerReviews.reviewText:
Heading to the gym can prove quite a frustrating ordeal for some, what with concerns like overcrowding and the perpetual hunt for available weights. Moreover, the cold shower appears to be out of order more often than not, a disheartening setback after a rigorous workout. And if that's not enough to test one's patience, securing a parking spot in the cramped car park can pose quite the challenge. Nevertheless, despite these inconveniences, countless gym-goers persevere and steadfastly uphold their dedication to health and fitness goals.
Add: access problem , app does not always work , dirty changing rooms locked in the morning .
showerReviews.author: Wojciech Dec

locations.title: JD Gyms Mansfield
locations.address: ÓÉàOld Mill Ln, Mansfield Woodhouse, Mansfield NG19 9BG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been going to JD in Mansfield since they took over the building and was a member of the previous gym for a few years too.
I like the app qr code log in for easy access, although since it's gone 24hr the metal gates make going in with yoga mat and gym bag a bit awkward.
There is a good range of equipment and it is maintained, although a lot of the same machines seem to be out of action regularly waiting to be fixed.
Id say cleanliness can be a bit of an issue. The disinfectant spray and wipes were removed about a year ago so you have to settle for sweaty and sticky equipment if you don't take your own wipes. The weekday cleaning lady with dark hair and glasses is really lovely and does an amazing job, the locker rooms (I can only vouch for the ladies) really suffer when she is not in.
The ladies gym area is such a good feature. It allows you to have access to equipment in a safe space which usually is never available in the main gym.
I avoid going to the gym after 4pm as it is over run with groups people who crowd machines, even if not using them and never seem to get moved on.
Sometimes trying to find a staff member can be an impossible task.
The classes are good, although they were cut back last year so it makes it hard to attend the ones I want to around work. The best class is run by Tiff which is the yoga. I've been going to her class for 4 years now and it really has changed my life from giving me coping mechanisms to deal with unwanted thoughts to strengthening my body.
Overall it's a good gym and it's convenient to where I live.
showerReviews.author: Alternative Grape

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym is massive! Two floors filled to the brim with equipment. They have absolutely everything you need.

Additionally, there are saunas in the changing rooms. It's a bit of a shame, though, that there aren't any mixed-sex saunas where men and women can chill out together.

In the afternoons, it‚Äôs fine, but it can get quite crowded during peak hours.

The good membership price and the fact that the place is open 24/7 are huge pluses - you can work out any time of day or night.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been training at JD Gym Peterborough for a while now and honestly, it‚Äôs one of the best gyms I‚Äôve been a member of. The equipment is modern, well maintained.

What really makes the difference, though, is the staff. Everyone is friendly, approachable, and genuinely supportive. A special mention goes to Dmitrijs, one of the personal trainers ‚Äî very professional, knowledgeable, and motivating. You can tell he truly cares about helping people improve, whether it‚Äôs strength, confidence, or overall fitness. His advice and approach made a big difference to my training.

The overall vibe of the gym is positive and welcoming ‚Äî no ego, no pressure, just people focused on getting better. Clean facilities, great energy, and good value for money.

showerReviews.reviewText: Where do you start! The food is normally very good! Most of the staff are very friendly with a smile, thank you Chrissy! The parking guy's are exceptionally friendly and good in the aspect of when you are leaving! üëåüëè. During the warmer weather this place is swarming with flies im sorry I don't want to be throwing my hands around like a sign language person for the deaf while I'm eating.  As for the facilities showers & toilets my god they could do with bleach or acid soaking in them for a month. Out of hour toilets wow, one toilet doest & hasn't had a seat on it for 12 months which is disgusting & two months ago the other & only two out of hours toilets the door was on the floor. Lincoln farm, yes you are always busy but please show some respect to your faithful customers & put some money back in for the sake of your customers. I know drivers who say the place is disgusting & like a hovel and won't return. Sorry for the truth but it's reality.

showerReviews.reviewText: It's got a huge truck park so plenty of space, food isn't too bad, toilets and shower work pretty well but are very dated. Overall it's pretty good just dated.

showerReviews.reviewText: Having read some other reviews, I guess I just expect too much! It was like going back to what I imagine trucking was like in the 1970's. Deep fried poor quality sausage! Not seen since Glasgow 1994. Parking was ok, large yard, well organised if you don't get boxed in, the toilets and shower were like Cub Camp 1978. If you have a less than clean toilet area at least invest 30p in each cubicle so there is a hook to keep stuff off the floor - 2 stars. Restaurant - 0 stars. When you have a lorry park, rammed for the evening @ ¬£24 each, surely a quality breakfast is a possibility - filter coffee or espresso? Just because there is a lot on the plate doesn't make it good. Very few in for breakfast, it would be busier if the breakfast was better.  I sometimes wish that the owners of these places would take a trip to mainland Europe to see what a truckers restaurant is supposed to be like in this day and age. I try to support smaller establishments rather than give money to Moto etc but please help make our job a little more comfortable when away from family home for the week!  Thanks
showerReviews.author: P Barnes

locations.title: A1 Truck Stop
locations.address: ÓÉàBourne Road, Colsterworth, Grantham NG33 5JN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Arrived tired and grumpy after a near 15 hr day.
Went and booked in on snap, got my shower and ¬£4 meal token and had a cold pint of Carl‚Äôs berg. Just what I needed!
Went and had my shower and got changed into fresh clothing. Made me feel like a new pin!
I believe 10 minutes is timed on your shower card, which is plenty if you get on with it.
Very clean and just right temp for this old git!
Food was fresh and cooked to order, with very healthy proportions after a long day, by staff who were engaging and helpful. If it‚Äôs the only meal of your day, you‚Äôll be delighted.
Car park was full but very quiet. Although my first time here, I never heard a single fridge.
All in all a superb place for a nice shower, decent tap beer, superb fresh cooked food and a peaceful nights sleep. I now have it saved to my sat nav for next time my wandering bring me this way.
showerReviews.author: Gary J

showerReviews.reviewText:
Food is spot on as it always has been every time I've visited, lovely lady in the cafe is always willing to accommodate, even when I'm running in late with 2 minutes left on my clock!
Cafe open till 9, last orders at 8:30pm.
24hr person in the cabin, always a cheery welcome, you get what you give in terms of friendliness!
Showers are hot, need to ask for the key.
Toilets are alright, make sure you cough or something if you're taking a dump or someone will turn the light off! üòÇ

Train runs past every hour but only the one for a minute or so, could do with tarmac road as is gravel/ mud currently and winter/ wet months gets messy.
Otherwise a good place to stop in my opinion and will return!
showerReviews.author: Ben Lewis

locations.title: Time For You Domestic Cleaning Lincoln
locations.address: ÓÉàCromwell House, Crusader Rd, Lincoln LN6 7YT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Time for You Lincolnshire supplied me with an excellent cleaner called Elena, a lovely person from Romania. She is punctual, friendly co-operative and incredibly hard working, always willing to do anything I ask of her. I also booked her separately for a couple of hours to deep clean my wet room, the floor of which was badly stained by standing, very hard water. She did this task superbly. So I have no issues with my cleaner,  only genuine praise.  My only gripe is that I expected the company to contact me after a few weeks to check everything was OK etc. This didn't happen although when I contacted the company their representative did at that time ask how things were going.
showerReviews.author: Tony Fielding-Raby

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is the best holiday Inn Ive been booked for a 1 or 2 days stay. We stayed at room 603. The room is super clean. The beddings linen is a super high quality. Fresh and clean towels. tap sink washed and polished, glass door bathroom super shine and clean.  water shower is perfect. soap and shampoo is provided with all time favourite brand since 1980.

Manager Robin was exceptional telling us all info we need to know for breakfast, parking etc. Housekeepers thank you. Without you... Hotel is not a  hotel.
The location is exceptional.

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed in many Holiday Inn hotels. This one is standard on first appearance however the room I had was facing a huge busy network of roads, the traffic was so loud and meant I had a disturbed sleep. The bed was tiny for a double,  lumpy and uncomfortable which also contributed to a poor night's sleep. The worst of all was the sink in my room 304, It stunk of sewage. I should imagine it was because the drains needed cleaning, but it put me off using the sink, especially brushing my teeth felt like a risk. The shower head was also grimy and orange, I  felt grubby using it and showered again when I got home. All in all not worth staying again as these things should be kept clean as a minimum standard. I did tell the staff on check out, they just said, 'Thanks for letting me know' Once they've got your money they don't really care I suppose!
showerReviews.author: Sarah Chadwick

showerReviews.reviewText:
Reviews for this place, on Google Maps and TripAdvisor seem amazing, however my experience didn't live up to the expectation.

Firstly checking in was bizarre. Pressed bell. After a few moments other guests came to the door and let us in. We collected room key from table. All very strange. Owner no where to be spotted.

I stayed in room 6, a small twin room for one night. One of the beds was particularly noisy, and had a headboard which wasn't attached properly to the bed. Bathroom was cheap, especially the toilet seat. Shower was nothing special.

Breakfast again was nothing special. Full English was presented on massive plate, but there was not that much of it. Bacon was overdone, wasn't provided with toast, and was never offered a second mug of tea.

Not a terrible place, just nothing special. Possibly I was just unlucky.

Would look elsewhere on a future trip to Lincoln
showerReviews.author: Keith Spink

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very nice little place to stay, but could be noisy with other groups.
Accessibility is okay, there is a step free shower with a seat, accessible toilet and ramped entrance.  However, some people will find the sleeping areas inaccessible due to lay out and bunk beds. The beds are definitely designed for the young and / or fully mobile, but are pretty comfortable.  The doors to the dorm rooms are sliding ones to make the most of space. The partitions between rooms though doesn't fully extend to the ceiling, so could be an issue for light sleepers. Ear plugs recommended because of this
Other than the slightly difficult bed access it was a brilliant place to stay for 2 nights
showerReviews.author: Rebecca Sullivan

locations.title: Hayes Wharf - iQ Student Accommodation Lincoln
locations.address: ÓÉàHolmes Rd, Lincoln LN1 1RF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Hayes Wharf is one of the nearest accommodation sites to Lincoln University, with the exception of the University-run sites and possibly The Junxion (Mezzino). Located on Carholme Road, marginally within the West End region of Lincoln, its surroundings bear less of the urban intensity as that of other sites, but essential facilities are conveniently accessible (including a small Sainsbury's and the West End Tap, a micropub located one street to the North). A particularly attractive local feature is the immediately accessible Fossdyke footpath, running along the Roman canal and towards the cycle route 64.
Being in its 14th year of existence, I was expecting the building to be riddled with battle scars inflicted by the carefree habitation of rowdy students. However, it is remarkably well-maintained and the interior was largely refurbished in 2018, providing a new kitchen and re-decorated bedrooms. Whilst the site's design and execution lacks some of the elegance and simplicity as at Cygnet Wharf (my 1st year accommodation), its appearance actually looks quite respectable today... something which cannot be said for the related Pavilions site of the same age: a severe collection of monolithic, steel-framed blocks, snaking ominously across the South of Lincoln.
The site is very secure, requiring an electric key fob to enter the site, and again to enter your own block, and then a key for the flat and bedroom.
The bedrooms wildly vary in size and layout, depending on the specification chosen and the part of the site it happens to be. My room (Silver en-suite) is exceptionally spacious and has a view of upper Lincoln and the Cathedral (don't get too excited, some rooms will have a view of a wall). In the room, there is actually too much storage to completely fill, which is only a good thing, and the sliding storage crates under the bed are particularly useful. The desk chair provided is not an adjustable office chair, but is just about comfortable enough, despite using hard plastic. The deskspace is very generous, 60cm deep and extending the full width of the room (2.7m in my case). A large slot has been cut out of part of the desk, under which is the electric radiator, to stop the desk surface from overheating and being destroyed. The radiator operates on a maximum 2 hour timer, and seems quite capable for the room size.
A major rearrangement of the bed and surrounding furniture was required to make the bedside light switches actually be beside the bed. There is also an additional LED spotlight above the bed which is useful for reading, although the light is very bright and cold white in tone (made suitable for night use by taping an orange Quality Street wrapper over it). The bathroom is the usual arrangement, but the shaving light and power source above the mirror is a useful addition. Once the inevitable teething troubles of blocked shower drains are addressed, you will find that the showers work well enough. The electric shower unit is quite underpowered, but should be adequate for those who have not been spoiled with mixer showers like myself.
The kitchen works quite well for five people, each person has two large cupboards, one drawer, and a shelf in the fridge and freezer. This leaves one remainder cupboard, an under-sink cupboard and an excessively sized cleaning cupboard that is larger than the fridge: the exclusive home of a mop. In addition to the single ***INDUCTION*** cooker/oven and sink, is a kettle, a microwave oven, and two rubbish bins. There is no toaster included, nor a vacuum cleaner. The lounge features a modern television, with 'smart' features.

Inevitably, there will be problems which need fixing by the maintenance team, and so far they have been extremely helpful and efficient. The staff overall have been excellent - incredibly friendly and keen to make personal conversation. My first month here has proven that Hayes Wharf is a very comfortable place to live, and that its non-University ownership has no negative effect on quality.
showerReviews.author: Oliver Mills

locations.title: Pine Mill | Student Accommodation Lincoln
locations.address: ÓÉàBeevor St, Lincoln LN6 7DJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was slightly apprehensive when I first booked a room at Pine Mill.
However that soon disappeared after I was met by Gabrial and shown my room.
A shared block of single rooms with on suite shower,
bed with bedding supplied, desk, chairs and clothes closet.
On the ground floor there is a communal kitchen and washing machine. On site parking for an extra charge.
It's a good location fairly central and next door to Morrisons.
It's a good atmosphere as everyone I have met has been friendly and helpful. It's a secure gated compound with electronic key access. No problem with personal security.
Incredible value for money.
I highly recommend.

Adam Davison
showerReviews.author: Adam Davison
