showerReviews.reviewText: Arrived today, 1st July 2024, for a 4 night stay, and got to say we're impressed. Weather not good (yet) but Lincoln can't be blamed for that ! Site is part of a county park so lots of good walks to be had, plus bus route just a short walk away for visits to historic Lincoln, which is well worth a visit for either history or the shops (used to live only 10 miles away so regular visitor). But back to the site .... it's well laid out, with booking online and coded security gates for access. Pitches have hook up, and some are hard standing, and some are dedicated for disabled use. The toilets and showers are separate for men and woman, and each has 2 toilets and 2 showers with lashings of hot water. There is a separate wash room with 4 sinks and again it's immaculatey clean. Tv reception is good as is mobile signal with THREE/Smarty for streaming etc. Looking forward to the next 4 days.
showerReviews.author: glyn moore (ytgvmtv)

showerReviews.reviewText: Just got back from a three night stay on the grass pitches and we had a lovely time. The pitches are nice and large so we had plenty of space to pitch our tent and have an area to put our windbreakers up on the side. The toilets and showers were kept nice and clean as well as the kitchen area. The site is nice and quiet bar the donkeys and chickens! but we loved having the animals there. The staff were great and can be found when needed. The fishing was good but didn‚Äôt seem to see any fish larger than 12/13lb. You are also locked in as the site has a locked gate which code changes regularly to give you piece of mind. The kitchen area has a washing machine, a tumble dryer, a microwave and a kettle which was a pleasant surprise. There are also a selection of local attraction and takeaway leaflets to read. At the back of the lake there is a field which we let the dog have a run on although it is not fully enclosed it certainly was more than enough. We will definitely be visiting again.
showerReviews.author: Amelia Turnbull

Spent the most perfect 3 nights here and it was everything I hoped it would be.

Showers and toilets were immaculate, the whole site was clean and tidy.
The site is set on beautiful surroundings and I spent hours walking in the woods, and sitting by the lake while my partner fished.

The warden and all staff we met were friendly and welcoming and honestly couldn't do enough for us.

We had the quiet, peaceful, relaxing holiday we hoped for 100% we will be back again soon!

locations.address: ÓÉàPillar Box Farm, 9 Main St, Kirkby Green, Lincoln LN4 3PE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic Cs.. A lovely welcome awaited us.On arrival the owners had left us an easter egg, card and plant, what a great first impression. Easy access,with signs at the end of the drive way. Large open site with 6 all weather pitches and also a camp field. Electric and water supply to each pitch. Amenities block with a toilet/shower room including wash basin. Also a pot wash room and recycling bins,also a chemical waste point.The site also has another toilet/shower room a little further away at the end of the main house. Great location for visiting Lincolnshire and the coast is an hours drive away.We really enjoyed our holiday at this clean, well looked after site.
showerReviews.author: Mark Preston

showerReviews.reviewText: This has got to be the best Certificated Site we have been to with our caravan the 6 hard standing pitches have electric and mains water it has Two showers and Two toilets in Two separate buildings with one having a dish washing and an elsen point in the closest One to the pitches and the grassed area you have to be careful when you reach the site the entrance is easy to go past, but the entrance is nice and wide with plenty of room to turn in, the camping area is at the end of the drive One of the shower / toilet room's is on the left just as you reach the pitches, the other One is on your right / left opposite the new chalets they are building you will see some building material as work is still on going, all the facilities are spotless and modern plus the showers are free to use, there are plenty of places too visit such as Lincoln, Sleaford the R A F also have plenty to look at in the area on the ground and in the air the Battel of Britain Memorial flight the Red Arrows and a lot more plus the seaside is just an Hour away, the couple who own and run the site Tony and Ang are Two of the nicest people you could wish to meet they even gave us a present on our arrival.  Thank you very much we will definitely be back.  Mick and Sandra from Stoke-on-Trent.
showerReviews.author: Michael Harding

showerReviews.reviewText: I first visited The paddock when my Nephew got married in the area and The Paddock had not then become a Camping and Caravanning Club Certified site. It's owners were very helpful and told me all about their plans for the site. It was easy to find and access was good. Water was available although at that time electric hookup wasn't. Since then they have done a lot of work improving the site putting in five individual hard standing bays and gravel road access to them along with ten grass pitches for tents. Electric hookup and a water point is available individually for all hard standing pitches and two bollards with four hookups for the tents. A toilet is available and showers are coming shortly. The owners enthusiasm will make sure this happens soon. A recommended site.
showerReviews.author: Gerard Harris

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed on this site for 9 weeks: we had sold our house and were buying another nearby, so it was convenient.
The site is large with flat pitches, all have water and elec hook up. But there‚Äôs no dividing hedges, so no privacy.
The hardstandings are actually ash with a fine covering of gravel, which eventually gets moved about and the ash ends up inside your awning or caravan/motorhome.
When they cut the grass they don‚Äôt pick up the cuttings. So if you step on the grass, the cuttings end up with the ash inside your awning or caravan/motorhome.
If you want to stay on a building site, fine. Otherwise go elsewhere. The view is a mixture of metal storage containers, vehicles, farm machinery, stacks of Thermalite blocks, bricks, paving slabs, plastic pipe, oil drums, old wooden pallets, building equipment, sand, gravel and rubble.
The shower block is a shower room. It‚Äôs very nice, but, with one shower, one toilet and one wash hand basin. The hot water on the basin is hardly more than a drip. Apparently, the site is licensed for 7 caravans/motorhomes and 10 tents ‚Äì for ONE SHOWER and ONE TOILET?
The toilet seat doesn‚Äôt fit, it wobbles about. There‚Äôs no toilet roll holder, so the loo rolls sit on top of the cistern, which is continually wet with condensation ‚Äì so the loo rolls are wet too.
There is a pot washing room, which we did use. But, personally I‚Äôd rather have a washing machine and drier. Beware if you are washing dishes and someone uses the chemical disposal point; your water will run cold until they are finished.
The owners are a couple of storytellers. First you will be told that the Wi-Fi is hardwired to each pitch (eh?).  Then they will say that the heating in the shower room comes on for 2 hours, morning and evening every day. Rubbish! I showered at least 45 times on this site and the heating was never on, even when it snowed!! I did complain and was told that Tony would sort it, he didn‚Äôt.  And they say that there‚Äôs a pumping station under the shower block, sorry ‚Äúroom‚Äù, which is capable of sending text messages, amazing.
There is no designated dog walk, despite what it says on their site. You will be directed out of the site onto the main road of the village and told to follow the public footpaths.
The first time I spoke to Tony he told me that I came from the rough end of town ‚Äì twice. Then he insulted me about the time I had spent living in France. Then he became an expert in war games, telling me that as we were surrounded by Airfields, if Putin decided to invade (???) we wouldn‚Äôt stand a chance. I had planned to avoided him after that, but I didn‚Äôt have to; he ignored me completely. He could pass within 2 feet of me and just stare at the ground. Absolutely no hosting skills whatsoever.
There‚Äôs a five bar gate across the entrance which is closed whenever the Grandchildren are on site, which seemed to be pretty often. You can open the gate if you happen to be a 17 stone rugby player. If, like me, you are an 8 stone woman, you won‚Äôt be able to budge it without pulling a muscle ‚Äì which I did. It‚Äôs total overkill for a 2 and 4 year old, especially considering there‚Äôs a pedestrian gate feet away with a simple gate latch.
If you do manage to get through the gate, more often than not, your access will be blocked by a tradesman‚Äôs vehicle. The owners were renovating some outbuildings into holiday cottages, and this seems to be the priority for the owners. They don‚Äôt seem bothered about anyone on the campsite, or the mess they have to stay in.
No one came to offer help when our awning collapsed under the weight of snow, or when high winds almost ripped it off altogether. They didn‚Äôt even notice.
As a CL site they are not permitted to have anyone stay for more than 14 days. Nonetheless, they were very happy to take our cash for 9 weeks, until someone complained that we'd been there so long. We were given 2 days notice to leave.
showerReviews.author: Doreen Joyner

locations.title: Willow Holt Caravan and Camping Park
locations.address: ÓÉàLodge Rd, Tattershall, Lincoln LN4 4JS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Whilst busy with rows of static caravans, the large holiday park had a good area set aside for motorhomes like us. We had a hardstanding pitch with a view of the lakes, near the excellent new facilities (hotel quality), a water tap and bins. The popular bar/pizzas/games room opened at weekends. Overall the site was very well managed, the friendly staff clearing the lakes of weed with a special aquatic vehicle and also keeping the grass clear of the droppings from the numerous grazing Canada Geese. There was even a good accessory shop at Reception.

A bonus for us, and a good reason for being there, were the two largely off-road bike rides available from near the site. A return journey to Lincoln of some 45 miles was largely on NCR1, the Water Rail Trail, a former railway line paved for cycling. In the opposite direction, just under 20 miles each way took us to Boston, where we turned back at the famous Stump after enjoying coffee and cakes at the Boston Lock Caf√©.

On a third day, a short walk took us round the lakes, meeting 2 swans with 5 young and passing an impressive children‚Äôs play park. One lake was for fishing, while the other offered safe row-boating and swimming.
showerReviews.author: Barry Williamson

showerReviews.reviewText:
A lovely little lakeside caravan/ camping site. We stayed at Willowholt for 2 nights with family, and we enjoyed our stay.
The tiolets and shower blocks are brand new and are definitely a bonus to the upcoming site.
I believe the site is upgrading the site in areas as the entrance has a lot of diggers, etc, and the new bulit tiolet block is the only thing that is relatively new. The washing up area could do with a little upgrading.
The boathouse is a nice touch to the site. Unfortunately, the night we were planning to use it, the staff put a sign out to say bar only so we didn't get to try the food.
Maybe next time.

If your camping with young kids be asked to be put near the park as it was a bonus for us.
The park is massive, and our children made friends with others and used the park the whole time we were there. Great addition to the site.
The pitch area was fine, big enough, and pitched next to the family, which we requested.
Beautiful views over the lake.

Take earplugs, the geese that live on the site fly over and make a racket at 4am.

I've given 4 stars for service as when we arrived the lady who served me was a little moody and said if we didn't leave by 11 am the next day they won't be returning the ¬£10 they take for the gate fob to get in and out the camp site.
We, of course, are always aware of a checkout time, and 11am is a good time for checkout, but the way it came across wasn't very friendly. Even if it was 11.05am, we wouldn't be getting our money back. I feel sorry for anyone who gets there just a few minutes late (as of course that can happen) with a car full of kids. Things are unpredictable.

Overall, a good stay and make sure you take a trip into Woodhall spa to the bakery delicatessen absolutely 5 star cakes, baps, chocolates our highlight of the trip.
showerReviews.author: Katy Rhead

locations.address: ÓÉà57 Sleaford Rd, Tattershall, Lincoln LN4 4JG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
0/10 ‚Äì Extremely Disappointing Experience
We paid ¬£150 just for entrance for 3 nights, simply to be able to access the bar and restaurant, which makes absolutely no sense. I have never understood why guests should have to pay just to enter facilities like these.
The food and drinks are extremely overpriced ‚Äî over ¬£6 for a pint of beer and more than ¬£7 for a small portion of dirty fries.
The rooms were very dirty and had a strong unpleasant smell. There were bugs in the room, and we couldn‚Äôt sleep properly because of this.
The website states that towels are included, but there were no towels provided at all. On the last night the gas ran out, so there was no heating, and my children were freezing.
We stayed 5 nights, yet we never managed to use the swimming pool even once because it was always fully booked ‚Äî despite the fact that we had paid for access.
Overall, this was a very poor experience. I do not recommend this place to anyone, and I will never return.
showerReviews.author: A Omed

locations.title: Glentham Grange
locations.address: ÓÉàGlentham Grange, Cross Ln, Glentham, Market Rasen LN8 2AH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This caravan site is a  real 5 star site.
The toilets and showers are the best I have used on caravan sites,  well maintained,  beautifully clean. It  a  very quiet place.
There is a well stocked and fantastic bar, ,"The Glentham Duck",
The whole site is well maintained and manicure, it's a real credit to Dave and Debbie investment.  They a very friendly and welcoming.
The pitch is pebbled, very spacious, with hookup for electric and water in a brilliant housed.
We used this for beginning season run out weekend,  but next time I will want to spend more time enjoying the site,  yes we will visit it again
showerReviews.author: Dave Dent

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a fantastic site, the owners know exactly what caravan and motorhome want and need, they have the best and very high quality fittings and fixtures throughout the site, the showers are first class and so clean, as are the toilets. There is a bar on site which again is really nice and is well stocked.
The site has a lake which is stocked with fish for use by anyone who stays there, just sitting looking at the lake with all the wildlife about is so relaxing.
We stayed for 3 days and will without doubt be going back again, you are made so welcoming, this is a first class site and in 20 years of caravanning this is by far the best I have been on.
I cann't recommended this site enough, just book it and go you will not be dissappointed.
showerReviews.author: Mal Appleby

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a gem of a site this one is !!!
Our first time here . The toilets/showers are the best we‚Äôve seen . Spotlessly clean , and very modern .
The bar is fabulous and we were made to feel really welcome by the owners and regulars . A beautiful onsite shop , a fishing lake , and peace and quiet in abundance , what more could you want . The pitches are huge ( we have an 8 metre van ) and easy to drive your van onto to overlook the lake .
It definitely won‚Äôt be long before we are back here .
Many thanks for making us feel so welcome .
5* all the way for me .
Joanna xx

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our experience at Glentham Grange was nothing short of awesome. From our first trip out last September to our latest trip this weekend we have been warmly welcomed by Debs and Dave into the serene, calming atmosphere of their wonderful site.

Each time we have been here we have never felt so relaxed and rejuvenated.  The place is so quiet and the surroundings are spectacular.

When we are there we are at one with Nature and would gladly just sit outside all the time with a glass of Vino just to look at the wonderful wildlife and views surrounding Glentham Grange.

The site down to the small shop and wash shower facilities are just luxurious and to top of an evening there is always the Duck Inn where you can listen to the legend Dave singing.

It is truly a spectacular place and we cannot wait to go back again soon
showerReviews.author: Martin Young

locations.title: The Fairways
locations.address: ÓÉàTattershall, Lincoln LN4 4LR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed in a superior caravan, nothing superior about it. Seating area very uncomfortable, seats reminded me of the vans we used to stay in 20 years ago... like sitting on a park bench. Tv channels very limited and settings were set as. Only good thing it was anti glare screen and a decent size.
Carpets were stained, blinds were dirty, curtains were stained. Cobwebs in living area and bathroom. Shower needed attention, 2 heat settings, very hot and very very hot. Shower head had a split so water sprayed up the ceiling. Not enough bedroom storage for an 8 berth. No socket by the bed in double room.
Curtains kept coming off the rail if the window was open.
Overall if you want a relaxing break or peace, this isn't the place. Way too busy, and parking on arrival before check in is horrendous.
showerReviews.author: Kazzy G (Cazzy)

locations.title: The Hideaway By Liv Retreats
locations.address: ÓÉàDunston Fen Ln, Southrey, Lincoln LN4 3AP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Enjoyable 3 night stay for myself and 13 year old daughter and dog! In the middle of nowhere but that wasn‚Äôt an issue for us. We enjoyed the quiet and the countryside and the nature surrounding it. The road to the place is not that bad at all just don‚Äôt do the 60 mph speed limit. There are pheasants lining the road and we even saw a deer. Accommodation was spot on. Clean, welcoming and warm. Table was set when we arrived and the heating was on. Modern kitchen with dishwasher and washing machine. Tv in each bedroom and one in dining area. Signal could be hit and miss but you‚Äôre in the middle of nowhere, embrace it!  Lovely little walk by the river which the dog enjoyed being off lead. Nice to see the barges too. It‚Äôs definitely a place to get away from it all, hot tub was a bonus. We had an issue with the tub one night but as soon as I reported it Gary was straight out to sort it. No issues.
showerReviews.author: Sally Pickford

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very long lane approach to the site and drivers need to take it slow or face losing a bumper!! Lovely lodge very modern clean and well equipped on initial inspection very happy with things.   The mattresses were not very comfortable you could feel the springs. we went for a relaxing mini break and hoped to be able to walk to nearby villages and walk along the riverbank. We discovered the site  pub was closed so we had to seek pubs where we could eat.  The site manager did offer to open the pub for us for a drink but we had out own drinks it was food we needed. As  we had our little dog with us we checked if dogs were allowed  in the local pubs and we found only one pub in the vicinity that served food and allowed dogs. Many of the pubs were closed down or didnt serve food.
We had a fab day out in Lincoln which we loved so beautiful and lots to see especially the Cathedral and the Castle. Didnt enjoy Boston so much it was quite run down although St Botulphs was beautiful and the people in there very nice and helpful and let us take our fur baby in.
There is a gym on site but we didnt use it. Not much else to do so dont imagine its great for kids.
Unable to find anywhere to eat on our last night i resorted to shopping and cooking which isnt usually part of our plans on our annual mini breaks.
We enjoyed the hot tub which was lovely and warm and very clean. We had a slight issue with a dripping tap in the kitchen which flooded part of the kitchen, however a lovely member of staff came to our rescue and got us dried out.
Just a few slight changes could have scored the site higher.
+ a bedside light in the single room would have made reading in bed much nicer.
+ No mattress or Pillow protectors when we stripped the beds with quite unpleasantly stained mattress and pillow
+ some hooks in the bathroom to hang your clothes while you shower
+ tidy up around the back of the lodges
On a positive note there are plenty of plug sockets, TVs, places to relax inside and out. Gary the manager was very cheerful and did offer us some info.  A big plus is its very very peaceful.
showerReviews.author: linda treitl

locations.title: Skybears Holidays
locations.address: ÓÉàSpridlington Rd, Faldingworth, Market Rasen LN8 3SQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: This place is amazing the minute I walked through the door in my Lodge I felt like I was in a completely different place, solid wood everywhere but with the modern finer things, log burner in the centre off the massive open planned space, traditional yet modern kitchen with everything you could possibly need, such a warm a cosy environment also with that elegant feeling. The outdoor areas are amazing one of which is a canopied outdoor luxury seating area with a bbq beyond what I've ever seen, wine cooler, fridge and 2 fire pits. The bathroom and showers are a little walk down from where you are but 3 toilets and 2 showers plenty of towels and not your typical cheap shampoo and shower gel. I work away allot and unfortunately I was herw by myself and working nights so didn't have chance to explore everything this place has to offer but I'll definitely be coming back with my family and friends
showerReviews.author: Owen Simmons
